The cards with negative values also have a special power (e.g., move the captain from one ship tile to another). If the cards hit the value of the ships tile, it sinks; otherwise the ship tile sinks when five cards are on each side, and whoever has more points on their side wins this tile.

Each ship tile, the captain, and the first mate are all worth 1 VP, and a game is won as soon as a player has scored three points.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
180341.description:
Smugglers Guild settled in the heart of the giant sea creatures cemetery, in the darkest depths of the Deep kingdom. In this disconcerting necropolis, with the help of mysterious Krakkens, representatives of Guilds are trading NEBULISES. Nebulises, wonderful black pearls, are the unofficial currency of the realm. That's money stained with blood. They accelerate your way to power, but be careful, because those who are caught on their possession awaits a terrible fate!

Abyss: Kraken is the first expansion for Abyss.

When playing with the Kraken expansion, base game rules doesn't change, although new elements are added:

7 New Allies cards
18 New Lord cards
3 Sentinel tokens
6 New location tiles
25 Loot cards
25 Black pearls (the Nebulis)
1 Kraken figure
1 transparent cup
1 Rulebook
180341.name: Abyss: Kraken
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Ep. 86 - Our Second Birthday!
The Game Pit: Episode 64 - Automobiles and more….

180342.name: Peril at the Pod Auction
180342.description:
From publisher blurb:

A White Star Mini-Adventure
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 1-3

There’s a fortune to be made bidding “sight unseen” on the contents of recovered cargo pods at the Jaroo Pod Auction. Of course some pods are better off left sealed. And still others are better off left drifting in space...

Peril at the Pod Auction is part of a series of mini-adventures designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side missions or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

This adventure is part of our Astro Adventures series, a new line of products created with ‘old school’ gaming in mind. If you like this adventure watch for other Astro Adventures mini-adventure coming soon.

180343.name: A Shackled Mind Is a Clear Mind
180343.description:
From publisher blurb:

This book contains ten tome of lore for the Tyrants of Saggakar setting. These books make great rewards or treasure for players. Some are spellbooks, some are religious, some are travelogues.

It is so much better to receive a copy of a book that has a history than "a nice book worth 5,000gp"

A great resource for the Tyrants of Saggakar, or your own Pathfinder Campaign.

180344.name: Forgotten Oni
180344.description:
From publisher blurb:

Strange and Exotic Oni

Introduced in the Pathfinder Bestiary 3, oni are a race of evil outsiders inspired by eastern mythology. In Pathfinder, each oni is associated with a particular race of humanoid creature, and many of them are based on giants. By now, a wide variety of humanoid races have had oni made in their image, each oni using the original race as a starting point and expanding or building upon it to create a new and exciting foe, but there are still some humanoid races that have been left behind and forgotten. This is particularly a shame, because some of the races left behind are those that could make the most interesting oni.

This book contains three new oni: the shikoru (CR 10), based on the cyclops, the tororu (CR 10), patterned after the troll, and the waste yai (CR 16), made in the image of the ash giant. The shikoru can fire beams of energy from its single massive eye to burn its foes to a crisp, and can twist and distort fate, turning a roll into the opposite of what it actually was. The tororu, by contrast, can rend foes asunder with its deadly frenzied strike, and in times of dire need, can call upon its regeneration burst to increase its healing power immensely for a short time. Finally, the waste yai spreads a particularly virulent and deadly disease that causes its victims to rise as zombies, can control vermin, and has a nasty debilitating gut strike.

Whether you want to round out your cast of oni for an oriental-themed campaign, or are just looking for new and exciting takes on some classic giants, you'll find what you're looking for in these unusual oni.

180345.description:
The events of Zena 1814 take place during the eight months in which Genoa was an independent city, following the end of Napoleonic domination and lasting until the Restoration of the Congress of Vienna. As the city's great families did in reality, you must cooperate with your rivals to reap the rewards of shared commercial ventures and the prestige of successful military victories. But your ultimate goal is to surpass all the others in the race for prestige! Zena 1814 is a game in which cooperation and competition always go hand in hand — but in the end there can be only one winner!

The focus point is that is possible to place influence cubes on cards, including the ones played by opponents. This causes a very strong interaction among players and plenty of choices.

In each round, players can move their pawns through the game areas and play cards from their hand belonging to areas where they have at least a pawn. On each card are spaces that allow others to influence it; the player who played it must influence it, while the others can decide whether to do it or not to obtain the effect of the card. Each time a player chooses to influence a card played by another, this one gains a smaller one-time bonus. This participation aspect reflects what really happened among historically families in those years...
180345.name: Zena 1814
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Post Scriptum

180346.name: Cloaks and Shadows
180346.description:
From the Front Cover:

The Cloaks of Mulmaster have taken an interest in your progress, and may be looking to sponsor adventurers for future work. You've been offered an interview with one of their ranking members at the Theater of the Stars, but you never know what to expect in the City of Danger. A four-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Cloaks and Shadows, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 3rd-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. A player with an ineligible character can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms, in the city of Mulmaster.

180347.name: Oubliette of Fort Iron
180347.description:
From the Front Cover:

When Fort Iron was taken from the duergar who inhabited it, much of their subterranean quarters were never fully explored. An ancient oubliette has been discovered and its contents have disturbed the miners. Can the mine and the miners be saved from the dangers of the Oubliette of Fort Iron? A two-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Oubliette of Fort Iron, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 3rd-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. A player with an ineligible character can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms, in the city of Mulmaster.

180348.name: Dark Rites at Fort Dalton
180348.description:
From the Front Cover:

Fort Dalton along the River Lis was long ago destroyed. Now rumors tell of foul cults practicing their dark rites within the fort's ruins. Are the rumors of elemental cults true or are the rumors a cover for some other sinister plot? A two-hour adventure for 1st-4th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to Dark Rites at Fort Dalton, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 1st-4th level characters, and is optimized for five 3rd-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure. A player with an ineligible character can create a new 1st-level character or use a pregenerated character.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms, in and around the city of Mulmaster and the Flooded Forest to the south of the city.

180349.name: The Howling Void
180349.description:
From the Front Cover:

A storm of unparalleled fury has been ravaging the peaks of the Earthspur Mountains for a tenday, and the Monastery of the Yellow Rose sits in its eye for now. Some monks have fled the monastery to the safety of Mulmaster and beseech you to convince their more obstinate brothers to retreat to the city before the eye of the storm shifts, and the monastery is in terrible danger. Can you brave the elements and convince the monks to escape? An eight-hour adventure for 5th-10th level characters.

From the Introduction:

Welcome to The Howling Void, a D&D Expeditions adventure, part of the official D&D Adventurers League organized play system and the Elemental Evil storyline season.

This adventure is designed for three to seven 5th-10th level characters, and is optimized for five 8th-level characters. Characters outside this level range cannot participate in this adventure.

The adventure is set in the Moonsea region of the Forgotten Realms. A majority of the adventure takes place in an air elemental node below the Monastery of the Yellow Rose. The Monastery is located in the Earthspur Mountains near Mulmaster.

180351.name: Mutant City Spies
180351.description: [publisher blurb] Ten years after the ghost flu hit, the world is changed — but the secret world stays the same. Enemies of your country still plot, terrorists still scheme — but now they might have superpowers. An espionage-specops frame for Mutant City Blues takes the super fights into the shadows.

180352.name: Walled City of Vandosia
180352.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the seat of power in the Duchy of Starryshade! This large city is where the Archduke Meldor Gantrius IV rules his land. A walled city on the bay, Vandosia is bustling with activity. A busy seaport sits down the road from the fortified city with regional farmers coming into town every day. Many former adventurers call the city home and training guilds are available for those levelling up. While “mostly” safe this city is not without adventure, especially with the massive sewer system below the streets.

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Duchy of Starryshade Campaign. It is useful for any level of adventuring party. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a setting in your campaign!

180353.name: Phillipsburg
180353.description:
From publisher blurb:

The northwest corner of the Duchy of Bast is ruled by Sir Elwin of Monoth the 4th Earl of Kawall. This pudgy ruler sits in his tower in the small city of Phillipsburg which is a hub of the Caravan trade. The town is rather dirty and mostly considered a backwater area for good reasons. This city is a stopping point on the upcoming release of “FQ4 In the Caravan Service” Get a jump on the next adventure by getting used to one of the main settings. Phillipsburg, along with the Barony of the Knolls are point “A” and point “B” in the next adventure!

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a mid-level adventurers and a DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

180354.name: Venture into Sordack Valley
180354.description:
From publisher blurb:

The fifth offering of the Filbar Dual (FD) series is Venture into Sordack Valley and takes the small group of young adventurers and puts them on the border of the frontier. The small town of Commerstance is located on the edge of the Lordek River separating civilization from the wild. Several locales are present for the aspiring group of adventurers including two wanted criminals.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a 2-4 low level adventurers and DM. Primarily designed for two players, the FD series has included the opportunity for NPC assistance. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

180355.description:
Visby is a short, but challenging game. Each player has an identical set of eight cards, each of them with a special effect.

At the beginning of a round, the common supply on the board becomes more attractive by adding seals (victory points) and wares and by improving the ratio to change wares into seals. All players choose one card from their hand simultaneously and place it face down in front of them (two cards in a two- or three-player game). Then the cards are revealed and the effects become active:


Knights and Troops take victory points;
Blacksmith gets wares for each Knight/Troops played by other players;
Ships and Fleets get wares; Tollkeeper gets seals for ships and fleets;
Merchant changes wares into seals;
Monk gets wares for merchants and number of cards already played.


Players with a monk take all cards back to their hand, while others proceed with their remaining cards.

The specific issue is that the more efficient cards become effective only after those which are not that strong. For example, a fleet gets you three wares, but the ship gets you all the remaining ones. If there are ten wares and one opponent played a fleet, you get the seven remaining wares after he has taken three. If three other players play a fleet and take three wares each, you gain only one for your ship. How effective your card is depends on what the other players do — but you cannot be sure of what they'll do because all decisions are made simultaneously. Perhaps, though, you remember which cards the others have already played...

Visby comes in a basic set for two players and can be enlarged with one or two expansion packs that contain material for two additional players each (to the maximum of six players).
180355.name: Visby

180356.name: Red Sun Rising
180356.description:
A complete Lunar mini-campaign set in the Dara Happan city of Serris, a tough independent city which lies in the shadow of the Red Moon.

Contents

Introduction
Heroes of the Red Sun
Mythology and History
The City Of Serris
Cast List
Escorting The Goddess
Gladiators And Sand Castles
Achec's Tomb
Last Seen In Pavis

180357.description:
These five Core Worlds promo cards are part of the Promo Pack A of the Dice Tower Season 11 Kickstarter. There is one card for each of the five Galactic decks.

All cards are suitable to be used with just the base game or with any combination of the Galactic Orders and Revolution expansions. The cards are I - Tower Fanatics (Infantry unit), II - Immolation Squad (Tactics), III - Le'Sav (Planet), IV - Mutabot (Robot unit), V - Tower of Infinite Dice (Prestige).
180357.name: Core Worlds: Dice Tower Season 11 Kickstarter Promo

180358.description:
A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Jovem Nerd, and come from Jovem Nerd's Chronicles of Ruff Ghanor. The survivors include:

Ruff Ghanor
Korin
Johrgrund
The Prior
180358.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Jovem Nerd

180359.name: In the Caravan Service
180359.description:
From publisher blurb:

The quest continues…kind of! After enjoying the accolades of your previous successes in the Barony of the Knolls, your group begins to get that adventuring itch and finds a job opportunity and will allow you to see more of the Duchy of Bast at the same time. The local caravan service is in need of a few hearty individuals that can handle themselves in a fight. A quick trip to Phillipsburg should give you an idea of where you would like to go next right?

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Quest Campaign for a group of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

180360.name: God Eater Resurrection
180360.description:
User Summary

God Eater Resurrection, a new remake of the first God Eater game.the It will have a new “Predator Style” of combat, which allows players better mobility and more devouring options while fighting against the Aragami. There will also be a new story segment that bridges the events of God Eater into God Eater 2.

180361.name: Barony of the Knolls
180361.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Knolls is the second largest city in the Duchy of Bast and a frequent spot for the adventurers going through the Filbar Quest (FQ) series. At over 60 pages this setting can easily appear in any campaign. Welcome to the city that Baron Tamar Wizzel rules and is a safe haven for adventurers of any level.

This adventure setting was designed for 1st/2nd Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for any level adventurer and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

180362.name: Conclave of Evil
180362.description:
From publisher blurb:

Located at the division of land between the Duchy of Starryshade and the famed Horselords is the historic Mystic Wood. Home to the site where the peace treaty was signed between the two countries this area is rumored to have a strange effect on magic. Information has reached the local thane that a gathering, or conclave, of humanoids is to occur this weekend. He has dispatched his military but they are too far to be of use. He has heard of your growing fame and asked your party to investigate this rumor and take appropriate action.

This adventure setting was designed for 5th Edition AD&D for the Filbar Campaign for a party of mid-level adventurers and DM. This adventure is easily adaptable to most any game and system. Save yourself some time and utilize it for a one shot adventure or a continuing campaign!

180363.name: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing III
videogameseries: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing
videogamecompilation: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing: Final Cut
180363.description:
User Summary

The final entry in the trilogy.

180364.name: Vacant Ritual Assembly (Issue 3 - Summer 2015)
180364.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vacant Ritual Assembly is an OSR zine. Directly compatible with Lamentations of the Flame Princess, but easily adaptable to other OSR games.

Issue #3 includes:

Arresting Artwork from Abigail Larson, Anthony Stiller, Marcin Sciolny, Rick Saada, Sean Poppe, and Xolis.
The Legend of Dragon Trench: The woods behind my mom’s house, mythologized and game-ified. Hex map, encounter table, rumors, NPC stats, site descriptions, and more.
Knights of the Dragon Clan: A valorous order of knights and their remote fortress in the woods. Optional rules for Falconry.
The Thundercloud Druids: Guardians of the Crystal Crater. Creators of the thundercaster. Masters of flute magic.
Tales of the Timberwives: Headhunting witches who roam the forest by night.
The Grand Vespiary: A complete adventure detailing the temple of a sinister wasp cult.
Rick's Moving Castle: An interview with Rick Saada, creator of Castle of the Winds.

180365.name: Assimilant Menace!
180365.description:
From publisher blurb:

Assimilant Menace! is the first in a new line of supplements for the White Star roleplaying game from Barrel Rider Games. It expands upon the Assimilants, a race of bad guys found in the White Star core rulebook. The book is compatible not only with White Star, but all d20-based OSR games with a foundation on the world's most popular RPG.

Inside are several new variants on the basic model, new cybernetic implants for the Assimilants or your characters to wear, including fearsome new Rigs. Now you can send three new threatening starships against your players, including two variant fighters and a cruiser.

Not everyone's bad, and this book presents two new classes for PCs that have been liberated from the Swarm. The Free Servitor gains cybernetic enhancements and can help coordinate his allies. The Free Node Brain links symbiotically o a starship to greatly enhance its capabilities.

This book draws inspiration from its source material, and also presents ways to use the Assimilants as more than mindless cyberzombies, but also as stealthy infilitrators and other threats.

Keep on the lookouts for further books in the Menace! series, each of which is going to highlight a new enemy for your group.

180366.description:
From the publisher's website:

In Great War at Sea: Triple Alliance, we explored the notion of Italy remaining true to her alliance partners, Germany and Austria-Hungary, during the outbreak of the First World War in 1914. Staff officers from all three fleets prepared detailed operational plans, yet when war came in August 1914 Italy refused to join her Alliance partners and those plans would never be used.

The joint staffs foresaw an aggressive Triple Alliance, one attemtping to seize control of the Mediterranean from the British and French. Our book Triple Alliance looked at the first year of such a naval war in a set of 43 new scenarios for our Great War at Sea: Mediterranean boxed game.

Central Powers picks up that story in September 1915, with Italy, Austria-Hungary and Germany still struggling against Britain and France as new warships join the fleets of both sides. The fleets are almost evenly matched, with a slight Allied superiority in numbers matched by the Central Powers' central position. In this war, the fighting on the Mediterranean Sea has been just as bloody and destructive as that on the land fronts.

Central Powers is a book supplement for the Great War at Sea series based on this naval war that never happened, but was probably more likely to have occurred than the actual events. It is not a complete game; ownership of our Mediterranean and Jutland boxed games and Triple Alliance, Dreadnoughts and Zeppelins supplements is required to enjoy all of the scenarios.

The book includes 90 new playing pieces. The French receive their powerful Normandie- and Lyons-class super-dreadnoughts, and a pair of battle cruisers as well. And there's a quartet of French light cruisers proposed before the war but never built, that would have been very useful in fleet actions.

With the Royal Navy unwilling to detach too much strength from the Grand Fleet facing the Germans across the North Sea, it falls on the other Allies to bolster this very active naval front. The Americans enter the Mediterranean naval war with their oldest dreadnoughts and newest pre-dreadnoughts, plus a large squadron of the armored cruisers. The Japanese are present as well with a squadron of battleships and one of cruisers. Plus there are four re-armed Austrian light cruisers (there have to be Austrians) and an Italian seaplane carrier (with seaplanes).

The forty-two (42) scenarios continue the Triple Alliance story line through to the end of the Great War; since the book shares the special rules of Triple Alliance, we have more room for the story! It's a unique project, telling the alternative history of the entire Triple Alliance Mediterranean naval war in a series of game scenarios.
180366.name: Great War at Sea: Central Powers
boardgameexpansion: Great War at Sea: Rise of the Dragon
Great War at Sea: The Mediterranean
Great War at Sea: Triple Alliance

180367.name: OneDice Raptors
180367.description:
From publisher blurb:

Quick and easy dino role-playing rules

OneDice Raptors is a role-playing game red in tooth and claw. In it, you play velociraptors. Hungry velociraptors. Velociraptors with attitude. Co-operate with you pack-mates to bring down creatures bigger than you! Protect your eggs from other hungry dinosaurs! Fight for dominance within the pack! Bite! Rend! Tear! In an ancient world that never quite was, it’s survival of the fittest.

But what if there are cavemen? And women, of course! They’re clever. Sneaky. And…mmm… tasty.

And what if the world isn’t quite what it seems? What if it turns out you live in some sort of park? And tasty morsels go by, frustratingly enclosed in metal contraptions? And some of those humans have sticks that go bang and hurt you? Still, they’re tasty too if you can catch them…

OneDice Raptors is a role-playing game in which you play carnivorous dinosaurs. Whether it’s in a semi-realistic world of giant reptiles, a world where dinosaurs and cavemen co-exist, or a world where dinosaurs have been recreated by modern science, is up to you. You might not even find out until you’ve been playing for a while. Just keep eating, everything will be fine.

180368.name: XXXI
180368.description:
From the Front Cover:

Official Gaming Aid approved for use with Castles & Crusades.

Looking for adventure? Don't know where to start? Here's an easy method. Flip through the booklet and pick a location at random. This is where the adventure begins, in the middle of the action. Look over the description of the location and its occupants, and consider the nature of the adventurers.

180369.description:
This expansion brings all the components for a 5th Player. It includes all the cards for the color black, additional crate cubes and a new region: South America.

This was released only in Brazil.



Esta expansão traz todos os componentes para a adição de um quinto jogador. Nela estão inclusas todas as cartas da cor preta, cubos adicionais e uma nova região: América do Sul.Ela foi lançada apenas no Brasil.
180369.name: Gunrunners: Homens de Preto

180371.name: Reflex'S
180371.description:
Are you bored with traditional party games where you just have to react quickly when the cards are identical or different? Do you want to play at the next level game? Do you want to think and say « O my gosh! I can't remember how it works! » And, at the end of the game, do you want to say « ok, let's play again, I will do it! » Then, Reflex'S is for you!

It is a game that combines reflexes and reflection in which players must associate colors, shapes and numbers in an unusual way. Rules are quickly understood and heat up your brain. A card with two criteria identical to yours? Grab the object corresponding to the third criterion! Two identical cards and everybody must tap on the center.

And now, watch out, think twice and hurry up!

180372.name: UnitZ
180372.description:
User Summary

You play this game as a zombie apocalypse survivor, seeking out supplies to survive, or as match against other players. A first person shooter, you start with a handgun and box of bullets, but can craft items or just pick them up from houses. You die often and can re-spawn easily. The game has crude graphics, typical controls, and basic action.

This 'game' is controversial since it was put together from pieces of the UnitZ developer kit under the Unity Engine. While FieldZ and Day Survival Begins did not make it past the Greenlight process, Uncrowded did and was sold as a cheap regular game on Steam. This called into question the use of these developer kits and the entire Steamlight selection process for indie game developers. Also, since developers make money on any card sold on Steam, selling the game cheaply and depending on the cards as a revenue stream has supported what is commonly seen as a Unity ripoff given legitimacy by Steam publication.

180373.name: Iron Falcon
180373.description:
From publisher blurb:

The earliest fantasy campaigns grew directly out of wargames. There was a point in the development of the first commercial role-playing game when the rules shed most of their wargame roots and assumed a form familiar to generations of players to come. Iron Falcon aims to be that game, reproducing its mechanics and style in all its raw and innovative glory, as it was before the advent of more "advanced" rules.

180377.name: Sea Chess
180377.description:
A chess-like game between opposing navies. Each player receives 16 pieces which are arranged in opposite corners: 1 FLAGSHIP: moves one space orthogonally, cannot attack or be used in custodial capture. Is captured by advancement (must move in straight line towards it and stop on space before it). All other pieces can move any number of spaces horizontally or vertically.

1 AIRCRAFT CARRIER: can only be captured by custodial capture (sandwiching an enemy piece between yours and another).
2 BATTLESHIPS: can only be captured by cannonade (your piece must be separated from it by another piece [not an unoccupied space] so that it can jump over it and land on the battleship).

4 CRUISERS: can only be captured by withdrawal (your piece must move away from it in a straight line).
4 DESTROYERS: can only be captured by leaping (your piece must pass over it to an empty space behind).
4 SUBMARINES: can only be captured by displacement (landing on it); can also move underneath a piece to empty space behind (but cannot attack while doing so).

GOAL: to capture your opponent's flagship.

180378.name: The Locksmith
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
180378.description:
The Hook

Your father turns up on your doorstep in the middle of the night with a problem - there is a dead prostitute in his bed.

180379.name: Warhammer: End Times – Vermintide
videogamehonor: 2015 Global Game Awards Best Co-op Game of the Year Nominee
180379.description:
Vermintide is a co-operative action first person shooter and melee combat adventure set in the End Times of the iconic Warhammer Fantasy world.

Vermintide takes place in and around Ubersreik, a city overrun by Skaven. You will assume the role of one of five heroes, each featuring different play-styles, abilities, gear and personality. Working cooperatively, you must use their individual attributes to survive an apocalyptic invasion from the hordes of relentless rat-men, known as the Skaven. Battles will take place across a range of environments stretching from the top of the Magnus Tower to the bowels of the Under Empire.

Core Features:

- Cooperative Survival For up to 4 Players - Band together with your friends or die alone. Vermintide will continuously test the teamwork and skill of you and your friends. Drop-in, drop-out Multiplayer and the addition of A.I. bots ensures a full team at any time, regardless of available players.
- Play as Five Unique Heroes – Five distinct characters to choose from, each with their own personality, agenda and story to tell. Learning what it means to work together is key to the group’s survival.
- Huge Hero Arsenal – Each hero has its own unique weapons arsenal to draw from, allowing players to adjust their combat style to fit their gameplay preference. There are hundreds of different weapons, includíng swords, daggers, axes, hammers, bows, guns, magical staves & more
- Embark on an Epic Quest – Boasting 13 diverse levels – on the ground, in buildings, on walls and underground – ranging from the immense Magnus Tower to the treacherous Under Empire, Vermintide will take you on a journey you’ll never forget.
- Experience the Skaven Like Never Before – A rising tide of malicious and cunning rat-men await you, hacking, clawing and eviscerating all that stand in their way. Face vicious packs of clan-rats and deadly specialized elites.
- Gather Mountains of Shiny Loot – Rewarding teamwork above all else, players are given loot dice at the end of a mission that will reward them with a weapon, a hat or a trinket. Completing side objectives means that better loot dice can be added to the roll.
- Battle Unpredictable Enemies – Vermintide features a dynamic spawn system providing a constant set of new challenges lurking behind every corner.
- Experience an Immersive Story – Games Workshop veterans have banded together to write a fantastic new addition to the Warhammer lore, offering a new perspective on the cataclysmic events of The End Times.
- Find a Path to Safety – The Skaven boast incredible mobility, able to climb and leap fantastic distances to make life a living hell for the Heroes. No matter where you go, they will be there, ready to pounce.

The time of mortals is ending, and the reign of Chaos draws ever closer. The Dark Gods are at last united in a singular purpose, losing their madness across the world as never before. In the Empire of Sigmar, Karl Franz’s gaze is focused on the incursion of the savage northmen, but it is not the only threat. As the Chaos moon Morrslieb waxes full, shrill voices echo through tunnels gnawed far beneath the Empire’s cities, and a Skaven host swarms towards the surface. It emerges first in the city of Ubersreik, a screeching mass that consumes all before it. Soon Ubersreik is a charnel-town, drowning beneath the malevolent shadow of the Horned Rat.

Yet even in the darkest times, there are always champions to light the way. As Ubersreik cowers, five heroes, united by capricious fate, carry the fight to the rat-men. It remains to be seen whether they have the strength to survive, let alone work together long enough to thwart the invaders. One truth, however, is beyond all doubt: should these five fall, then Ubersreik will fall with them.

Source: The Game Website.

180380.description:
Players have a new hero to face off against! The Dragon Warrior has dragon's blood flowing through her veins, making her a feared fighter. Players will have to summon undead dragons, snow wyrms, and dragon constructs to defeat her!

The Dark Dealings: Dastardly Dragons expansion comes with six Dragon Warrior Hero Cards and three new dragon Defense Cards. These are added to a copy of Dark Dealings to add a new challenge.
180380.name: Dark Dealings: Dastardly Dragons & Gnome Illusionist

180381.name: Call of Catthulhu Deluxe
180381.description:
User summary:
The Deluxe boxed set, includes:

Call of Catthulhu Book I: The Nekonomikon (The Book of Cats)
Call of Catthulhu Book II: Unaussprechlichen Katzen (The Cat Herder's Guide)
Character sheet pad
6 custom six-sided dice showing sad cats and happy cats
4 cat figures
16 goldfish counters
Cat pen

180382.name: Masha and the Bear: Trouble in the Garden
180382.description:
Masha and Bear lavish care and attention on the fruit and vegetables in their garden. They love picking them and nibbling on them.

But what's that? Every night, uninvited guests get amongst the beds and help themselves to the fruit and vegetables. who on earth can it be? Get your thinking caps on and start guessing!

Every round every player chooses one of the four guests in secret. Afterwards the guest tokens are cast and every player can move his Bear figure as many steps forward as there are matches of chosen guests and guest tokens.

The player, whose Bear figure is the first to reach the final field is the winner.

boardgamepublisher: Winning Moves Germany (Winning Moves Deutschland GmbH)
180383.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from FC Schalke 04, a soccer club in Hannover, Germany.
180383.name: Monopoly: Hannover 96
boardgamefamily: Cities: Hanover or Hannover (Lower Saxony, Germany)

180384.name: Chattanooga: The Civil War Game
180384.description:
Civil War Game based on the campaign for Chattanooga. Published 1978, Chattanooga, TN by T&M Enterprises.

From the instructions:

"The object of the game is to strategically move your unit pieces into a position which would defeat your opponent within 63 days (21 turns)"

180385.name: Pizza Delivery
180385.description:
For most people, ordering a pizza is just a phone call away. What does it take to get that hot pizza to you? Do you have what it take to deliver? Find out with "Pizza Delivery". Race against your friends to earn the most tips in one evening, or be the "Top Driver" by delivering the most pizzas by the end of the game. How ever you choose to play the game, you'll find that Pizza Delivery delivers the fun.

Players move with dice and use event cards to move their cars and make deliveries.

180386.name: Commander Pixman
180386.description:
Fast-paced action, gun with your hands, 80 levels to master, hundreds of enemies to kill and thousands traps to avoid! Everything is packed with retro style and responsive controls!

Guide trapped Andrew “Pixman” Blazkowicz to leave the alien base. Destroy every creature, jump over treacherous holes and traps on his way. Find your rocket and get the hell out of there!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Print & Play Board Game Nominee
180387.description:
Tomb of Four Kings is a fantasy adventure card game for a single player using a standard 52 deck of playing cards and one joker. With each turn, you defeat monsters, disarm traps, and open doors as you explore a dark dungeon. Along the way you collect treasure, gain skills, even use magic. But death awaits those who linger too long, and if all your torches burn out you will be lost in the dungeon forever. The objective is to find the tomb hoards of four ancient kings, collect as much additional treasure as possible, and make it out alive.

The spread is the standard layout for the game. At the top of the spread is an area where you play torches (A), as they appear. In the middle of the spread is the dungeon area itself. Turns descending into the dungeon are played in a row from left to right. This row is called the delve. The turns ascending from the depths of the dungeon are played underneath the delve from right to left, with one turn for each turn of the delve except the turn-around point. This is called the retreat. Below the dungeon area, from left to right are a discard area, a hit point counter, and a hand where you collect your treasure, tomb hoards, skill cards, and magic scroll.

The game is divided into turns. Each turn, you play a series of cards in the dungeon area. The turn represents an encounter as you explore the vast and sprawling dungeon. Layer the cards in a column while the turn is active. When the turn is over, stack those cards face down before moving on to the next turn. Each turn starts by playing cards from the deck until an encounter card appears.

If you make it out of the dungeon alive, add up all the treasure in your hand. If you found all four kings and survived, you have won the game, regardless of points. Multiply total points by 100 to calculate the value of your treasure in gold pieces.
180387.name: Dungeon Solitaire: Tomb of the Four Kings

180388.name: A Mini Falafel Adventure
180388.description:
Source: The Game Website.

A Mini Falafel Adventure is a condensed, action-oriented Metroidvania with an emphasis on memorable boss fights, characters and gameplay-twisting powerups. It was developed over 3 years and features a chiptune/disco soundtrack by Reed Richards.

180389.description:
Insekten Hotel ("Insect Hotel") is a card-laying and -collecting game for children and families.

In Insect Hotel, each player tries to be the first to occupy all the rooms in his insect hotel with crawling guests. Some insects come voluntarily, others must be lured in with honey — but beware of the insatiable cockroach that steals all your honey. And watch out for the grim spider that adores to frighten individual guests out of your hotel!
180389.name: Insekten Hotel
boardgamepodcastepisode: Essen 2015 - Insect Hotel

180390.name: Nafetel: Merchants
180390.description:
Nafetel: Merchants is a unique game where players will compete against each other to fill quotas from shipmasters eager to get back out on the sea.

In Nafetel: Merchants each player will play through a set of rounds in which they trade, bid, invest, gain victory points, and more. Each player has four sets of these rounds to fill however many quotas they possibly can then the shipmasters will leave with what they have or empty. This is called the ticking time bomb, where Shipmasters and Merchants alike both want the best deals in the quickest time possible.

Players will draw 4 Investment cards to begin the game, after that a specific number of quota cards will be placed in the middle of the players. Each player will play their rounds separate from the other players. They will decide if they wish to invest, bid, and/or trade their investments for new ones or invest them on quotas. The first player to fill a quota through either monopolising it, out bidding it, or quickly snagging it off the market will gain a victory point for that quota the filled.

180391.name: Khrysos Hunters: Fires of Gammara Expansion
180391.description:
Bring the heat! The ‪‎Khrysos‬ Hunters adventure takes our heroes to the volcanic world of Gammara in the Fires of Gammara expansion pack releasing this summer! Featuring 12 new map cards with treacherous lava flows that make you choose between speed and safety, and 12 all new characters with new, crazy abilities!

Entering a lava space takes 2 movement or 1 movement and 1 Damage.
The players get to choose whether to play slow and cautious or fast and dangerous.

Mix and match tile cards with the base game and the Ruins of Abetan Expansion to make your own challenging game maps.

180393.description:
A free print-and-play mini expansion for Empires of the Void includes a player tableau and planet token for an additional faction; the Sirens of Belshar.

The special ability of the Sirens basically means that they may steal a Starfighter from an opposing player in a space battle, provided that at least one Siren Diplomat ship is present in this battle and the Sirens have an unused Starfighter ship available. If these two conditions are met, the opposing Starfighter is removed and handed back to its owner, whereas the additional Starfighter of the Sirens is placed at the same space and - of course - participates in the battle on side of the Sirens.
180393.name: Empires of the Void: Sirens of Belshar

180394.description:
Contained in Plato Magazine n°73.

The promo card in Plato is a new sea monster. You just include it the ally deck. When it's drawn, you have this choice:


Fight. It ends your turn. The threat token goes back to the first space, but you don't take any reward !! (you just lose your turn)



Continue exploration. To do so, first have to pay what's in front of the threat token. Then, move the threat token one step forward.
180394.name: Abyss: Anglerfish

180395.description:
Two District cards not included in the box. Provided to backers of the Kickstarter campaign.

One District allows a player to build Empire cards immediately when using the Explore action. The other provides extra income, and a two card bonus when using the Explore action.
180395.name: The Ancient World: Kickstarter Promo Cards

180396.name: Cat Traders
180396.description:
User summary:
猫町商會 (Cat Traders) is a psychological strategy game in which players try to detect crooked merchants by exchanging transaction cards with other merchants (opponents) using 8 gold-coin cards.

If a player detects that a merchant has submitted a transaction card with a lower value than the gold-coin card (crooked merchant), he will acquire the transaction card and also impose a penalty on his opponent. If he fails to detect this and passes the obtained card to his opponent, he will incur a penalty himself.

The person with the highest number of total points on obtained transaction cards when the game is over will be the winner.

The game was prototyped in 2007 and first published in 2010.

Publisher's summary:
金貨カード8枚を使い、商人（対戦相手）と取引カードと交換トレードを行い悪徳
商人を見破る心理戦略ゲームです。
商人が金貨カードより低い金額の取引カードを出した（悪徳商人）ことを見破れば、取引カードを獲得し、しかも相手にペナルティーを課せられます。
見破るのを失敗すると獲物カードが相手に渡ってしまい、反対にペナルティーが課せられます。
ゲームオーバーの時点で取引カードの獲得合計点がより高得点の人が勝ちとなります。

180397.description:
Abriss is a fast and tactical game that deals not once again with the construction of buildings but with the consequences – DEMOLISH buildings. Therefore, at the beginning of the game all 25 buildings are laid out on the table, ready to be torn down and blown up. Of course, this work is not done by itself but you need trustworthy workers like Slobodan, Leonid or Hao Wech. During each game round each player buys one of these at an auction, and thus equipped with the required devices they can demolish a building, provided the following conditions are met: the player is able to get rid of the construction waste (legally or illegally – the main point is: away with it!) and there are sufficient vacant spaces next to the building. Of course the nuclear power plant in the heart of the city is harder to break into pieces than the hot-dog stand just next to the city limits sign. This edition introduces the bureaucrats. They can be useful with their special permits if once and again there is not enough space to demolish a building. A successful demolition results in a demolition award for the player and they keep the tile for scoring at the end of the game. Who would not like to blow the revenue office to pieces and thus earn a little tax refund? That way the buildings vanish one after the other until there are only 2 or less left standing. The player who has demolished the most valuable buildings is the winner of the game.

Abriss takes about 45 minutes to play, the game mechanism is easy to understand and there is little downtime. The auction of subcontractors and bureaucrats provides interaction and is kept simple - there are only 3 possible bids. With the random set-up, each game offers a new challenge for the players.

The new edition includes bureaucrats and the expansion ABRISS-AUFTRÄGE/DEMOLITION-CONTRACTS.
180397.name: Abriss (Zweite Edition)

180398.name: Horen Zien Zwijgen
180398.description:
Partygame where people have to guess and score point in several categories:

(no) Hear:
- Sign language
- Draw on ones back

(no) See:
- Blind drawing
- Braille

(no) Talk:
- Gestures
- Say 'uh'

180399.name: La Guía de BNC (Barnacity)
180399.description:
De la contra portada:
E esta estupenda guía de Barnacity encontrarás todo lo que siempre quisiste saber, e incluso lo que siempre te la trajo floja acerca de la capital del reino de Dick y de cualquier otra gran ciudad en general del universo Fanhunter.

180400.name: BNC Tales
180400.description:
De la portada:
Cachondas aventuras en la capital del reino de Dick para Fanhunter.

180401.name: Fanhunter's Spanish Show (1ª Parte)
180401.description:
De la portada:
La resistencia, en otro arrebato de estulticia, ha decidido resucitar a Krad el Zurdo, el peor jugador de Magik de la historia. Para llevar al cabo el ritual necesitan recuperar el "Powerpack", las diez cartas que Krad tenia en todas sus barajas, dispersas ahora por todo el reino de Dick.

180402.name: Fanhunter's Spanish Show (2ª Parte)
180402.description:
De la portada:

La resistencia sigue buscando el "Powerpack" de Krad el Zurdo, provocando incendios, terremotos y decapitaciones involuntarias.

180403.name: Fanhunter's Spanish Show (3ª Parte)
180403.description:
De la portada:
Epica conclusión del campañote, los NJs por fin conseguirán el "Powerpack" de Krad el Zurdo y resucitarlo, pero algo despertará un poder ominoso y ancestral: el Reverso Oscuro de la Pichurrina.

180404.name: Anjos & Dragões
180404.description:
In Anjos & Dragões two or four players control factions of bionic dragons and magic angels. Each player must first take down five protection shields to finally give a killing blow to the opponent and rule the planet.

The first brazilian edition has four factions, each one with 50 cards. A faction have four copies of 12 common cards and two copies of 1 evolution. You can play with them right out of the box or mix non-opposing factions.

Players use they cards as Generals, Allies or imediate effects. During a player's turn, he/she will put Generals in play to attack the opponent. The defender can use one of his Generals to block or put in play a new one from his hand. There are no mana or any type of resources to summon Generals: you can use all your cards in an attack, but remember that you will need defense later!

Each card have a General Strength and a Ally Strength. While some are strong when leading an army, others are better following orders. Also, some have special abilities when performing a specific role. A combat is resolved comparing total opposing Strengths. During an combat, the player with fewer strenght total is allowed to add allies to a General to revert the situation.

Some cards can also be discarded from hand to have an imediatte effect, which can change completely the result of a battle. Effects can vary widely, from keeping some nasty units out of battle, destroy allies, give extra attacks or protect valuable combatants.

The cards used as shields, when destroyed, reinforce the owner's hand and can be played just after. Choosing wisely when forfeit a block, can give you precious resource to win the next battle and become the new attacker.

With 13 distinct cards per deck, each play allows you a unique experience combining powers and imediate effects.

180405.name: Book of the Wyrm Storyteller's Screen (W20)
rpgpublisher: CCP Games / CCP hf (Crowd Control Productions)
180405.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A sturdy three-panel screen featuring a beautiful collage of W20 Book of the Wyrm art on the outer side, and on the inside there's a selection of charts and other info to make the Storyteller's job a little bit easier

180406.name: Rogue Shooter: The FPS Rogue-Like
180406.description:
In this game you will battle your way through a randomly generated space station that is overrun with aliens, killer robots, and giant carnivorous plants!

You won’t be alone in this fight though, you will have plenty of guns to keep you company. Everything from Plasma Rifles to Rocket Launchers to the fabled Shotgun Trident will be at your fingertips!

As you progress you will level up and gain perks such as the ability to carry more items or strike with improved melee attacks.

Can you make it to the 200th floor and discover the source of the station’s corruption?

No, you probably cannot, but you can have fun trying.

Source: The Developer Website.

180407.name: Spark Rising
180407.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




Spark Rising is a sandbox action strategy game where you build fortresses and fight back against an invasion. You can build fortresses, weapons, creatures with our voxel game engine, and then take all that into battle. Imagine a game where you can explore and conquer floating fortresses across the galaxy created via user generated content. In addition to user generated content, the game features upgrade systems, co-op gameplay, and a robust story mode.

Source: The Developer Website.

180408.description:
Children's card game with occupations and letters on the cards.

You can play different popular and new games based on memory, old maid, guess who?, hangman etc.

In one variant each player draws a card with occupation and other players must guess each other occupations one by one by asking questions. Current player can answer only Yes/No. Each question scores him 1 point until his occupation is guessed. The player with the most points at the end of the round is the winner.
180408.name: Kelleks Tahad Saada?

180409.name: Silence of the Sleep
180409.description:
Silence of the Sleep is a psychological horror adventure game for PC.

You play as a man called Jacob Reeves.
A man who has lost his reason to live.
He throws himself into a blackness to end his misery, but instead of it being the end he wakes up without a memory of his life before.

You will travel through the abstract world of Silence of the Sleep to find the very reason for your journey...

Source: The Game Website.

180410.name: Creature dei Domini
180410.description:
From the back of the book:
Il misterioso Moloke-Tanu che caccia tra l'erba elefante della Savana d'Avorio...i Ditagialle che si nascondono nelle tombe oscure delle Terre di Cain...

English translation:
From the mysterious moloke-tanu hunting in the tall grass of the Ivory Savannah to the yellowfingers lurking in the darkest tombs of the Cairnlands.

180411.name: CO-OP: Decrypted
180411.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between) but IS already available for sale / early access, so CAN BE PLAYED.




CO-OP is a 2.5D puzzle-platformer. You control two robots; R3D, who can absorb all the light sources around him, and BLU3, who converts that energy into an explosive power. They find themselves in what seems like a recycling facility, with drones analyzing their every move..
You can play it singleplayer, mutliplayer online and multiplayer local (splitscreen), up to you!

Source: The Game Website.

180412.name: Ash: Il Pianeta Morente
180412.description:
From the back of the book:
Atterra su Serena, la città dove i criminali sono talmente duri da ribellarsi perfino al Sindacato e gli squadroni della polizia sono più pericolosi delle stesse bande che dovrebbero combattere.

English translation:
Lands on Serena, the city where criminals are so hard to rebel against the Union, and police squads are more dangerous of the criminal bands they should fight.

180413.name: Ultima Forsan: Italia Macabra
180413.description:
Publisher blurb:
Italia Macabra è il compendio geografico di Ultima Forsan dedicato all’Italia del Rinascimento Macabro, dai Domini del Mare di Venezia Nuova ai Giudicati del Regno di Sardegna, dal Piemonte Selvaggio al Califfato di Sicilia.

English translation:
Italia Macabra is the geographic compendium of Ultima Forsan dedicated to Italy's Macabre Renaissance, from New Venice Sea Dominions to the Giudicati of Kingdom of Sardinia, from savage Piedmont to the Caliphate of Sicily.

180414.name: The Stronghold (Issue 2 - Jun 2015)
180414.description:
The Stronghold
Issue #2
June 2015

Cover art by Emily Rencher.

180415.name: AMP: Year Two
180415.description:
Publisher blurb:

The year of fear has begun! Continuing the story into the year 2016, AMP: Year Two is the latest sourcebook for the AMP: Year One RPG. Not only does this book expand the world timeline, but provide full details on how AMPs have begun to affect the rest of the world. AMP: Year Two introduces 4 brand new Affiliations for characters to join, 1 additional powers for each Strain (like Horror for Mindbenders or Immortality for Bulks), and one awesome universal power, Gadgeteering, available for both AMPs and Saps.

180416.name: 100 A.D.
180416.description:
It is 100 A.D. The present emperor is Trajan; one of Rome's greatest generals, leading Rome's greatest military expansion. He has ruled for two glorious years. The senate is largely perfunctory, but those in power still seek the Emperor's ear in order to push their own agendas. This game is about trying to gain Trajan's favor and rule Rome from the shadows.

In 100 A.D. players are members of a secret cabal attempting to control the Senate from behind the scenes. By manipulating the system, passing Bills that improve their status, and gaining influence over the city's factions, the players gain control over various aspects of Rome. Victory points are earned by having influence over the Senate, factions, Senators, and Emperor's Favor. At the end of the game, the player with the most extensive power structure (i.e. victory points) wins.

Throughout the game players take various actions to impact three different portions of the game board in order to accumulate victory points. Players can control the Emperor's Favor, the Senate, or the various factions of the game (or some combination thereof). Players also need to manage their corruption, as too much will lose them points. Generally, players have only one action per turn, but various cards and tokens can be used to gain additional actions.

Each round starts with the Orator, who advances the round token one space and takes an action. During a player's turn, he or she takes one action play then passes clockwise. The actions a player can take on their turn are: Call in a Favor (by playing a faction card); Contact a Faction (by placing influence tokens on a faction space and drawing the appropriate card); Control a Senator (by buying their seat); Remove Influence (withdrawing influence tokens from factions); or Subterfuge (a special action that can vary depending on the circumstances).

When all players have taken a turn, the round is over. At three different times during the game (after rounds 5, 10, and 15) Recess is called and victory points are tallied. Recess is also where players adjust their faction points, and vote on Bills. Players need to be keenly aware of how little time they have before the game is over.

180418.name: Configure
180418.description:
An educational game where players utilize geometry to design floor tile plans in Mt. Vernon, George Washington's house.
There are four rule sets with many variations for each. Some of these include racing to complete a room first, utilizing various color combinations, picking all the tiles to complete a room before laying any out, etc. Some variants are for solo play as well.

180420.name: The Scroll
180420.description:
Adapted from Publisher Description

Rumours of an ancient document of awesome power... a strange murder at dockside... As you check into your hotel, the desk clerk hands you a note - and you are drawn into a mystery of menacing proportions!

Use your Cook's Guide, contacts and city map to research ancient tribes and rites - and unearth the secrets of a long-forgotten evil in the perilous, mysterious world of Alexandria - where the truth and legend of ancient Egypt meet!

What is reality... what is fantasy? Experience the eerie transition from fact to fiction!


Stunning, animated full-screen graphics - photographic quality you have too see to believe!



An epic cinematic adventure - meticulously researched in every detail, with original 1920s materials from Thomas Cook.



Complex, absorbing story lines - plot variations depend on your chosen character's profession: Egyptologist or Occultist.



Unique full-screen graphics, with animated icon interface.


User Comment

The Scroll adapts the story line and basic gameplay mechanics from the earlier adventure game Daughter of Serpents, but lacks the character creation system and pulp detective story line found in the earlier title. The Scroll adds new scenes and events plus digitized dialogue.

180421.name: Flapjack Flipout
180421.description:
Flapjack Flipout is a dexterity race of contestants for the position of short order cook for Flappin' Jack's restaurant.

There are 5 types of pancakes in Flapjack Flipout and each Order Card indicates type and number of pancakes required. As soon as the card is revealed, players grab pancakes from the random community stacks, place them on their griddles face up to see what type of pancake they are, then need to successfully flip them face down in order to cook the other side.

Players need to remember where they keep their cooked pancakes and ring the bell as soon as they think they can fill the order. If correct, the player earns the order card as a point. If not, that player sits out until the order is correctly filled.

(developed by Peter Newland and Chris Rowlands)

180422.name: The Great Air Race
180422.description: Inspired by the 1934 MacRobertson air race from England to Australia. 32-space race track over map of the route, with 2 possible paths connecting some check-point cities. Instead of rolling dice, players draw numbered cards to determine how far they move. some spaces require the drawing of Danger cards which impose penalties.

180423.name: Hostage Negotiator: Negotiator Cards – Series 1
180423.description: 10 Negotiator Cards that each add a power that can be used once per game. Simply select one by choice or at random at the beginning of the game.

180424.name: Tessen: Oversized Ryuu Promo
180424.description: An oversized version of the Ryuu mini expansion for Tessen.

180425.name: Tessen: Oversized Sacred Beast Promo
180425.description: An oversized version of the Sacred Beast card mini expansion for Tessen.

180426.name: Zombicide: Black Plague – Grom and Thalia
180426.description: 2 new Survivors to add to your zombie-killing party (including their miniatures and ID cards).

180428.name: Hometown Heroes
180428.description:
INTRODUCTION

Attention, Heroes! The law-abiding citizens of mid-western Hometown, USA need you!

Super villains from nearby Colossal City have come to expand their criminal enterprises. Their minions are wreaking havoc on this once peaceful town, and someone must rise up to challenge the masked mayhem.

You are the only people capable of thwarting these diabolical criminals. Though you are but a handful of courageous citizens, you possess unique powers and abilities that give Hometown its best hope for salvation. You are the Hometown Heroes!

OVERVIEW

Hometown Heroes is a Superhero-themed card game by Roger Alan Cotton for two players, ages 11 to adult. Play Time ranges from 30 to 90 minutes, depending on how many episodes are played. The starter version of the game comes with seven Comic Book Issues, made up of twenty-one episodes. Expansions will introduce new comic book issues, episodes, and characters.

GAME CONCEPT

Players play out a "comic book issue," which is comprised of three Episodes. Each episode lists objectives worth different amounts of Victory Points. The player whose team of superheroes or super villains completes objectives worth the highest number of Victory Points by the end of the comic book issue, wins.

GAME SET UP

1. Decide who will play the Heroes team and who will play the Villains team. The Villains Player always starts the game as the Active Player, with the Heroes Player starting as the Reacting Player. After the first turn, the players switch statuses. This continues until the end of the game.

2. Decide which Comic Book Issue you will be playing. Place this Issue Card off to the side on the play area.

3. Each player receives the Comic Book Issue Card's three corresponding Episode Cards. Episode cards are double-sided; with one side listing the Heroes Player's objectives, and the other side listing the Villains Player's objectives.

4. The Heroes Player selects five heroes to be in his super team, while the Villains Player selects seven villains and henchmen. These characters are represented by Hero / Villain Cards (which are placed face-up in front of their respective players, on the game play area).

6. Place all (9) of your selected characters' corresponding Action Cards into your Actions Decks, along with the (9) base Action Cards that correspond with your alignments. Then, shuffle the decks. These decks are made up of Actions Cards that represent attacks, defenses, maneuvers, and general actions (like Lifting and Tracking) performed by specific characters in play.

GAME TURN SEQUENCE

1. Hand Formation / Action Card Draw
2. Initiative Determination
3. Action Resolution
4. Episode Completion

HAND FORMATION / ACTION CARD DRAW Phase

At start of game, draw (5) cards from your Action Deck to form your Hand.

At the start of each of your successive turns, draw only enough cards to refill your Hand back up to (5) cards.

INITIATIVE DETERMINATION Phase

Regardless of whose turn it is, the Action Card in either of your Hands with the highest Initiative Value gets to go first. If there are one or more Action Cards with equal Initiative Values, the Active Player's actions are resolved first. Initiative then continues to the character in either Hand with the next fastest Initiative Value.

ACTION RESOLUTION Phase

All actions have an Initiative Value ranging from 1 to 10. An action with an Initiative Value of 10 is the fastest action, while actions with an Initiative Value of 1 are the slowest.

The Active Player starts the action by asking if the Reacting Player has any Action Cards in his Hand that have an Initiative Value of 10. If not, the Active Player may play as many Initiative-10 actions from his Hand as he wishes (depending on availability).

Unless the Reacting Player can prevent the Active Player's cards from taking effect, these actions are resolved and can be used to attack enemy characters, or to complete the objectives on the current Episode Card.

Note: If both players have actions with the same Initiative Values, the Active Player's actions always get resolved before the Reacting Player's actions.

Once the Active Player has played all of the cards in his Hand that he can play, his turn ends. The Reacting Player cannot play any further cards until the start of his own turn.

SCORING

As your characters complete Episode Card objectives, you gain Victory Point Counters equal to the objectives' VP Values. As you gain these counters, keep them on the game play area, next to your characters.

You also gain (1) Victory Point for every enemy character that is Knocked Out at the end of the game, as well as (3) Victory Points for every enemy character you have captured.

180429.name: Fortune's Tavern - The Fantasy Tavern Simulator
180429.description:
Every great RPG has its tavern: where heroes meet, rumours are told, quests are undertaken, and beer is supped by the gallon… but could you manage such a place?

Jump into the role of a fantasy-world tavern keeper: where you will need to renovate an ailing tavern, chat to hundreds of unique guests, manage a stables full of magical creatures, oversee the battle pit, hire heroes or villains to help hunt down magical tavern items like the Mythril Spork of Fortune, and try to keep the drunken guests from trashing the place.

Even at the best of times running such a tavern is not an easy task, but these are not the best of times. War is brewing! To the east the undead minions of the Lich Lord are stirring in response to the trade blockades imposed by the Northern Elves, and violence is spilling over into every part of the three kingdoms.

Take part in a story that will lead you to the palaces of the great and the powerful. Is it possible that a humble tavern keeper can save the world from itself? Perhaps even gain his tavern the royal seal of approval? More likely, like his predecessors, he will be driven into madness, poverty, or an early grave!

Source: The Game Website.

180430.name: Grapple
180430.description:
Grapple is an exciting 3D platformer for PC. In Grapple you play as a blob of goo exploring outer-space. The blob must reach the black hole at the end of each level in order to continue his exploration. Every level can be beaten multiple ways.

Fling, swing and climb across everything in Grapple. Different surfaces react differently to the gooball. Grapple is as fast paced as you want to play it. With multiple checkpoints and unlimited lives your skill is the only thing slowing you down.

Source: The Game Website.

180431.name: Revelations 2012
180431.description:
Armageddon. Apocalypse. The end of days. Mayan prophecy foretells the beginning of a new world age on December 21, 2012 when the road to the stars will descend from the sky and civilization as we know it will come to a tumultuous end. That date has arrived and with it the awakening of a most formidable enemy. Galactic alignment has enabled an artifact which opened a portal allowing villainous Gods access to our universe. Fate has chosen 4 characters to teleport through this portal into another dimension and battle against all odds to rescue mankind from destruction and enslavement. Using teamwork and strategy, can the four heroes save humanity by defeating these evil foes?

In Revelations 2012 players progress through an alternate dimension in a sweltering jungle environment heavily influenced by ancient Mayan culture. First-person shooter action is combined with puzzle solving requiring methodical yet quick-thinking team play in a captivating campaign that can be played with up to four players in co-op mode. Players navigate their way through this perilous maze in 15 different maps gathering “suki-tok” to advance themselves all the while fighting hordes of demonic minions. At the end of each level, the characters are faced with their greatest challenge yet, the Gods themselves!!! As each God is defeated players acquire a crystal to increase the capability of their weapon. Players must use each successive crystal in the next trial that awaits them. Gather all the crystals and overpower the Gods to be victorious in this epic journey.

In addition, multi-player modes let you compete four-on-four with friends playing as either heroes or demons in stasis tag or team death match. Revelations 2012 also boasts the premiere of battlegrounds multi-player maps. This unique mode allows unit selection mind control in a 4 vs. 4 setting to advance in force upon your opponent and infiltrate the enemy base to destroy their boss.

Source: The Developer Website.

180432.name: Paranormal Investigators & Exterminators: Good-Bye American P.I.E.
180432.description:
From publisher blurb:

The P.I.E. team returns to exterminate some ghost and make some cash along the way! Based on Antipaladin Games' Mini-Six system, Paranormal Investigators & Exterminators is a game freakish fun and spiritual head hunting!

In this outing we have updated rules for P.I.E. to make the game run faster, smoother, and be twice as fun, two adventures "Marching Orders" and "Take Me Out to the Ballgame", and the return of some of our great pregens!

This module follows the PIE team on two cases centered around Independence Day in the United States of America. The first case Marching Orders follows the team as they’re called by a local Revolutionary War museum that is being troubled by a company of British Red Coats who, reliving the past, have set up a field hospital in the Museum’s main hall. The second case, Take Me Out to the Ballgame has the team responding to a call to a minor league baseball team’s field just hours before their Independence Day game to stop two ghost teams who have taken over the field.

180433.name: Chi Warrior
180433.description:
From publisher blurb:

The focus of stories and fables alike, all history remembers the acts of a true hero. Adventurers at heart, a chi warrior is rarely found idle, instead going out to leave their mark on the world in whatever way they can. There are those who love challenging the impossible, slaying dragons and demons alike while bringing back exotic trophies of their slaughtered foes. Others work to overthrow oppression, rarely abiding a tyrant in their lands.

Most chi warriors feel right at home with barbarians and rogues, finding a great deal in common through their travels. A bard and a chi warrior can have a friendship that is as legendary as their accomplishments, each complimenting the other. Chi warriors are often at odds with monks and lawful divine characters, their rigid codes rub the more free spirited chi warrior the wrong way.

Chi warriors generally pay little attention to the gods, seeing them more as inspiring idols than objects of veneration. Terrestrial affairs concern them far more, chi warriors sometimes keep a journal to chronicle honorable opponents and glory won in battle.

Vain and prideful, chi warriors can be reckless in battle, proving a touch too wild for allies. But rarely will they go as far as to put their comrades in danger, preferring to face the most dangerous challenges themselves. Drawn to trouble like moths to a flame, chi warriors are rarely wanting for combat, finding the experience invigorating as they use their opponent as a canvas for their artistic expression. As long as chi warriors can walk, they can fight, often pushing the body to the breaking point and beyond.

The Chi Warrior is a new full-BAB base class for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

rpg: ROLF!: The Rollplaying Game of Big Dumb Fighters
180434.name: Major Victory & Yankee Girl
180434.description:
From publisher blurb:

Complete Golden Age Oddballs spotlights obscure characters from the Golden Age of comic books, in many cases collecting the stories in one place for the first time ever. Each issue in the series contain every single appearance of one or more quirky heroes from the founding years of the comic book genre, along with all-new roleplaying game content and an occassional bit of fiction.

In this volume, we spotlight two patriotically themed heroes from one of the original comic book production studios run by Harry Chesler--Major Victory and Yankee Girl. In addition to every single Golden Age appearance of both characters, including covers, this book contains brief publication histories for each; an overview of how they are being incorporated into NUELOW Games' emerging comic book universe; ROLF! game stats; and a bonus expansion to the OGL Modern superhero rules first published in Madden's Boys.

180435.name: Temporal Wake
180435.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Quick Mission for characters of levels 11-13, ready as stand-alone or for easy insertion into an existing campaign

A temporal experiment goes horribly wrong, catapulting you and your team into a distant, deadly future. Cut off from both allies and resources, you must find a way to return home while preventing this nightmare from becoming reality.

Features:

A chilling mission that pits the characters against creatures and hazards warped by terrible weapons and bizarre powers.
Combat, dialogue, and hacking challenges combined with roleplaying opportunities.
Scenarios that provide a wider perspective on the actions of the players and what long-lasting effects they can have on their universe through action or inaction.
A challenging high-level mission that offers a glimpse into one of many possible futures, as well as hints about some of the most terrible threats that lurk beyond known space.
For 11th to 13th level characters

180436.name: Moodswing
180436.description:
From publisher blurb:

Moodswing

Once a respected psychologist working with Law Enforcement, Dr. Jennifer Winters stole the helmet of Professor Emo to become the villainess Moodswing. Now she uses the helmet for her own nefarious purposes, manipulating people's emotions for her amusement.

In addition to Moodswings statistics, there is a higher powered 2.0 version featuring a more experienced Moodswing (who also has some new powers) to use against your heroes.

Also guest starring Spectrum, a second villlain being manipulated by Moodswing!

180437.name: Lighthouse
180437.description:
From publisher blurb:

Lighthouse

A child prodigy, Avery Albright saw his work with light manipulation turned into weapons. Angered by this, he created a suit of powered armor that incorporated his lightmanipulating technology. Taking the name Lighthouse, he now seeks to destroy all weaponry based on his work, as well as expose government cover ups and crimes to the public.

In addition to Lighthouses statistics, there is a higher powered 2.0 version featuring a versatile and more powerful version of the character to oppose your heroes.

Guest starring Colonel Freedom, a government sponsored superhero whose first mission is to capture Lighthouse.

180438.name: Infinite Class: Bounty Hunter
180438.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bounty Hunters are individuals who hunt down criminals for a bounty, generally a small percentage of the bail put up for the criminal's release. In later Ages, though, those criminals they hunt down are often heavily augmented with powerful machine or biological parts, or even parts of strange, alien designs. The wonderful and terrible things that bounty hunters have faced and fought down could fuel many a horror story. And facing down those things comes at a heavy price. Bounty hunter lives were already short, but they only grew shorter as the technology advanced. And so, in order to combat the

growing threat, a group of bounty hunters formed and began augmenting themselves in return, but in a different way. These heavily armored, heavily drugged-out warriors became the famed Skoecher Brigade, from which all later Bounty Hunters effectively descend.

A full player class usable with Infinite Futures 2.0

180439.name: Let's Hike!
180439.description:
The game contains 38 cards - 7 walking cards, 25 trip memory cards, 3 stop cards and 3 field-glass cards.
3 stop cards, the card stops the next player for one turn.
2 field-glass cards, with this card the player can watch a memory from the trip.
Goal - To collect as many memories cards as possible by remembering their spatial position.
Getting started - Place one walking card on the table, face up. Place the rest of the deck on the table, face down.
Playing the game -
1. Each player, in turn, starts by taking cards from the top of the deck. The number of cards the player takes is indicated on the back of the top card of the deck.
2. The player then plays one card according to the card rules below. The card played may be a card the player just took from the deck or a card held by the player from a previous turn.
Card Rules:
- Walking card - A walking card starts a new walk and is placed next to the other walking cards in a row (side by side).
- memory card - These cards represent memories from a hike. To play an memory card, the player must first show it to the other players and then place it, face down, next to one of the open walking cards. To help remember the spatial position of the card, try telling yourself a journey story…
- Stop card - Playing this card makes the next player miss a turn. After this card is played, it is removed from the game.
- Field-glass card - Play this card enables the player to take a peek at one memory card that is on the table. The player plays the memory card only on his or hers next turn. After this card is played, it is removed from the game and the turn passes to the next player.
3. After four memory cards have been placed on the table, the player may guess the identity of one of the memory cards on the table. If the player guesses correctly, he or she takes the card and places it aside.
The game ends when the deck runs out. The winner is the player with the most memory cards.

180440.name: Seeing Red
180440.description:
From publisher blurb:

Of the four racing team, the Reds and the Blues are the eldest. Yet, despite their long pedigree, both have fallen upon hard times.
