A 4-page comic book illustrations and dozens of MVP, all unpublished them. "

180459.name: Wikipedia: The Game About Everything
180459.description: Three exciting Wikipedia games to challenge your brain: Wiki-Trivia, Wiki-Ranks and Disambiguation. It's informative, it's collaborative and it's fun! Which of you and your friends know the most about everything?

180461.name: El Orbe de Amonhotep
rpg: Aventuras en la Marca del Este
180461.description:
Portada:
En el viejo país de Neferu, más allá de Semerkhet, allende el desierto, la arena ardiente oculta enigmáticas ruinas de antaño, ahítas de misterios y reliquias fabulosas. ¿Seréis los suficientemente osados para explorar el zigurat maldito en busca del Orbe de Amonhotep?

Contraportada:


Modulo para personajes de nivel 5-6 **



Este módulo ha sido especialmente diseñado para usarse con el reglamento de Aventuras en la Marca del Este. No obstante, podrá ser empleado con otros juegos similares con relativa facilidad y aplicando pocos cambios, incluyendo la quinta edición del juego de rol de fantasía por antonomasia.

Esta aventura trata de emular los viejos módulos que aparecieron en su día para el juego que Aventuras en la Marca del Este clona, como homenaje a un estilo muy particular y querido de entender esta afición, así como una no disimulada pretensión de establecer una línea de aventuras clásicas, con el aroma inconfundible de antaño, sencillas y adaptables, sin pretensiones, como aquellas que jugábamos hace ya más de veinte años.

180462.name: Assault Boat
180462.description:
From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible starship. The space craft introduced in this installment of the series is a small but sturdy 80 dT assault boat for boarding operations or planetary invasions.

The PDF contains the background of the ship, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains simple deckplans (Without scale or grid!) of the ship and images showing the ship from various directions.

180463.name: The Lich
180463.description:
From publisher blurb:

Death.
A being both known and unknown to you. You casually give and take souls to and from Death as you please. You create mockeries of souls to inhabit the corpses you raise. They are imperfect, of course. A mere mortal cannot hope to imitate the precision required to make a soul.
Not that you are one.
You are the Lich. You, whose soul is housed inside a seemingly mundane item, have spat on Death’s face. Regardless of race, heritage, or wealth, Death will have his eyes on you. Whether it be religious zealots or glory-seekers, Death will stare.
And you, Lich, will gladly stare back at him.

The lich is the epitome of undead monsters, and now, you can play as one! Raise and command the dead. Use your touch to drain the life out of the living. Practice necrotic rituals. Improve upon your phylactery, the receptacle for your soul. Eventually, you will become a demilich.

This product contains:

The lich playbook, with over 20 moves. In addition, the playbook includes 6 phyactery moves, and an ultimate move, which you can take at level 11.
New tags, equipment, and monsters.
An adventure front designed with the lich in mind.

180465.name: Psi-Threats Book One: Mutant and Machine
180465.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is the first in what’s going to be a series of short bestiaries for the Psi-Watch Campaign Setting. Eventually, this content will be collected and expanded into a mammoth, setting-defining collection of opponents in the tradition of Closed: Monsters of the Army of God and The Black Bestiary. This volume focuses on an assortment of criminal cyborgs, Mutant street scum, and robotic threats to the Mutant race as a whole.

180467.name: Vegetable Race
180467.description:
Vegetable Race is a racing game with varying point values given for finishing. Your primary goal is to manipulate your neighbors to finish based on your secret objective. Vegetable Race is played over multiple rounds and is anyone's game until the final round.

Game Play:
Each player selects a vegetable from the eight available (Carrot, Tomato, Bean, Pepper, Eggplant, Onion, Corn, and Lettuce) and takes the appropriate vegetable card and player pieces.
At the start of each race, each player is given a secret objective and dealt 2 playing cards. The secret objectives relate to yourself or your neighbors finishing, i.e.: "Finish any time after the person to your right. 3 pts", or "Finish Last. 4 pts."

On a players turn they draw a card then play a card. Or, they can use their vegetables ability. Cards move themselves or other players. Cards also allow you to play from another players hand, swap places, and more.
There is a single "Finish First" card that gives a player 7 points if they finish first with it in their hand and causes their opponents to lose 1 point.

Points for finishing in each race are awarded as follows:
First: 0pts
Second: 4pts
Last: 3pts
Other: 2pts

So, in the span of each race, you go from not wanting to finish, wanting to finish, then not wanting to finish again.

The race is run on a 10 space racetrack. After all players have finished, points are tallied on a separate score track. Play continues until a predetermined score has been met (20 or 30 points) or number of races have been run (3 is usually a good number to determine the top vegetable). Each race runs 5-10 minutes, more or less depending on the number of players.

When playing with 6-8 players additional rules and objectives are added to help speed the game along.

Vegetable Race Consists of: (subject to change prior to release)
54 Standard poker sized playing cards (10 Secret Objective, 42 playing cards, 2 rules quick reference cards)
10 Large playing cards (8 Vegetable Player cards, Race Track, and Score track)
18 Molded plastic pieces (2 of each Vegetable and two additional pieces for tracking starting player with 6-8 players)

The vegetables used in Vegetable Race are vegetables in the culinary sense. The designer is aware that some vegetables used are botanically fruits. Since a lot of different colored vegetables are the same color (Onion, Leek, Bok Choy, etc.) and/or look similar (radish, turnip, beet, etc.) the designer just went with what he thought would be the most amusing (and the name Vegetable Race had a good ring to it).

Vegetable Race is scheduled to be released on Kickstarter right now!!! Pledge now! Running now until August 26th.

180468.name: Doomtown: Reloaded – Immovable Object, Unstoppable Force
180468.description:
Description from the publisher:

Gomorra, California is a town founded on darkness and greed, creating a blight that spreads through both the physical and spiritual realms. The Eagle Wardens and the 108 Righteous Bandits have come promising a cure, but they may have to defeat each other first.

Doomtown: Reloaded – Immovable Object, Unstoppable Force is a 162-card Pine Box Expansion that introduces two new outfits to Doomtown: Reloaded. Now you can sling lead with the Eagle Wardens and the 108 Righteous Bandits. This set also includes cards to support the new themes of Shamans and Kung Fu.

180469.name: Vega Prime
180469.description:
From publisher blurb:

Vega Prime is the leader of a group of transformming robotic spies designed to infiltrate worlds by imitating the technology of native civilizations and then lay the groundword for an invasion by the Mech Centrality - a space empire of technological lifeforms that view all biological life as a cancer in the universe.

Are your heroes up to the challenge of stopping Vega Prime and his squad before he can open a portal to his homeworld and establish a beachhead for an army of merciless mechanized shock troppers?

(This pdf also includes art and a write-up for the workhorses of the Centrality military - the Mech Centrality Shock Troopers.)

180470.name: Menko
180470.description:
Menko is a Japanese game for two or more players. Originating during the middle Edo period (1700s), Menko was a popular children's game during that time.

The objective of the game is to flip the other players' cards or cardboard chips by striking the play area from above with a card or chip from the hand. The purpose is to create a gust of wind with the intent of flipping over one or more cards on the table. If a card is flipped, the player gets to keep it. The game continues until one player has won a set number or all of the cards in the game, and this player is the winner.

Menko cards are often decorated with images of power and military from the time. They continue to be made today in Japan.

It is assumed that Menko was brought to Hawaii at some point during the early 20th-century and eventually evolved into another popular and similar game, Pogs.

180471.description:
Can you gather and secure more treasure than your fellow-adventurers from the Hoard of the sleeping dragon? Can you defend yourself from their attacks and perhaps perpetrate a few of your own? And can you end the hunt at the most opportune time, perhaps by actually wakening the fearsome beast?

Hoard is a dynamic game of hand management, set collection, and press-your-luck. Each turn players take one of four possible actions: 1) roll a custom die and move to take a new card, 2) secure a set of treasures or add to an existing set to score points, 3) affect the dragon, who wakes in stages from his tail to his head, by playing cards that soothe or rouse him, or 4) use a sword on an opponent or capture a used sword with a shield. The board is composed of 12 facedown cards surrounding the dragon. It changes as players remove and replace the cards. Dice rolls between 1-5 enable clockwise or counterclockwise movement and the special symbol allows access to all but one of the cards, so it is a game that rewards memory.

Hoard is meant to be played in rounds, with scoring tokens obviating the need for pencil and paper scorekeeping.

A limited run of Hoard was self-published by Tim Kings-Lynne and Beck Veitch in 2014. They entered into an agreement with Cheeky Parrot Games in order to improve the game play and get Hoard re-published and more widely distributed. Hoard was successfully funded on Kickstarter in mid-2016. The Kickstarted version with deluxe features released into the New Zealand and Australian markets in Q4 2016. A North American edition is now available in that market.
180471.name: Hoard

180473.description:
From the publisher:

When the leaves are spiralling downwards in fall and the wind whips them up for a dance ... Can any player turn over a new leaf? Only the necessary skills will gain you victory in this airy game!

This is the fourth game in the crowdsourcing series Little'N'Nice by Spieltrieb: Take it or leaf it is an exciting dexterity game for the entire family. Two to four players are flicking their playing cards towards the middle of the table. But only the topmost leaf will determine the victory points. And always dependent on the amount of leaves underneath. But be careful! For when a leaf turns in mid-flight, it may be your opponent who gains the points!

Take it or leaf it - A game for up to four friends of little, but nice dexterity games, who do not mind getting up during a game from time to time. What is special about this project? Definitely the game mechanics, and they will provide you with lots of fun. Have you not always wanted to own a game that asks you to throw around cards?

The gameplay of Blätterbunt is very simple and and easy to learn, even for younger players.. One player flicks a card on the table. Then it is the next one's turn. Both aim to cover their opponent's cards with their own. After all cards are flicked, points are given to the player whose card is topmost in a pile. Points are then gained depending on the white dots on the leaf cards. The player who is first to reach a previously agreed victory point target (for example 20) wins the game. The short playing time of about 15 to 20 minutes makes the game a perfect filler game.n)
180473.name: Blätterbunt

180475.description:
from the publisher page

"Officially Licensed form Rio Grande games! This play mat is perfect for playing Dominion, and any or all expansions!

Great for keeping your play area organized. Best of all, helps keep the stacks of cards from sliding into one another. GripMat can be gently slid on smooth surfaces to allow players to get a better look at their choices as well."
180475.name: Dominion: Gripmat Playmat 16" x 24"

180476.name: Dora's Carnival Fiesta
180476.description: Join Dora, Boots and friends for their party at the carnival. A cooperative effort to collect tickets by playing carnival style activities like ring toss, feeding apples to barn animals, knocking over milk bottles and other fun games. Turn over the tickets at the end of play to reveal puzzle images. Together, complete the spectacular carousel. puzzle in the middle of the game board. There are 6 different carnival activities to play. BONUS Dora and Boots pawn figures included.

180477.description:
Nuramuru literally means "earth track" in many of the Aboriginal dialects still spoken today. Travelling their land without maps, Indigenous Australians created a series of songs based on the contours of the land. The songs defy language, and are aural representations of the landscape. Knowlegeable Aboriginals could navigate very great distances with accuracy by singing the landscape. Nuramuru allows players to explore the continent of Australia, expand their territories through strategic game play, and become educated about the rich history and culture of Aboriginal people.

Nuramuru pits four players against each other in a race to explore the country of Australia. Players must explore territory and collect point cards to be the first to 75 points and win.

The game was inspired by Bruce Chatwin's 1987 book 'The Songlines', and draws its game mechanics from Ticket to Ride and Settlers of Catan. Played on a point-to-point network map of Australia, each player moves to an adjoining location, draws a card from the deck, and if he has the required card type(s) for the location, can claim that location by placing one of his tokens on it. Another player can steal possession of that location by moving to it and spending twice as many of the the required card type(s). Players receive points for each location controlled, extra points for individual locations on the ancient Songlines, and a bonus for complete control of a Songline.
180477.name: Nuramuru

180478.name: Kick-Ass 2
180478.description:
User Summary

This action game mimics the movie Kick-Ass 2 using combos to fight enemies. The graphics and general production values were of high quality, although the game was generally criticized as being repetitive both in combat moves and voice acting.

Incidentally, the game disables your clear text font for your entire computer. To readjust, you need to go to your control panel and search "Adjust ClearType text" to turn it back on.

180479.name: The Chrysalis Ring
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
180479.description:
The Hook

Mexico City, 1994. Another day, another missing persons case. You have been hired to find another woman who went missing 2 days ago. You expect the same as always: another body discarded in the desert without a trace of the murderer. But today's case is different... usually it is the poor and homeless that go missing. Today it is a college age woman from a wealthy family in her junior year of a pre-med program. Except no ransom note. No nothing.

180480.name: The Keepers of the Woods
rpgseries: RPG Geek One Sheet GUMSHOE Contest 2015
180480.description:
The Hook

January 1934 - The investigators receive a letter from their friend, Margaret Blackwood, a professor of British folklore and traditions. It invites them to meet in the quaint Devonshire village of Postbridge, where Blackwood has made a discovery regarding active worship of an ancient god. Before they set off, however, the morning’s paper annnounces her death in a mysterious car accident, attributed to a local ghost legend, known as the ‘hairy hands’.

180481.name: Nighthawks
180481.description:
Nighthawks is a tactical space combat microgame that feels like a minis game.

In Nighthawks, players will each pilot their own fleet as they battle for control of the Dyner System.

180482.name: Mask of the Pirate Queen
rpg: Star Wars: Edge of the Empire
180482.description:
From the publisher's website:

Pursue a criminal mastermind across the galaxy in Mask of the Pirate Queen, an adventure for the Star Wars: Edge of the Empire roleplaying game! A powerful smuggling operation has placed a tremendous bounty on the head of the so-called Pirate Queen. In hunting this bounty you and your colleagues will explore the prosperous shadowport of Ord Mantell, fight an intense interstellar fleet battle, and discover the dangerous underworld sport of pit fighting. You never know where you’ll find the Pirate Queen– or what you might encounter in the search.

Within this book’s 96 pages you’ll find complete gazetteers for Ord Mantell and the oasis world of Saleucami, full-color illustrations, numerous new adversaries, and plentiful tips to help Game Masters easily run the adventure. A complete adventure in itself, Mask of the Pirate Queen can be easily integrated into an ongoing Edge of the Empire campaign or used as the launching point for a series of smuggling, spying, or bounty hunting escapades.

180483.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Zombie Bosses Abomination Pack
180483.description:
Special box with three abominations:


Abominotaur. It can break through walls and closed doors! At the start of the activation step of the Zombies' Phase, set the Abominotaur's target Zone before moving it, ignoring closed doors and walls (but not Vault doors and ramparts). If an Abominotaur has to go through a closed door or wall, first put a “broken wall” token to link its starting and destination Zones, and remove any closed door token that might be in the way. The broken wall is considered as an open door, and thus can generate a Zombie spawn in a previously closed building. Actors can now cross the Zones. After that, proceed with moving all the other Zombies (as the Zombies’ route can be redefined by the wall’s destruction).



Abominatroll. Is big, very big, but also incredibly stupid. It will roam around aimlessly until it spots a Survivor. But when it does see you, it will go mental and rush to tear you apart! The Abominatroll normally has only 1 Action per activation. However, if it activates with Line of Sight to any Survivors, it will then get 3 Actions for that activation! Hide away from this freak, and you may evade it. Get caught in the open and you will be well and truly trolled!



Ablobination. Is massive and very tough to kill, but what really sets it apart is its freakishly huge and powerful arm, and the surprising ferocity with which it flails it about, creating a swath of destruction around it! Whenever the Ablobination activates with Line Of Sight to any Survivors at Range 0-1. It will perform an Attack against ALL Zones at Range 0-1 to which it has Line of Sight. That means its own Zone, and any open Zones connected to it! Obstacles preventing Movement between Zones (such as tower ramparts) do manage to block the Ablobination's attack.

180484.description:
The Gateway opens, revealing a land of shadow and fire. Demonic forms wielding strange powers clamber into the arena. Tash-Kalar is now open to the extra-dimensional realm of Nethervoid.

Nethervoid is a new player deck for Tash-Kalar. In addition to the usual cards and pieces, Nethervoid also includes a token for marking the Gateway, a trans-dimensional portal through which Nethervoid practitioners draw energy.

The position of the Gateway becomes critical to your tactics. You will realize the full power of the deck once you have mastered this extra dimension.​
180484.name: Tash-Kalar: Arena of Legends – Nethervoid
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 40 - Asymmetric Games for Two
Essen 2015 - Czech Games Edition

180485.name: Hello Kitty Fjärilsspelet
180485.description:
In the Nordic Hello Kitty adaption Fjärilsspelet ("Hello Kitty - the Butterfly Game" in English) players take on the role of cute kittens trying to catch butterflies. The mechanic is basically roll-and-move, and if you land on a spot with a butterfly, you roll a colored dice; if any of the colors on the side rolled match any of the colors of the butterfly you catch the little creature. You can also land on a spot with a flower, making one of you caught butterflies to escape to a field in the middle of the board. By landing on a spot with a butterfly net you get to catch a butterfly from the field. Finally, if landing on a spot with a bee, you can move to any spot on the board.

The game ends when all butterflies are caught. The player with the most butterflies matching the color of the bow in Kitty's hair is the winner.

Comes with four different Hello Kitty miniatures; red, green, yellow, and pink.

The game is also called Sommerfuglespillet (in Norwegian), Sommerfuglspillet (in Danish), and Perhospeli (in Finnish) respectively on the Nordic edition box cover.

180486.description: Byte Run is a hacking race game. Hackers are represented by icons in code, and they are racing to get data points. First one to 10 points is the winner. Icons move specific number of spaces each turn, and each space has it's own power. When am icon reaches a space it must either use its power, or reroute, move protocol token to his pool, or to any other space. There are 10 powers, one token per power, and ahacker can use only one of each protocols each turn.
180486.name: Byte Run

180487.name: Memo+
180487.description:
Memo+ is a game, or rather six (!) games, from Tactic, all played with the same memory tiles. Rules are provided in twelve different languages for all six game variants:

Memo: A game variant that copies classic Memory (see https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/7688/memory)

Bang!: Tiles are mixed and placed face down. Players take turn flipping the tiles. When two identical tiles appear, players must react quickly and try to put their hands on the first tile, calling out "Bang!".

Fast Fingers: All cards are dumped on the table in a mess. Someone shouts "Go!" and all players then try to collect as many pairs as possible. I think of it as "Galaxy Trucker" for non-gamers. :)

The House: Another variant of matching pairs, with only half of the tiles spread out on the table, and the other tiles piled on top of each other. First, a player draws a tile from the pile, then he/she tries to find the matching tile on the table.

Trio: Basically a variation of "The House" (see above), where you draw three tiles instead of one.

Four in a row: Basically a variation of "The House" (see above), where you draw four tiles instead of one.

180489.description:
You're now part of the School of High Alchemy, but you still have a long path ahead of you, a path that can lead to wisdom, yet a path which is laden with pitfalls and threats that will test you in ways that you can't even imagine. Work hard. Learn to control the elements. Study each recipe and combination, no matter how impossible they may seem. Face your worst fears. And trust fortune as well because it's wise to admit that not everything is in your hands. That's the only true way to become an alchemist.

In each turn of Los Aprendices, players throw all their dice at the same time to get resources. With these resources, they place their tokens in one or more of the six boards on the table, and on these boards they can get abilities or knowledge (depending on the area the player wants to develop). The game is all about gaining resources, using the abilities to transform them into other resources (or multiply them), and rising in the different boards to gain as much knowledge as possible. When a player has more than 42 victory points, that triggers the last round, then whoever has the most points wins.

Your knowledge and intelligence will be the key to your becoming the next alchemist!


Ahora sois aprendices y os queda un largo camino por delante. Un camino de conocimiento que estará lleno de trampas, de amenazas que no imagináis todavía y que os pondrá a prueba. Esforzaos. Aprended a dominar los elementos. Memorizad cada fórmula, cada combinación posible o imposible. Plantad cara a vuestros miedos. Confiad, también, en la suerte porque es prudente reconocer que no todo está en nuestras manos. Sólo así os convertiréis en alquimistas.

El primer jugador que llegue o supere los 42 puntos de conocimiento cierra la última ronda. El que tenga más puntos en la última ronda gana.
Al principio de cada turno, los jugadores tirarán sus dados para obtener recursos según sus resultados. Con estos recursos se colocarán en los tableros que más les interesen. En cada una se obtendrán más conocimiento o más habilidades (según el campo que cada jugador quiera desarrollar).
El mecanismo del juego consiste en obtener recursos, usar las habilidades para transformarlos en nuevos elementos (o bien multiplicarlos) e ir ascendiendo en los distintas tableros para obtener tanto conocimiento como puedan.

Los Aprendices es un juego en el que tendréis que usar vuestros conocimientos e inteligencia para convertiros en alquimistas.
180489.name: Los Aprendices
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ55: Buscant pistes a l'Off (4 mini-entrevistes)

180490.name: Les Petits Pirates
180490.description:
Les Petits Pirates is a mini game played on a single, small game board. In Les Petits Pirates, players are pirates, working to gather resources and gold while trying to prevent their opponents from doing the same. Through action selection and dice manipulation, players will plunder, attack, and sail the seas in their quest to bury enough treasure and enjoy a decadent pirate retirement!


Features:

Les Petits Pirates is an easy game to expand for more players or larger games. A single 5.5” x 8.5” game board can support 2-4 players with 3 ships each. Multiple game boards can be combined, or a larger board used to easily expand the game for 5-6 players. Special rules and map also allow for solo play. More variety can be easily introduced by simply printing new maps that can be used alone or combined with other maps. The game can easily be re-themed for a variety of genres, like Vikings, Space, High Fantasy, etc. Les Petits Pirates can easily be played with just the game board and typical household items, like dice and coins, but the game lends itself to having a ‘deluxe’ edition that includes nicer components.


Overview:

Les Petits Pirates is played in two phases per round. In the first phase all players roll Action dice for their pirate ships and then place them in turn order. In the second phase each Action die is resolved from the lowest to the highest. This means that the player order for the second phase changes every round. Each die provides a choice of Actions, from attacking other pirates to plundering ports to burying gold. However, players are able to manipulate their dice by spending gold and resources to take their desired action. The first player to successfully bury twenty gold coins is the winner.


Accolades:

Les Petits Pirates has been tested at Protospiel and other game design meetups. Les Petits Pirates won 2nd place in the 2015 MicroGame Print and Play Contest on Board Game Geek. Les Petits Pirates was a finalist in the KBG Design Contest.


Print & Play:

Print & Play files are available in the Web Links section at the official page (at http://georgejaros.com/LPP )

180491.name: Love 2 Hate: A Party Game for Inappropriate People
180491.description:
From the publisher:

Love 2 Hate is the card game of finishing sentences (and laughing at the result!). The rules couldn't be simpler.

There are two types of cards, sentence starters and finishers. At the start of the game everyone draws a hand of 5 finishers. Players then take it in turns to act as the judge. A judge draws the top starter card. Example starters include Cosplayers, Moist Towelettes, Crabs, and Mimes.

Then the judge has a decision to make: love or hate?! Let’s say the judge draws the Hippies card. That can be played one of two ways:

I love the way hippies…

Or

I hate the way hippies…

The remaining players now look through their finisher cards and chose one to play, face down. The judge reads these aloud and then chooses the best one. What does best mean? That’s up to the judge, so know your fellow gamers! It might be the funniest, craziest, or most outrageous, depending on the judge, so choose wisely!

The winner keeps the card and play continues until one player gets 5 cards.

180492.description: 8 cards that add a back-story to each of the playable characters in the game, allowing for random character selection and better knowledge of the played Hero.
180492.name: Zombie 15': Hero Backstory cards

180493.name: Rayzer
180493.description:
From publisher blurb:

Special Deluxe Issue!

A Power Level 11 threat on his own, Rayzer is almost never alone. As a Renegade, Rayzer acts outside the law and by his own code. Whether the players see him as a villain or hero will very much depend on how they relate to him and the actions he takes. Rayzer is presented as a special deluxe-sized issue of Rogues, Rivals & Renegades with a map of his base and gorgeous art of his amazing submersible vehicle, the Karkarius! You'll also get details on "Rayzer's Raiders," the devoted soldiers who have allied themselves with Rayzer.

180494.name: Mako Shark
180494.description:
From publisher blurb:

"I Shall Rule the World beneath the Waves!"

A disgraced Olympic swimmer who was turned into a monster by the fiendish Doctor Jeste, Mako Shark (PL 11) has abandoned the surface world to focus on conquering Atlantis, though he has yet to ever defeat it's rule, King Ravas. Mako Shark deigns to work with the Overlords because their leader, Haupman Klaue, promises that the group's victory will lead to Mako Shark's own aquatic ascension.

180495.name: Student of War
180495.description:
From publisher blurb:

To hear most warriors talk, battles are won by heart and grit, by sharp iron and mighty thews. Yet the student of war knows that the key to victory is the mind behind the mettle, the training that guides the blade, and the knowledge of when and where to strike.

Prestige Class: Student of War.
Build Class: Fighter.

Role: Armed with knowledge and hardened by constant drill and practice, the student of war fills her repertoire with tricks and techniques designed to exploit every weakness and negate every advantage of her studied foes.

180496.name: Seikkailu vuorilla
180496.description:
From the publisher:

"Sniff has gotten into a trouble on the Lonely Mountains. He is stranded on a cliff after all the bridges have collapsed after him. Each player has to find 5 bridge steps among the tokens to build his or her own hanging bridge, and get over the gorge to help Sniff. A lot can happen on the way: one might get caught by the officious Constable, who wants to know who stepped on Hemulen's flowers, bridge steps might fall from a backpack, and the nimble Nibling eats them at once. Luckily Too-Ticky is enjoying the sunny day and if one is lucky he or she might get a lift from Too-Ticky on her hot air balloon. There are also some shortcuts along the way, but it takes a bit of luck to find them. The winner is the player who first completes his hanging bridge and gets to Sniff's rescue."

Seikkailu vuorilla ("Adventure in the Mountains") is a Moomin-themed roll-and-move game for 2-4 players.

180497.name: Wine and Blood (EGS)
180497.description:
From publisher blurb:

Zagreus tried his best to dissuade Zeus to resign in a thousand years, persuading him with wine and dance, to end the Heavenly Contest immediately, for Cosmos’ sake. But Zeus was adamant; the Heavenly Contest would go on and whoever among its contenders would have the largest number of followers within a thousand years would be appointed Cosmos’ new supreme ruler. Zagreus was left with a difficult choice: enduring a bad ruler in the future or taking part in the Heavenly Contest, being forced to spend time scheming instead of partying. Eventually, he chose the latter option; after all, he could use a little diversion from time to time from extreme partying and wine orgies.

Wine and Blood is the first supplement for Mythos, a setting of epic adventures in mythological Ancient Greece. This first supplement details Dionysus as he enters the Heavenly Contest as Zagreus. With his entry into the Heavenly Contest, Dionysus, as Zagreus, grows in Patron Deity potential with Mystery Cults, new heroes to sire, and new lands to explore!

Wine and Blood is designed for players and GMs and includes:

A new playable race – satyrs
New Qualities
A new Patron Deity entry covering Zagreus
Three new Mystery Cults
Information about the lands of India
Exotic beasts and tribes
Epic Tales
… and more!

rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
180498.name: Revolvers & Wizardry: The Discordant West
180498.description:
From publisher blurb:

This new OSRIC expansion includes new creatures, new magic, and new optional OSRIC rules not appearing in any other Usherwood Publishing product.

This OSRIC expansion material includes;

New character race options;
Half-gnoll; a generally despicable half-breed of human-gnollish parentage.
Minotaur; the mythic beast of Greek legends now turns cowboy.

New character class options;
The Desperado; a chaotic mixture of fighter and highwayman, the desperado brings thiefly skills to your Discordant West adventure.
The Doctor; part sage, part healer, part spell caster, the doctor brings to life a particular set of skills to the Discordant West.
The Gunslinger; judge, jury and executioner in the Discordant West. The gunslinger specializes in one-on-one combat in the form of the showdown.

Rules for firearms, lassos, dynamite, boomerangs, and mass brawls.
Challenge your players with 23 new monsters, and 18 historical figures imagined as Discordant West NPCs.
Reward your players with 12 new magical items, designed especially for western settings.
Integrate 19th Century technology for the wonderment of your high-fantasy PC's.




Inspired by the Usherwood Adventures campaign setting, the material contained in the Revolvers & Wizardry: The Discordant West is completely setting-agnostic, and easily adaptable to your campaign world. 84 pages of new material, and only to be made available in this publication. As all Usherwood Publishing PDF products, this book is fully forms-activated for Adobe ReaderTM (or other PDF-capable application) so you can include your own notes live, on each and every page.

180499.name: Madame Winter (Supers!)
180499.description:
From publisher blurb:

It was Natasha's dream to become the epitome of the fairytale. She had it all. Money, respect, and a mob boss for a husband. No one knows how she survived the plane crash that killed her dream or gave her fantastic powers. All everyone can agree on is that she has used these new found gifts to cut her way to the top of the crime family her husband once ruled. Beware the icy stare of Madame Winter!

180500.name: Hop la Puce
180500.description:
Hop la Puce is played with several colored discs, that are scattered across the playing area. Also in the playing area are two target rings. Players take turns launching a disc, in Tiddledy Winks fashion, trying to make them land inside a target ring.

Each player has three assignment cards that he tries to fulfill. Each card shows one, two or three discs inside a ring. If a ring contains the right configuration of discs, the assignment has been completed. The first player to complete all three of his assignments wins the game!

180001.name: Everyman Archetypes: Skald
180001.description:
From publisher blurb:

Rock on with Everyman Archetypes: Skald! From the mind behind Everyman Archetypes: Swashbuckler and introducing all-new author Justin Whitley, Everyman Archetypes: Skald provides all new options for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's heavy-metal performing class. Within Everyman Archetypes: Skald, you will find:

Six all-new skald archetypes, including the chivalric harbinger, the blood singer, the jarl extoller, and the unarmored canter. In addition, the jarl extoller has a second, unchained version herein to make it compatible with the unchained skald from Everyman Unchained: Unchained Rage.
16 new equipment tricks, called instrument tricks, for use with the Equipment Trick feat. Instrument tricks allow a skald to use his instruments in new and exciting ways and include four tricks available to all instruments as well as additional tricks that can only be specifically used with skald-favorite instruments like the horn, the drum, and the COW BELL!!!!!!!!!!
And much, much more!




With Everyman Gaming, innovation never has enough COWBELL!!!!!!!

180002.name: Iceberg Seals
180002.description: Each player gets an equal number of the 24 seals included in the game. Then taking turns, each player must place one seal on the iceberg without knocking any off. If a player does knock any off, then they get all the seals that fell off. The first player with no seals left is the winner.

180003.name: Move: The Corridors
180003.description:
User Summary

Wheel a corps through corridors, avoiding a naked bald man in a thong.

180004.name: Human Feats
180004.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Human Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to feats of ambition and daring for that most versatile, adaptable, and ubiquitous of all fantasy races: humanity itself! This product contains 15 mythic feats for both helping your heroic humans try anything and achieve everything, taking out and dishing out unimaginable amounts of punishment, from Fast Learner to Surge of Success, Fearless Curiosity to Martial Versatility, and Inexplicable Luck to Improved Improvisation (say that five times fast)!

Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

180005.name: Pages of War: M.O.D.E
180005.description:
This is the First in the Pages of War Series of Card Games: M.O.D.E (Men, Orcs, Dragkins, Elves)

Pages of War: M.O.D.E is a richly strategic game with simple mechanics and a unique flavour.

You take on the role of a bard of 1 of the 4 races in the western lands of the continent of Murghingale: MEN of the Blue Mountain, ORCS of the Black Hills, DRAGKINS of the Cloudy Peaks, and ELVES of the Verdant-Wood.

As a bard of one of these races your goal is to tell the greatest tale of its glory and strength by reciting the rhymes and songs of history.

BASICS:
Each player gets a deck (Historia) of 30 cards containing 22 heroes of 3 of the 5 suits (Axe, Bow, Sword, Lance, and Winged), 3 Jacks (generals of their 3 suits), 3 Aces (special tactics) and 2 monarchs (King and Queen).

The Goal is to create chapters (groups of heroes) that are strong enough to find the other players' Kings and Queens and destroy them - defeating other players' chapters and collecting their cards as spoils of war as you battle to achieve victory.

Once a player's King and Queen are destroyed they are eliminated from the battle to win but can turn the tide of combat with their remaining cards by adding their heroes to the chapters of other players.

180006.description:
This game looks a simple trick-taking game. Each player plays a power card and the player who played the greatest power card wins a treasure.

However, Victory points of the treasure is revealed to only one player(dealer). Other players have to guess the victory points with the power card played by the dealer. And be careful! The winner's power card becomes negative points as well.

Winning is not only getting victory points but also getting information. The winner becomes next dealer. Exactly, you may peek at both the treasure you win and the treasure of next round.

All players with negative VP are attracted to The Abyssuspolis and become cultists of The Old One. If at least one player isn't a cultist, he can call for aid and stop their intrigue. However, if all players do become cultists, THE OLD ONE AWAKENS. In this case, the player(s) with the most negative VP win! The Old One gives favor to people attracted to insanity the most.
180006.name: Fram R'lyeh

180007.name: HuniePop
180007.description:
HuniePop is a 2015 adult hybrid tile matching puzzle game and dating sim that was developed and published by HuniePot. Funding for the game was raised via a successful Kickstarter campaign and the game was released on January 19, 2015. HuniePop is available in two different versions, an uncensored version available via Humble Bundle and MangaGamer, and a censored version via Steam. The game follows the dating adventures of the main character as they try to woo several different women in their home town.

Gameplay focuses on the player (who can be male or female) interacting with several different women, each of whom has her own distinct personalities and preferences. The player can interact with women by talking to them and giving them gifts. Doing this rewards the player with "Hunie" an in-game currency that can be used to upgrade the player's stats. These stats allow the player to earn more points during dates, increasing their chance of success.

In order to progress through the game, players must take the women on dates, where they will play a tile matching game where they must make matches of 3 or more of the same tokens. The player must earn enough points to complete the date before they run out of moves. Each woman has specific type of token that they like and dislike, and players will gain more points if they match the type of token that woman prefers. The player can also use special items called "date gifts" during their dates which grant positive effects to help the player earn more points. After a successful date, the player is rewarded with a picture of the woman the date was with. Each successful date will also raise the game's difficulty, making subsequent dates require more points to complete. After 3 successful dates with a woman, the play will be able to take them on a date at night, and if that date is successful, the player can bring the woman to their bedroom for one final round of tile matching. Unlike regular dates, the player will have unlimited moves to complete the bedroom game, but the score meter constantly drains over time, so to win, the player must make matches quickly until the meter is full.

Throughout the game the player is guided by Kyu, a love fairy set on turning the player into a successful Lothario. She gives the player tips on how to interact with each woman, and explains how the game's various mechanics work.

Source: Wikipedia, "HuniePop", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

180008.name: Sheriff of Nottingham: Gambler's Risk
180008.description: This pack of promo cards contains one card in each player color. Each player starts the game with a Gambler's Risk. During the inspection phase, before you complete a deal, you may remove this card from play to double the penalty paid on that merchant bag, if it is inspected.

180009.description:
8 Mage Wars Arena promo cards made available through the 2015 Dice Tower Season 11 funding campaign on Kickstarter (part of Promo Pack A).

The cards contain creatures (Messenger of Bim-Shalla, Unstable Fire Imp, Dwarf Kriegshammer, Magma Golem), enchantments (Reinforce, Bind Spirit, Life Link) and a conjuration (Hidden Tunnels).
180009.name: Mage Wars: Dice Tower 2015 Funding Campaign Promo Card Set

180011.name: Elephonkey
180011.description:
From the box:

The hilarious and insightful game where... "Everyone has an opinion and every opinion counts!" - if you match!!!

Gameplay:
The object of Elephonkey is for teams of 2+ players to score points by matching their opinions with those of their teammates by listing and ranking the top 5 answers in each opinion poll. During each round, each team draws an opinion poll card and a category on the card is chosen by rolling the provided dice (one die decides the category while the other determines the point values). When the timer begins, each player begins listing their opinions (e.g. Top 5 Bruce Willis movies) on one of the provided pads. After 90 seconds, players compare their answers with their teammates and are awarded points for direct and indirect answers, unless otherwise stated. The game ends once one team reaches the pre-determined number of points.

180012.name: I-List Music Party Game
180012.description:
From the publisher:

"It's the fast-find song frenzy that pits your playlist against your friends' in a simultaneous music challenge for up to four players! Connect up to four MP3 players (not included) and let your fingers do the flyin' as you show what you know about your music collection. When you're done playing, use the console to play your favorite music! Plus, the console stores everything, making it easy for you to take this tune-tappin' song-matching game anywhere you go! Game console comes with cables, 60 cards, and instructions."

This unique game is played by everyone connecting their MP3 players or smart phones to the game console via the included audio cables. Players take turns drawing cards and reading aloud the categories. All players must then search through their playlists in a race to be the first one to play an appropriate song. If the song does indeed fit the category, that player earns a point; otherwise, they lose a point. Once all cards have been played, the game ends and the player with the most points is declared the winner.

180013.name: 5-Across
180013.description: An alternate take on the Connect 4 style of gameplay, 5-Across is a vertical game played with checkers. The board is placed on the stand to hold it vertically and players drop checkers into one of the 7 slots until one player succeeds in getting 5 in a row either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally.

180015.name: Murder Mystery Video Party Game
180015.description:
From the box:

Everyone loves a great party...with the Murder Mystery Video Party Game, you'll throw the party your friends won't stop talking about It's fun! To play, you and your friends assume the roles of the characters in the story. You act out your parts as the game is played.

When a popular restauranteur is suddenly murdered, no one is allowed to leave and everyone is suspect! Why is Miss Svenson so emotional about the murder? Who is Oscar Himmel and what does he know about Miss Swift? At THREE POINTS in the movie, the detective will tell you to stop the video, question your suspects and pick up clues to track down the killer. Is Fred Simms really an aluminum siding salesman? Who is the floosie hanging around Mr. Engels and where did the waiter disappear to?

A thrilling whodunnit! YOU FIND THE KILLER and YOU SOLVE THE MURDERS. But watch out, your character may be the next victim!

180017.name: Pig Out, Pete!
180017.description: Pig Out, Pete! is an electronic game in which Pete moves around and makes funny sounds as he throws up plastic food. Every 15 seconds, Pete will throw up a piece of food and players must dig through a tray of slime/gunk (much like Gak) for a plastic food piece of the same color. Once a player finds the correct piece, they set it aside along with the matching piece that Pete threw up. After Pete has fully purged himself and all of the pieces have been collected, the player with the most wins.

180020.description:
Experimental virus outbreaks have escaped the lab and only you can stop them! Face the pandemic and compete to be the first to eradicate the virus by isolating a healthy body. Ethical or not, all means at your reach are valid to achieve victory. Use your wits to boycott your rivals' efforts and win.

Each turn in Virus! you either play a card or discard any number of cards, then you replenish your hand to three cards. Cards can be:


One of four organs (or the joker organ)
One of four viruses (specific to each organ or the joker virus)
One of four pills (specific to each organ or the joker pill)
A special action card


You can play only one of each organs in your player area. Pills and viruses can be played on any player's organs, but only on the same color organ. A second pill on any organ immunizes it against infection. Your goal is to be the first to have four healthy organs in front of you.
180020.name: Virus!
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ61: Especial Dau Barcelona 2016

180021.description:
This is a deduction through conversation game. Exercise your vivid imagination and infer the thing that comes into your opponent’s mind by using the sense of touch.
Due to the nature of the game, the visually impaired people can enjoy and play, too!

//story

In ancient times, when the mammoths and dinosaurs walked the land, or perhaps even before that, there was a civilization called “Dattakamo”. Its people excelled at making things out of clay, of which they made many: from what they found at the bottom of the ocean, to what they saw in the beyond the galaxy; from flowers and animals around them, to things from the imaginary future. They treasured what they had made, and lived happily. One day, however, a volcano suddenly erupted and the civilization perished.

Time flew by, and now in the present, the works of the “Dattakamo” people have been excavated and brought into the Academy. What are they? Some of the artifacts are broken; others, with strange and bizarre shapes. All of them were treasures of the “Dattakamo” people.

In the Academy, a renowned professor and his students sit around these artifacts. The professor wonders what the pieces are, while his students discuss his ideas earnestly.

// Game Progress

The purpose of this game is that the students guess right what the professor imagines. The students ask the professor three questions, one at a time, during their turns. This is called the “discussion”, and a discussion has 3 rounds. The professor has to answer correctly these questions. During this phase, students can freely touch the piece as many times as they want.
If a student manages to make a correct guess, he gets the piece from the professor.
When all the players have finished playing the role of the professor, the game ends and the player who acquires the most artifacts is the greatest professor ? and wins!
180021.name: The Mystery of Dattakamo

180023.name: Crítico: La revista de rol (nº 7 - Summer 2015)
rpg: Omertà, el poder de la mafia
A Song of Ice and Fire Roleplaying
180023.description:
Entradilla de la editorial:

Número 07

Publicado en Verano de 2015

Versión física. Versión digital.

68 páginas a todo color

Incluye:

La balada de los hijos traidores. Durante la rebelión de Robert Baratheon, los hijos de varios señores menores decidieron desobedecer a sus padres y mantenerse fieles a los Targaryan. Sus padres les declararon traidores. Ellos no están de acuerdo. Una aventura para Canción de Hielo y Fuego, por Jorge Mir y David Bueno (JalfDaltonics)
El ojo de la tormenta. Una antigua máquina sumergida puede convertir cualquier viaje marítimo en una horrible pesadilla. Un encuentro para RuneQuest 6 de la mano de M. Alfonso García.
El Sistema d13.
Cuenta atrás en el Cotton Club. Una familia deja el negocio, y eso deja un gran vacío. Se están rifando varias balas, y los personajes tienen unas cuantas papeletas. Una aventura para Omertà por Jorge Mir y David Bueno (JalfDaltonics)
Silvis Gelida. Una alianza de verano muy interesada en la felicidad de aquellos que viven cerca de ella. Un escenario para Ars Magica por Manuel Belizón.
El sistema d13: La víctima. Tira cómica de Joan Tretze.
El rincón del experto: Los artrópodos en los juegos de rol. Solemos conocerles como “bichos” y nos rodean por todas partes pero ¿qué secretos, beneficios y peligros nos ocultan?. Por Francisco J. Cabrero y Diego G. Tapetado.




From publisher blurb:

Issue 07

Published in Summer 2015

Physical version. Digital version.

68 color pages

It includes:

The song of the treacherous sons:During the Robert Baratheon's Rebellion, the sons of several minor lordings decided disobey their fathers and maintain fidelity to the Targaryen. Their fathers declared them traitors, but they don't agree. And adventure for Song of Ice and Fire by David Bueno and Jorge Mir (Jalfdaltonics).
The Eye of the Storm: An ancient machine sunken under the sea can transform any maritime travel in a nightmare. And adventure for RuneQuest 6 by M. Alfonso García.
Countdown in the Cotton Club. A criminal family goes out of business and the others rush to take its place. And adventure for Omertá by David Bueno and Jorge Mir (Jalfdaltonics).
Silvis Gelida. A summer covenant very interested in keeping the happiness of their environment. A game aid for Ars Magica by Manuel Belizón.
The d13 System: The Victim. Comic Strip by Joan Tretze.
The Expert Corner: arthropods in the RPGs. We usually know this creatures as 'bugs' and they are everywhere, but... What secrets, beneficts and dangers they hide?

180024.name: 500 Malicious Cards
180024.description:
500 злобных карт ("500 Malicious Cards") is a Russian-language adaptation of Cards Against Humanity.

Игра "500 злобных карт" - веселая и взрывная игра для вечеринки, авторизованная локализация популярной американской игры Cards Against Humanity. Игра строится на спонтанном, иногда абсурдном, юморе: один игрок тащит из колоды историю или вопрос, а другие — выбирают из 10 доступных им вариантов самый смешной ответ! Немного веселого цинизма, и парадоксального остроумия - это то, чего нам всем так не хватает. В игре много юмора на грани и “взрослых” тем.

180026.name: McGuffin
180026.description:
A hidden roles card game game. Play either the NASTI party or the Foundation to either keep or gain the true McGuffin. Each player takes a role and is given a McGuffin card. On each card there is a special ability to help your team win.

The Archaeologist starts the game with the true McGuffin, the Maltese Falcon. Play is decided randomly. A player may use either the special ability on his McGuffin card or his character card. There is one round per player, so a 6 player game lasts 6 rounds. The NASTI players must use their McGuffins and special abilities to acquire the true McGuffin. They must keep it for one whole turn to win the game. For the Foundation players to win they must stop the NASTI players from retaining it for one whole turn. Special abilities allow the players to look at other cards, acquire them and to reveal others. Characters who die are replaced by others randomly, this may affect the outcome of the game.

180027.name: Middle Empire
180027.description:
Middle Empire summed up in one sentence - "Think Settlers of Catan combined with Risk, played in 30 minutes."

In Middle Empire, you are in a race to construct and defend the winning number of empires before the other players, while holding the other players back! Middle Empire is a strategy board game that can be learned in 15 minutes and play a full game in 30 minutes. Middle Empire provides engaging and dynamic game play in every game, fun for 2-4 players.

Middle Empire is an easy to learn, quick playing strategy board game where players compete to obtain the winning number of empires through construction, defense, and attack cards. Players can construct their own strongholds on new spaces and upgrade them to empires or attack other players to obtain more strongholds. From your construction cards, you decide where to place a stronghold on the board or to upgrade to an empire. Strategically time the picking and playing of construction, defense, and attack cards! Should you attack the weaker player to further your game or try to hold off another player from winning in the next few turns? Can you protect your empires from others before another player can sneak attack you?

A typical turn consists of picking 2 new cards for your hand and playing up to 3 cards:

Construction card - you can expand your presence on the game board or upgrade your current spot(s) to empires for more points

Defense card - you can pick various cards to defend yourself from other opponents and properly set yourself up for the win

Attack card - you can attack other players in hopes to take over their territories and build them into empires

180028.name: Thunder Hamsters and the Temple of Cheese
180028.description:
In Thunder Hamsters and the Temple of Cheese, players take on the role of one of the legendary Thunder Hamsters while they delve into the fabled Temple of Cheese. Players have several paths to choose from and will encounter large wheels of cheese, traps, guards, items of all sorts, and many other wonders.

This game has story-telling at the heart of it. As each encountered item is revealed, the player must make up a story to indicate how to pick up/ward off/handle the situation. Once the story is told, a judge is picked from the other players at the table and the story is ranked on a scale of likelihood. The player then must make a die role to determine the attempt's success or failure for that encounter. Other players may also toss in a coin to challenge the original story and a roll-off ensues.

Rules guide the players in basic mechanics such as movement, but the story-telling aspect opens up the game to nearly limitless possibilities.

180029.name: Alkemy: Aurlok Nation Starter Box
180029.description: The Aurloks are largely organized into nomad tribes, following the rhythm of the seasons and the migrations of the animals they hunt. They are generally a peaceful people, but do not underestimate them for this appearance! Their war-songs can echo as quickly as a thunderstorm in the summer. The Aurloks then become savage and merciless warriors whose wrath is guided by their totems: the Manitous.

boardgameimplementation: ACTOP: Ancient Construct Tower of Philosopher
180030.description:
User summary:
古代建築 (Ancient Construct) is a 3-dimensional puzzle game in which 24 pieces comprised of a total of 99 blocks are piled on top of one another in a chimney-like stack. The player who stacked the greatest number of blocks through their pieces wins!

There are six 3-block pieces, ten 4-block pieces, seven 5-block pieces, and one 6-block pieces, for a total of 24 pieces. This allows 2-4 people to play. If anyone makes the tower collapse during the game, they lose. The blocks are slightly uneven, so the game demands 3-dimensional spatial awareness, a good sense of balance, and dexterity in stacking.

Publisher's summary:
99個のブロックからなる24個のピースを煙突状に積み上げる、立体パズルゲームです。
積み上げたピースの総ブロック数が多い人が勝ちとなります。
3ブロックピースが6個、4ブロックピースが10個、5ブロックピースが7個、
6ブロックピースが1個の合計24ピースなので、2～4人で公平にプレー出来ます。途中で倒したら負けです。
ブロックは微妙に歪なので、立体空間認識とバランス感覚と積み上げる手先の器用さが必要とされます。
180030.name: Ancient Construct

The Friend
Cute Enough to Kill
Vampire Cat
