The Criminal Rings of Nova Vaasa
The Domain of the Endless Word
180033.description: Issue 21 is billed as "A Ravenloft Netbook" on the cover and has an all new layout and presentation.

180035.description:
It is the final stage of the 9th five-year plan and the oblast Odusad is still behind the expectations of the State Committee for Agriculture. After poor harvests in the prior years things finally look better and the comrades are looking forward to a bountiful harvest. The pumpkins are tall as tractor wheels and the flowers smell sweeter than ever. If only those pesky weeds will not spoil everything. The head of the Kolkhoz “Druzhba” has proclaimed the “Operation: Dandelion” in order to get rid of the weeds before they completely take over the farm.
All the comrades will have to work together if they want to save the harvest and fulfill the five-year plan. It will be challenging, but it can be done!

Operation: Dandelion is a light-weight cooperative family board game.
It is played over 5 rounds. During each round additional weed tokens will be placed onto the Farm Tiles while the players will move around and clear the fields from these weeds. They have only a limited number of actions available and as the game progresses it becomes more and more challenging to keep the weeds under control. Farm Tiles can be overgrown, the oblast government might send additional support and the players can work overtime – but will it be enough?
180035.name: Operation: Dandelion

180036.name: The Kids vs. The House
boardgamefamily: Card Games: Draw and Discard Games
180036.description:
You and your friends are tired of having all your great stuff go missing. You know it's that creepy house on the corner, and you have had enough. You are each going to gather a group of friends from the neighborhood and make a mad dash into the house to try to get your items back.

To start The Kids vs. The House, players determine how many items — as few as one and up to twenty — they need to recover from the house. This allows them to customize the length of their game.

You then flip the fist item card over and see how many kid team points you need to have to try to get the item back.

Each player starts with two cards from the Action/Kid deck. This deck contains kids from the neighborhood worth 1-5 points each that you add to your hand to try to build up a team with enough points to retrieve the item. There are also four other types of cards that cause things, do things, and help protect you from the creepy things that can happen in the house:


Chaos cards always go off when drawn. Chaos she is a harsh mistress.
Protection cards are used to prevent or deflect many of the negative events and actions in the game.
Incident cards can be played on other players during your action phase to try to disrupt their chances of acquiring the item.
Trap cards always go off when drawn, with the house apparently trying to defend its ill-gotten gains. Beware the house!


During your turn, you draw a card from the Action/Kid deck. If it doesn't instruct you to play it immediately (traps and chaos cards), then you can put it in your hand. You then have the option to perform an action. If you have a card that is playable (Incident and some Chaos), you can play this on the other players to help yourself or hurt their chances to win.

Turns proceed around the play area until someone has at least as many points in their hand as shown as the target number on the item. Once that minimum is met, they can choose to fold their hand and place it face down. They now cannot be targeted by any incidents, but can be affected by Chaos and Trap cards.

Once a person folds, everyone yet to play in that round draws one card, then everyone reveals their cards to see who has the most points and clams the item.

If this wasn't the final item, shuffle the cards and repeat with the next item. When the final item is claimed, the person with the most points at the end wins.

---
We currently are planning a Kickstarter launch in August 2016

180037.description: Keyflower: Pig Shelter, a new village tile for the Keyflower, parallels the Sheep Shelter included in Keyflower: The Farmers. Pigs placed in the field formed by the tile may be allocated to the pig shelter. At the end of the game, each allocated pig scores the indicated number of points.
180037.name: Keyflower: Pig Shelter

180038.name: Botology
180038.description:
User Summary

A company is conducting tests for a new system for the remote control of robots. The purpose of the company is to help future potential buyers explore the remote space systems.

180039.name: Nie Tej!
180039.description: Nie Tej! is a traditional card game, very popular in Poznań, based on memory and bluff. It consists of 55 colorful cards and instruction with a mini-dictionary of Poznań dialect.

boardgamecompilation: Villages of Valeria: Deluxe Kickstarter Edition
180040.description:
A village-building card game set in the world of Valeria. Establish resources, construct buildings, and attract adventurers to your Village to be crowned the next capitol city.

Each player takes a turn taking one action from the following list and all other players may follow the action but with fewer rewards:

Tax: Take 1 Gold and Draw 1 Card. (Follow: Draw 1 card.)
Harvest: Draw 3 Cards. (Follow: Draw 1 card.)
Develop: Discard 1 card to add a Resource to your village. (Follow: Discard 2 cards to add a Resource to your village.)
Build: Add a building to your village. Draw a card. (Follow: Add a building to your village, but do not draw a card.)
Recruit: Pay 1 Gold to add an Adventurer to your village. (Follow: Pay 2 Gold to add an Adventurer to your village.)

Building cards can be used for 2 reasons. 1) Pay resources to add it to your village as a building and gain its benefit and VP. 2) Develop it as a Resource and place it under your Castle card.

When building, use resources you have developed or pay another player 1 Gold to use their resource.

The game ends when a player has built or recruited 10 buildings/Adventurers.
180040.name: Villages of Valeria
boardgameexpansion: Villages of Valeria: Bard Promo Card
Villages of Valeria: Rahdo the Guild Master Promo Card
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 42 - Unpub 7 Experiences and Gloomhaven Impressions
New Games A Plenty
Podcast 9 [March 2016]
Podcast EP05 – Entrevue avec Professeur Board Game
Villages of Valeria
WIPNcast 141

180041.name: The Magic Shop
180041.description:
The Magic Shop is a game of magical, mercantile mayhem! Players each assume the role of a wizard or witch running their own magic shop, using ingredient cards to to concoct potions, talismans, scrolls, and magical weapons and armor with the help of your apprentices. Apprentices are sent into the market to gather magical ingredients and advertise to potential customers, or you may have some stay in the lab to help with the work of enchanting.

Ingredient cards are placed into your "cauldron" to produce a dice pool. This dice pool is then rolled in an attempt to complete enchantment lines (sets of specific dice facings). Players may opt to try and add more dice to their cauldrons to complete additional lines to make their items more valuable, but risk drawing magical accident cards that may make their apprentices vanish, curse the item, or turn some of your hard-earned gold into lead.

Cast spells to help you in your endeavors by having an apprentice visit the caster's tower, or hex your opponents to give you an edge in your quest to be the greatest magic shop owner in the city.

Try to anticipate your customers' needs when they arrive and sell them as many of your finished items as possible and pave the way to your victory! Victory Points are earned primarily by making the most gold selling your enchantments, but victory points may also be earned from completing all enchantment lines on a magic item. Points may be lost if your items end up cursed. The wizard or witch with the highest number of victory points at the end of eight turns is considered the winner.

180042.name: Elemental Conflux
180042.description:
Elemental Conflux is a game of dueling elements.

Each player summons elemental creatures to the battlefield to fight for dominance over five elemental nodes. Players create five stacks of creatures that will do battle, with the highest strength totals winning the battle.

Spells and certain powerful entities will make combat interesting and exciting. Summoners conjure additional creatures to their stack, Elemental Lords reduce the strength of the opposing elements' stacks, mighty dragons win no matter how many creatures oppose it (but can be thwarted by a wish from a Djinn) and cunning Wizards will very literally mix things up!

Cast spells to turn the tide of battle. Fires of destruction might rain down, eliminating cards from your opponent's stack, a divination will allow you to peak at your opponents stack before battle is resolved, or a mighty whirlwind might scatter creatures into each others stacks.

Battles commence, and the player with at least three out of five winning stacks takes control of one of five Elemental nodes. The player who takes control of at least three out of five elemental nodes wins the game.

180043.name: Mutated Marine Minion & The Kraken (ICONS)
180043.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Mutated Marine Minion is one of the loyal foot soldiers to the salt walter villain known as the Sea Monster (see WMW 5) who claims to be sent by the ocean itself to punish mankind for all it has done to her.

They are ready to cause briney mayhem in your ICONS game either alongside Sea Monster or freelancing on their own...

180044.name: Descended from Dragons: Kobold Archetypes
180044.description:
From publisher blurb:

Huge Draconic Power in a Tiny Package!

Everyone’s favorite underdogs, kobolds have been a fan favorite since 3rd Edition. Whether it’s their connection to dragons, and the promise of tapping the potential of their draconic blood, or their love of cruel and unusual traps and hazards, or simply their adorable high voices and the silly things they say, kobolds are great fun and provide lots of options for player characters…except for the fact that mechanically, they’re about as weak as you can get.

This book aims to give players who want the fact that their character is a kobold to be more mechanically relevant a way to make that happen, while also providing support for kobold characters of a variety of classes that don’t typically make much mechanical sense for kobolds. Included are the kobold crafter, an alchemist archetype that specializes in traps, the kobold jester, a bard archetype that is a master of appearing weaker than he really is, the kobold king, a fighter archetype that focuses on improving his ability scores and eliminating their racial weaknesses, the kobold revolutionary, a ranger archetype that focuses on combating larger foes, and mobilizing other kobolds as allies, the kobold spell scale, a sorcerer archetype that allows them to unlock greater draconic power than sorcerers of other races could ever dream of, and the kobold mystic, a wizard archetype that is adept at avoiding harmful magic, and gains some spontaneous casting ability.

180045.name: Ladrones
180045.description:
Ladrones ("Thieves") is a party-game, created by David Vaquero, easy to learn and very funny to play. In this game, 2 to 5 players fight each other for being the best white collar thief.

The players will try to form a band of specialist in some criminal skills, like strong-box opening or server hacking, to perform the most risky robberys. They could draw cards from the deck or place the highest bid to form their crew.

When a player is ready to carry out a robbery, he will announce it and will replace its specialist cards by the respective color specialist dices. The player will have only 30 seconds to get the perfect combination in any dice by throwing them as many times as necessary.

After the assault, it doesn't matter if the player has had success or not, it's time to go out and run. The player will have another 30 seconds to throw the Driver's dice to left behind the police and scape.

The game will finish when all the plans of robbery run out or all the available diamonds have gone. The player who has the biggest diamond amount is the winner.

180046.name: The Special Abilities Compendium
180046.description:
From publisher blurb:

Victory's Special Abilities in ONE Book!

Magic, Martial Arts, Mechanica, Powers, and Psionics; the things that set Characters apart and ahead! The Victory System Core Rulebook introduced a big selection of these Special Abilities, and we've added more as time has gone along.

Now, we've compiled all of the Special Abilities produced up to this time in one book, the Special Abilities Companion! This book includes not only all of the Special Abilities that were included in the Victory System Core Rulebook, but all of the Abilities introduced in our Villain Gazette's, Prosthetica, Thralls of Victory, The Ministry, Disciples of the Blade, The Agency, Project Demna, the Mechanica Companion AND the Powers Companion!

Also included is a set of charts for randomly selecting Special Abilities of every type for those times when you want a little Chaos thrown into the mix!

Also includes the Toolkit from the Victory System Equipment Manual for creating and modifying Special Abilities to suit your needs; everything from Player Character researched Magic Spells to custom-designed Mechanica and more!

Finally, the Special Abilities Compendium includes statistics for all of the NPCs that can be created or summoned by Special Abilities. As a bonus, there are also copious warnings for Game Masters to read over Player-created Special Abilities, you know, just in case.

Here it is, all in one place! What new Abilities will you find for YOUR Victory Campaign?

180047.name: Major Damage
180047.description:
From publisher blurb:

Right from the pages of the best-selling WatchGuard Sourcebook comes the "Rise of Regent" WG Solo series!

Meet ULYSSES!!

Never-before-available in any format! This newest solo release features a major character from the WGU's latest setting! Removed from his own time, his own country, his own world, and thrust into a horrific science experiment only to be tormented through various operations without anaesthesia, Major Damage arises from the ashes of his previous life to wage war against intergalactic tyranny! Add this powerhouse hero with a chip on his shoulder (and a cannon on his arm) to your cosmic arsenal now!

180048.name: Wardenhale Sewers
180048.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Wardenhale, the city with a thousand names. City of Shadows. CIty of Trade, City of Justice. Wardenhale is like every city, and yet like no other"

Wardenhale Sewers is a printable dungeon floorplan compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. It can be used as a standalone gameboard, or combined with any same-scale tileset.

Wardenhale Docks is a geomorphic set, comprising 8 10x10 square battlemaps and 5 5x10 rectangular end-piece battlemaps which can be arranged in multiple layouts. Whilst most of the tiles depict an underground sewer system, one tile depicts the sewer entrance on the surface, and fits with the other Wardenhale city tiles. The 5 end-piece battlemaps are ideal for giving a natural edge to a geomorphic tile.

The set can be used on it's own, or joined with any of the Wardenhale range to make a huge and diverse city.

180049.description:
You’re tougher. Meaner. Better equipped. You’ve taken on a drekload of challenges the Sixth World has thrown at you, and you’ve survived. Barely, sometimes, but that’s enough. You’re walking with a certain confidence, maybe even a little strut. You’re ready for the next thing the streets are going to throw at you.
At least, you think you are. Now you’re going to find out.

High Caliber Ops is a massive expansion for the award-winning Shadowrun: Crossfire deck-building game. How massive? How does two new character roles, more than a dozen new Black Market cards, fifty new obstacles, and a large bundle of new Karma upgrades sound? On top of that, we’ve got five brand-new missions, and a set of basic cards with new art. Taken together, you have the tools for high-powered, high-risk, high-reward shadowruns. Add High Caliber Ops to your Crossfire game to see just how much danger you can take on!
180049.name: Shadowrun: Crossfire – High Caliber Ops

180050.name: Star Wars Death Star Perplexus
180050.description: A puzzle in the round, an obstacle course on a roll. 360 degrees of orbital track filled with mind bending turns, brain-thrilling twists and jaw-dropping stunts that will challenge you, inspire you and have you wondering how can something so easy to pick up, be so hard to put down! There are 115 steps to beat this maze game.

180051.description:
Pani-High! is a card game in which players scramble for twelve Place cards. When the deck runs out, the player who obtained the most Place cards will be the winner.

Game play
Sum up the points of the Combat cards played by 2 players. Player with higher points will be the winner.
The point of this game is that after the match with the Combat cards, the losing player's Combat cards will be discarded, and the other Combat cards return to the hand of the player who won the battle.

To win the battle, you must also place the large number against other player.

However, in such a case, the winner's deck of cards will be exposed and remembered by other players, which will be disadvantage for next rounds of the game.

MOVIE : https://youtu.be/1WHRnpZgUuw
180051.name: Pani-High!

180052.name: Rhythm Destruction
180052.description:
Rhythm Destruction is a rhythm / shoot em up(shmup) game. Inspired by classics such as Ikaruga and infused with the intensity of addictive rhythm gameplay, it is unlike anything you've ever played before.

Source: Facebook.

180053.name: Into the Odder
180053.description:
User summary
Three new character types for Into the Odd:

Weirdos from The Underground (mutants)
Simple Folk (non-industrial age)
Unhumans (demi-humans)

180054.name: Sumoku
180054.description:
Sumoku by Blue Orange Games™ is a unique crossword-style game with numbers. Players add up tiles to multiples of the key-number shown, connect them, and that is Sumoku! Each line of unbroken tiles (both columns and rows) must be a multiple of the key number. For example if the key number is 5, then the set of tiles must total 5, 10, 15, 20, etc… But a tile may not match the same color as another tile in that line of unbroken tiles (row or column). Points are scored for each tile played and the other tiles that form the new line of unbroken tiles.

Hager Apps chose to release the Apps using the Freemium model. For a payment ads shown after playing a Game Center turn can be turned-off. An additional feature face-to-face play for 2 to 5 players by passing the device can also be unlocked.

Source: The Publisher Website.

180055.name: YamSlam
180055.description:
User summary
The iOS adaptation of the YamSlam dice rolling game.


Risk taking and strategy are needed to win Yamslam. Players roll 5 dice with red pips for even numbers and black pips for odd numbers to get the best combination. There are only 4 chips for each combination, so its a race to claim a chip before they are gone.

When all 5 dice match, the player has rolled a Yamslam! There’s not a chip for that. Instead the player takes any chip and a bonus turn.

Hager Apps choose to release the Apps using the Freemium model. After playing a Game Center turn an ad is shown. The ads can be removed, making it a standard app, for a payment. An additional feature of solitaire play or face-to-face play by passing the device can also be unlocked.

Source: The Publisher Website.

180056.name: Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer
videogamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
180056.description:
Discover your inner designer and interact with your favourite Animal Crossing characters in a whole new way in Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer for Nintendo 3DS family systems!
Put your decorating skills to the test and design wonderful homes to suit any animal! Find out what an animal wants out of their abode, then turn their dream home into reality. Listen to their requests, pick a style, finish it off with the perfect furniture and other decorations, and create happy homes for everybody!

Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer uses amiibo cards based on Animal Crossing characters. When you scan an amiibo card from the Animal Crossing series, you can design that animal’s room. When you’re finished, you can scan more amiibo cards to invite other animals to the room, then watch them have fun together or even snap a photo.

Source: The Game Website.

180057.name: Animal Crossing: Amiibo Festival
180057.description:
Now you can play with Animal Crossing characters as amiibo! In Animal Crossing: amiibo Festival for Wii U, the animals will race around a board game town where the seasons change just like they do in other games in the Animal Crossing series. Animal Crossing: amiibo Festival also includes some other minigames for you to play using Animal Crossing amiibo cards.

Animal Crossing: amiibo Festival will release as a special bundle that includes the game, two amiibo figures and three amiibo cards.

Experience the Animal Crossing universe in a light-hearted board game which changes based on the seasons and seasonal events
Bring your amiibo to the party, collect Happy Points, play with your friends, and save your Happy Points to your amiibo to
expand your own game even more

Use Animal Crossing amiibo cards in fun minigames

Source: The Game Website.

180059.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from London's highest viewing platform.
180059.name: Monopoly: The View from the Shard

180060.name: Yo-Kai Watch
videogamehonor: 2014 Japan Game Awards Best Game of the Year Winner
2014 Japan Game Awards Game of the Year Winner
2016 D.I.C.E. Handheld Game of the Year Nominee
2016 Golden Joystick Nintendo Console Game of the Year Nominee
180060.description:
YO-KAI WATCH™ is a Japanese phenomenon – a franchise about hundreds of sometimes cute, sometimes spooky, and usually mischievous Yo-kai that secretly inhabit our world. They’re hiding everywhere! Find them, befriend them, turn them into a team on your Yo-kai Watch, and then challenge evil Yo-kai to help people in need on Nintendo 3DS family systems!
With your Yo-kai Watch, now you can finally see the normally invisible Yo-kai hiding everywhere in your town. Many of them are causing trouble in people’s daily lives, so you’ll need to assemble a team of six Yo-kai on your Yo-kai Wheel and call upon them when you need their help. Every Yo-kai has a unique personality and abilities, so it will take some strategy to form and change your team to address various problems and fight evil Yo-kai.

Source: The Game Website.

180062.name: Extreme Exorcism
videogamehonor: 2015 SXSW Best Indie Game of the Year Nominee
180062.description:
Extreme Exorcism is a game about a haunted house and the woman hired de-hauntify it.

You play as Mae Barrons, a medium with an unconventional way of dealing with ghosts. Instead of crystal balls and seances, Mae brings an arsenal of shotguns and rocket launchers to ensure the ghosts learn their lesson.

After each ghost you eliminate, another one will appear to copy your every move. Every action will come back to haunt you if you aren’t careful.

Progress through 10 rooms with 20 different weapons to choose from. Once you’ve beaten your high score in single player, try out the multitude of challenges in chalenge mode or fight your friends in a deathmatch or two.

Source: The Developer Website.

180063.name: Typoman
180063.description:
Typoman is a two dimensional puzzle platformer distinguished by a unique game world. You slip into the role of the HERO struggling to make your way through a dark, surreal world. Despite your small stature you have a powerful gift: You can use letters to alter your environment!

Be the HERO and set out on the journey to become whole and gain the powers you need to defeat the giant, evil demon that rules the world you are trapped in.

Source: The Game Website.

180065.name: Mario Tennis: Ultra Smash
videogamehonor: 2015 Gamescom Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
180065.description:
Compete with friends in the multiplayer Mario Tennis: Ultra Smash game on the Wii U system. Along with the fun and dynamic gameplay known to the franchise, surprise your opponents with a new move to the series, the Jumpshot, which sends the ball flying down the court. Change the sport up with new Mega Battles, using the Mega Mushroom to gain an advantage over the competition. Claim your spot in Mario Tennis lore in singles (1v1) or doubles (2v2) as you play with and against family, friends or the CPU using returning and new characters to the series.

Source: The Publisher Website.

180066.name: Espada Negra: Juego de mesa
boardgameintegration: Espada Negra: Juego de Mesa – Edición Gunear
Espada Negra: Juego de Mesa – Edición Gunear
180066.description:
Espada negra is a game card set in the lands of Dormenia in which players control a powerful family in the kingdom. With a system of dynamic and entertaining auction, players will have to manage their assets and serve the military power of their opponents to get new cards resources, troops and win the coveted points.

-

Espada Negra es un juego de cartas ambientado en las tierras de Dormenia en el que los jugadores controlarán a una poderosa familia del reino. Con un sistema de subastas dinámico y entretenido, los jugadores tendrán que gestionar sus bienes y atender al poder militar de sus oponentes para conseguir nuevas cartas de recursos, tropas y los ansiados puntos de victoria.

180067.name: Mario & Sonic at the Rio 2016 Olympic Games
videogameseries: Mario & Sonic at the Olympic Games
180067.description:
All of your favourite Mario and Sonic characters are ready to join the fun in Rio, the host of the Olympic Games in August 2016.
Take the rivalry on the road with supercharged Olympic events like Football and Table Tennis in the Nintendo 3DS version, or see if you've got what it takes to hang with the best in the Wii U version, with events like Football, Rugby, and Beach Volleyball!

Source: The Publisher Website.

180068.name: DOJO game
180068.description:
Defeat your friends to win honor become Master of the DOJO! Choose a fighting style, build your character, and crush the competition!

Dojo is a fast paced, martial arts, card-drafting, character building contest of smashing your friends and trying to earn HONOR from the MASTERS of the DOJO.

Choose a Fighting Style with unique abilities and advance down the Fire or Water path.

Training Phase: Do Drills to improve your basic stats; Strength, Dexterity, and Chi. Study Techniques, which can be used multiple times during combat but expend your energy. You may also plan Tricks which are one time use and will likely catch your opponents off-guard.

The MASTERS of the DOJO watch over training, and if you please them, they may award you Honor. MASTERS may want you to build up your strength, and others prefer tricks!

Sparring Phase: Use the tricks, techniques, and drills that you've learned to take on your opponents in head-to-head or group combat. You can additionally use the abilities granted by your Fighting Style.

When Sparring begins, the combatants "Size-Up" each other, betting energy to see who will get the first strike.

Every opponent you knock out will earn you Honor and bring you one step closer to becoming MASTER OF THE DOJO!

180069.name: Pathfinder Society Face Cards
180069.description:
Back of the Box

Bring your NPCs to life with Pathfinder Society Face Cards! More than 50 recurring characters from Pathfinder Society Organized Play campaigns fill this gorgeously illustrated deck! Each card includes the character's name and role, space to record key details, and artwork by Paizo's finest illustrators. Usable in Pathfinder Society adventures or any fantasy games, these Face Cards bring the colorful and prominent characters of the world-spanning campaign to your table!

180070.name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel II
videogameseries: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel
videogamehonor: 2014 Japan Game Awards Best Unreleased Game Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best PlayStation Exclusive Game of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Song of the Year Winner
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Story of the Year Nominee
2016 Operation Rainfall Awards Game of the Year Nominee
180070.description:
The sequel begins a month after the end of the first title, with Rean having escaped with Valimar. He makes it to his hometown of Yumir where princess Alfin also escaped to, but she is kidnapped along with Rean's sister Elise. The rest of class VII has scattered over the country and he goes around gathering them and other Thors students, and after being given the airship Courageous by Olivier uses Valimar to help civilians and look for Alfin and Elise. The coup turns out to have been a plot by the leader of the Noble Alliance, lord Cheyenne, a descendant of the false emperor who had been defeated by emperor Dreichers, ancestor to the current imperial family, to gain power, and the Witch of the Abyss Vita, third apostle of Ouroboros, had been cooperating with him to fulfil the Illusion Flame project by making the Blaze Demon Castle appear and have the two knight-gods, Valimar and Ordine duel there. When Ordine loses, however, Cheyenne awakens the red knight-god Testarossa and thus the End of Vermillion, a legendary demon-god armed with a thousand weapons.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

180071.name: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel
videogameseries: The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel
180071.description:
The game takes place at the same time frame as Zero and Ao no Kiseki in the Erebonian Empire. Players who played the aforementioned prequels will be able to notice the overarching plot concerning the The Legend of Heroes series, such as the formation of the "that police unit" in Crossbell state and the conference between the three countries a few month after amongst other tidbits. The game's plot is centered around the newly formed special class "Class VII" in Thors Military Academy, composed of both aristocrats and normal Erebonian citizens. Class VII is the only class in the entire academy that does not segregate the two different social classes. The game follows Class VII throughout their school year, mainly around the times when Class VII receive special field training that takes them all over Erebonia.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Legend of Heroes: Trails of Cold Steel", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

180072.name: Nation
180072.description:
Nation is a great game of tactics and military strategies where the diplomacy and the ruse of each player take precedence over the chance and the stroke of luck.

The object of the game is to build 1 capital and 10 headquarters.
Each player starts with a Capital, represented by a hexagon with a star.

The game is played in turns:
1- Raising army
2- Moving armies
3- Fighting
4- Building headquarters

The Capital and headquarters are providing movement and force points (1 each to a limit of 6).

Movement points are used to move pieces (tanks, ships and fighters).

Force points are the force of a unit (including Capital and HQ) have to attack or defend. Units can be combined from adjacent hex, the force with the higher points total win, the defeated force must retreat according to specific rules. If a unit cannot retreat it is destroyed (Capital and HQ cannot retreat)

HQ are constructed if a player has at least one tank on a city hex.

180075.name: The Alien Wasteland
180075.description:
User Summary

Battle your way through hordes of aliens to get petrol cans for your car.

180080.description: A children's game in which you have just finished school, and you have to go back home with the least possible distractions. The game teaches children some basic principles about life. The game play is just roll and move.

180081.name: Crusher
180081.description:
Crusher is a fantasy trading card game that can be played with various deck sizes: A Skirmish game involves no deck, just a starting hand of 7 cards. A Clash game uses 20-card decks. A Battle game uses 40-card decks. A War game uses 100-card decks.

180082.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Claws of the Wyrm Warband

180083.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Emerald Valley Warband

180084.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Dungeons of Crystalia Tile Pack

Beware the things that go bump in the night! The Glauerdoom Moor is a haunted land filled with restless spirits, walking dead, and cackling witches. Von Drakk Ghost house lets you battle through the graveyards, spooky mansions, and villages of this cursed realm.

Von Drakk Ghost House expands your games of Super Dungeon Explore with 12 unique dungeon layouts and new creeps that are compatible with your existing dungeon tiles, ensuring no game is ever the same.
180085.name: Super Dungeon Explore: Von Drakk Ghost House Tile Pack

180086.name: Cthulhu Deckbuilder
180086.description:
Cards of Cthulhu a deck building game is centered around the Lovecraft genre which Cthulhu is famously known by.

In the game you will compete to build a better deck than the other investigators, defeat Ancient Ones, all the while not going insane.

Cards of Cthulhu is a deckbuilding game where you and up to 4 other players each strive to build the best deck, called your library and score as many victory points in order to win the game. Each player starts the game with the same library, 7 Strengths and 3 Fears. Players shuffle the library and deal themselves 5 cards. Each Strength is worth 1 power. Fears are worth nothing. The opening hand can have from 2 to 5 points of power. The main deck of cards is then dealt 5 cards out to the Storyboard. If any events happen, do what the card says, otherwise, check for card's with surprise effects (which usually add to your insanity). Now the first player takes their turn. They can use their hand of cards to buy items from the storyboard based on their cost (and, in the case of Horrors, the insanity level to banish them). Non-horror cards are placed in that player's graveyard, Horror cards are banished to the banished stack. At the end of the turn, the player draws their five cards again, if the library lacks sufficient cards, shuffle the graveyard back in to the library and complete the rest of the five card draw. The play is passed on to the next player, who then refills the storyboard from the main deck of any cards that were purchased or banished by the prior player. Resolves and event and surprise effects and then their turn starts.

Insanity rules - In the game, it is very important to track just how insane you are! Everyone starts out totally normal - with zero insanity - event, surprise effects and using certain arcane or artifacts will increase or decrease your insanity. If you reach 13 insanity, you have crossed over and succumbed to insanity. At this point, the only way to reduce your insanity is playing cards that reduce your insanity or discarding cards to reduce your insanity by the Victory Point value of the card. You'll need to do this as soon as possible because if your reach 20, you've completely lost your mind and are a vassal for the Ancient Ones (or, in game terms, you just lost and are out of the game).

Ancient Ones - Before the game is started, you separate the Ancient Ones, Azathoth, Hastur and Cthulhu are shuffled and put on the bottom of the stack. Yig is taken out and the rest are shuffled and put on top of the stack. Then Yig is placed face up on the stack. While the Ancient Ones are face up on the stack, they have an effect, called The Haunting - which impacts the game. Yig, for example, cost 8 points to defeat, however, his haunting effect is that, for each two banished Horrors, Yig costs 1 more point to defeat. If three Horrors are banished, Yig would cost 9 points to defeat. When a new ancient one is revealed from the stack, which happens after one has been defeated, they have a one time "awakening" attack - this is an effect that happens immediately when they are turned face up and the attack is against each player. If the player has a defense, they can defend against the attack - if allowed. For example, Ithaqua's Awakening Attack is that each player puts all Allies from their graveyard back in to the story.

Psychic Blast - These cards are put in a stack outside of the main deck or the Ancient One's. They cost three points and can be purchased at anytime during your turn. Sometimes the storyboard will contain cards you don't want or can't buy and you can always buy a Psychic Blast if you would like. When a Psychic Blast is destroyed, it is placed in the destroyed pile. If the stack is empty, no more Psychic blasts can be purchased.

Corruption - These cards are put in a stack outside of the main deck or the Ancient One's. Card effects that say you gain a corruption are from this stack of cards. Corruptions are have a -1 victory point, which, costs you points at the end of the game if they are in your library. When a Corruption is destroyed, it is returned to the corruption stack. If the corruption stack is empty, no more corruptions can be handed out to players.

Investigators - Each player represents an investigator, a Gangster, Law Enforcement, Nun, Priest, Private Investigator, Professor or Psychic. Each investigator has a special ability that allows them to do their special thing during their turns. The Psychic's ability allow that player - at the beginning of their turn, to look at the top two cards of their deck and then put one of those cards in the graveyard. Most of the time, this will help the player select the best of the two cards, possibly discarding a card they would rather not draw, sometimes both cards would work very well, but they still have to discard one. Other abilities affect the cards drawn, power of cards, the storyboard and so on.

180087.name: Ohunkakan: The Living Myths
180087.description:
An Ever-Changing Land of Myth and Power

The old stories still live. Tale-tellers practice their art, the constant flux of their tellings and retellings weaving an ever-changing tapestry of myth that shapes the fabric of reality. Landmarks, villages, and even the patterns of stars shift across the landscape, the familiar freely mixes with the mythic, and elements of dim ages stubbornly persist alongside images pulled from modern Earth. Even today, a tale told powerfully enough might just become true.

Ohunkakan: The Living Myths presents an ancient recursion. Spun from the traditional stories of the Lakota people, shaped and reshaped by the timeless war between the Thunderer and the Horned Serpent, and peopled by spirits, Ohunkakan is vivid and changeable: every object seems to shudder and breathe with life as if freshly imagined. Find creatures, artifacts, characters, and a fascinating, highly detailed description of this unique recursion in Ohunkakan: The Living Myths.

This free PDF contains an expanded version of the Ohunkakan recursion from The Strange corebook. The Ohunkakan recursion replaces Thunder Plains from the first printing of the corebook.

- From Publisher's Website.

180088.name: Ground Pounders:  The STAR CORPS Card Game
180088.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ground Pounders is a card game of STAR CORPS combat. It simulates the battles of the Corporate-Colonial Wars of the late 22nd Century. It simulates those battles on a scale much larger than the STAR CORPS miniatures rules normally allow, with most Force Cards representing a Company (which is 4-10 squads).

User description
The game is played with large Force Cards face up in front of each player. Each Force Card has both a Victory Point and Hit Point value. Once enough damage has been done to a card to equal or exceed it's Hit Points, the unit is eliminated and the player who eliminated it gains it's Victory Point value.

The players are also dealt a hand of smaller Action Cards which are not revealed when dealt. Action Cards are generally played to inflict damage to enemy units, although some activate other effects such as healing friendly units or allowing a player to draw additional cards.

Games may be played either until a player has reached a set Victory Point total, or until only one player has units remaining.

180089.name: Return of the Warlock
180089.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Swords & Wizardry Mini-Dungeon
For 4-6 Adventurers of Levels 2-4

The spirit of an evil warlock returns, demanding a rematch against the heroes who slew him. Thing is, those heroes have been dead for years. Someone’s got to take their place. Maybe he won’t notice the difference...

Return of the Warlock is part of a series of mini-dungeons designed to drop into existing adventures or campaigns. Use them as side quests or a way of getting in a quick adventure when you’re short on time.

180090.name: Realms Beyond the Perisphere
180090.description:
From publisher blurb:

Planets of Peril await!

Realms Beyond the Perisphere is Iron Throne Publishing’s homage to pulp adventures set on exotic planets as written by golden age Sword & Planet luminaries such as Edgar Rice Burroughs, Otis Adelbert Kline, and Leigh Brackett.

Rocket through the canals of ancient Mars!
Prowl the haunted caverns and grottos of Luna!
Battle the winged apes and the cloud frigates of the Venusian Potentate with raygun and steel!




This supplement contains new S&P character archetypes, rules for psionics, alien races, skills, rayguns and more!

180091.name: Everglow 5E
180091.description:
From publisher blurb:

Expanded on the 5th edition expansion, this book brings you more Ponyfinder content for your 5th edition game, including:

Premade level 1 characters
Feats
More Races
Ponyfinder Gods
Backgrounds
Bestiary

180092.name: We Be Goblins Free!
180092.description:
Back Cover:
After losing chieftain after chieftan, the Birdcruncher goblin tribe finally found competent leadership in four goblin "heroes"--Reta Bigbad the fighter, Chuffy Lickwound the rogue, Poog the cleric of Zarongel, and Mogmurch the alchemist. But it turns out leading a tribe of goblins isn't much fun, and the newest Birdcruncher chieftains are bored. In order to cure their doldrums, the chieftains have issued a new demand--find them some adventure, or else!

Eager to please their great chieftains, the Birdcruncher goblins frantically try to whip up all sorts of amusements, including goblin games, feats of skill, and a grand feast. But trouble arises in the midst of the goblins' feast for their mighty leaders--the goblins who went to harvest truffles for the feast got beat up by some stinky humans!

Now the Birdcruncher chieftains find themselves getting more adventure than they bargained for as they venture to the Bestest Truffle Field to pick up the slack for their bumbling minions. Will the goblin heroes be able to make it to the field, find the treasured fungus, defeat the mean humans, and make it back to the tribe in time to enjoy their well-deserved feast?

We Be Goblins Free! is an adventure for four 4th-level goblin characters, written for the award-winning Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. The adventure takes place near the Devil's Platter in Varisia in the Pathfinder campaign setting, and serves as a sequel to both We Be Goblins! and We Be Goblins Too!, Paizo's popular 2011 and 2013 free RPG Day adventures!

180093.name: PinBox 3000
boardgamepodcastepisode: 18. Devon Dice Podcast - Warring colons
180093.description: The PinBox 3000 is a cardboard, assembly-required, customizable, modular arcade "art-cade" system of tabletop pinball, and gravity-powered games.

180094.name: RPGA Members Handbook (Apr 1998)
180094.description:
Introduction to role-playing; introduction to the RPGA (role-playing gamers network) UK - membership, structure, process, tournaments, initiatives, RPGA magazine, game systems supported, events, conventions, clubs; live-action role-playing; The Living City: Sarbreenar; References; Retailer List; cartoons.

Announces May 1998 issue of Polyhedron UK (it was actually published July 1998).

180095.name: Crown of Qthuken
180095.description:
User summary:

Adventure resources and setting development. Includes region (Vinland), city (Port St. Willem), notable NPCs, adventure areas, and encounter lists. Tone matches that of Pits & Perils quite well.

180096.name: Robot Fuantaji RPG Worth Blade Start Set
180096.description:
Translated Title- Robot Fantasy RPG Wares Blade Start Set

Basic boxed set includes a rule book, players guide, 3 10-sided dice, a sheet of stand-up figures, record sheets, and scenario book including the introductory adventure "The Mountain of the sleeping Demon" and advice for running the adventure.

180097.name: Wares Blade Expansion Set 1
180097.description: Expansion boxed set includes an added Rule Book (includes character professions, advanced rules, more mecha information and additional spells), the Western World Guide (with more information on the campaign area, NPCs, and additional monsters that could be found there), and a map of the campaign area.

180098.name: Wares Blade Expansion Set 2
180098.description: Expansion boxed set includes an Added Rule Book Vol. 2 (includes advanced combat and magic rules, more mecha information, medicine, monsters, and additional spells), the Western World Guide Vol. 2 (with more information on the campaign area and NPCs), sheet of stand-up counters, new record sheets, and a map of the campaign area.

180099.name: Wares Blade Expansion Set 3
180099.description: Expansion boxed set includes a the Word-Casters Handbook (with more detailed information on word casters and how they live, train, their mecha, NPCs and places of learning, etc.) and the Words book (with all of the spells in one place for Word Casters, Missionaries, and Monks, as well as more detailed rules), new record sheets, and spell sheets.

180100.name: Wares Blade Expansion Set 4: Thored of Ryude
180100.description: Expansion boxed set with the World Guidance of Ryude book (with detailed world information on the countries with powerful military power (ie mecha), NPCs, and mecha) and the Manners for Warriers book (includes more detailed information on mecha combat, more mecha, mecha repair and upgrades, etc.), new mecha stand-up figures, an mecha arena map, and cardboard mecha status markers.

180101.name: Wares Blade Eastern Expansion Set 1
180101.description: Expansion boxed set with the Manners for Eastern Adventurers book (includes new character races and Eastern themed changes to all the character classes, magic spells, weapons, etc.) and the World Guidance of East book (with new monsters, NPCs and campaign information), and the List Book for Eastern Adventurers book (with new spells and fighting techniques), a map of the Eastern countries, and new character record sheets.

180102.name: Wares Blade Eastern Expansion Set 2
180102.description: Expansion boxed set with the World Guidance of East book 2(with new monsters, NPCs, mecha, places, and campaign information), and the List Book for Eastern Adventurers book 2 (with new spells and fighting techniques, and monsters), a maps of the Eastern countries, and new character record sheets.

180105.description: Scenario book with NPC's and detailed information on the adventure.

180106.name: Wares Blade Scenario/ Supplement Book No. 2: Inferno in Gmoniedus
180106.description: Scenario book with NPC's and detailed information on the adventure.

180107.name: Wares Blade Screen
180107.description: GM screen with 4 section double sided GM screen covered with game rule information and a booklet included that has the adventure "Plundering People of LesCard", general NPCs, and a a selection of adventure plots.

180108.name: Wares Master File Game Scenario Vol. 2  Act 2 (1): The Disappearing City

180111.name: Game of Fox & Geese
180111.description:
Cards are placed center of table, stacked, face down.
Each card has four of these numbers on it (1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9)

First player calls a number, turns over top card, reads number.
If number called is one of four digits on card, player keeps it.
Otherwise it is placed faced down on bottom of main pile.
Next player does the same procedure, and so on.

When all cards are taken, he who has the most wins.

180112.name: June 2015 Free Monster of the Month: Psychokinetic Slime
180112.description:
from publisher blurb:

Celebrating Octopus Apocalypse's 100th published monster, it's the Psychokinetic Slime!

"Psychokinetic (PK) slimes are not so much a creature as they are an unending torrent of astral slime held together by psychokinetic force. PK slimes are connected to the Plane of Ooze, a relatively small sub-plane that exists between the Astral and Ethereal planes. The PK slime uses this connection to constantly replenish itself and spew blasts of slime without diminishing its body mass."

180113.name: Recruitment Drive
180113.description:
Distributed for Free RPG Day 2015

Includes quick start core rules, pre-generated characters, and brief introductory adventure.

180114.name: The Sword of Izim
rpgitemversion: La Spada di Izim Softcover version
The Sword of Izim PDF version
180114.description:
From the back of the book:
Nel cuore della desolazione di Zandor, si erge un picco solitario, come un’immane sentinella di guardia a un’Impero ormai morente. Si dice che in passato questo luogo ospitasse un ordine di guerrieri, posti a custodia di qualcosa di molto potente e pericoloso al tempo stesso.

English translation:
In the heart of the desolation of Zandor stands a solitary peak, like the guardian of dying Empire. It is said that in the past this place would host an order of warriors, that took care of something very powerful and dangerous at the same time.

180115.name: The Trials of Idavare
180115.description:
The Trials of Idavare is a card-based party game for 9–27 players. Join a fierce battle of truth and deception, a battle of conviction that threatens your very life. As your faction struggles to claim Idavare, well-chosen words are more precious than any card dealt, and a single misstep can mean certain death. Victory depends on your ability to debate, lie, reason, and – should the night call you – move silently...

In The Trials of Idavare, every player secretly receives a faction card and a skill card. At night, the evil, sneaky werewolves transform into beast form and take a villager's life. During the day, the villagers must determine who is a creature of the night and hang them before the last one of the innocent is inside a werewolf's belly. Besides their senses and wits, some villagers have useful skills at their disposal that might help in battle – just pray the skill is not used by a werewolf...

180116.name: Ultima Forsan
rpgissuearticle: Supernaturalia 3 - Goran e la pentolaccia maledetta
180116.description:
From the back of the book:
Alla fine del Medioevo, il Flagello dei Morti si è abbattuto su Europa, Africa e Asia, dando inizio all’era più buia della storia. Oggi, nel 1514, gli eroi dei Nuovi Regni sono pronti a combattere per riconquistare il Mondo. Ultima Forsan è un gioco di avventure selvagge e minacce mortali, ambientato in una versione macabra e alternativa del nostro Rinascimento.

English translation:
At the end of the Middle Ages, the Scourge of the Dead has hit Europe, Africa and Asia, beginning the darkest era of the history. Today, in 1514, the heroes of the New Kingdoms are ready to fight to regain the World. Ultima Forsan is a game of wild adventures and deadly threats, set in a macabre and alternative version of our Renaissance.

180117.name: Next
180117.description:
From the game website:
È il 2014 e, dopo lo shock che ha investito il mondo sul finire del 2012, Terra-Z ha già ripreso la sua vita, dimenticandosi di tutta la follia che li ha investiti; gli H.E.R.O. convivono malamente con la società umana e, se una vera e propria regolamentazione mondiale sembra sempre più inverosimile, per alcuni questi superumani rappresentano ancora un ideale di perfezione a cui ambire.

English translation:
2014, after the shock that hit the world in late 2012, life on Terra-Z goes on, forgetting all the madness that has invested it; the H.E.R.O. coexist awkwardly with human society and, if a true global regulation seems increasingly unlikely, for some people superhumans still represent an ideal of perfection to be attained.

rpgdesigner: Hermanos Juramentados de la Espada Negra
180118.name: XIII Runas (nº 0 - Summer 2015)
rpgartist: Hermanos Juramentados de la Espada Negra
rpgproducer: Hermanos Juramentados de la Espada Negra
180118.description:
Entradilla de la revista:

68 páginas a todo color.

Primer ejemplar de la revista XIII Runas que te ayudará a explorar y conocer el mundo de Espada Negra. Incluye:

Manual del juego de mesa. Resumen de reglas.
Creación de personajes dormenios. Resumen de reglas.
Personajes atípicos dormenios. Consejos para aumentar la diversidad de tus partidas.
Invirtiendo motivación. Consejos para jugadores.
Mercado en CDLXXII. Ayuda de juego.
Semillas de eternidad. Aventura de intriga.
La Espada de Soid. Aventura de dungoneo clásico.
El cantar de la muerte. Cómic.

First issue of XIII Runes. It will help you to explore and know the Black Sword's world. It includes:

Board Game Rules. Black Sword's card game Rules summary.
Dormenian Characters. Rules summary.
Atypical Dormenian Characters. Game aid to augment the character diversity in your games.
Spending Motivation. Game aid and tips for players.
Market at CDLXXII. Game aid.
Seeds of Eternity. Intrigue-based adventure.
The Sword of Soid. Classic dungeoneering adventure.
The Song of Death. Comic.

180119.name: Nuscheln
180119.description: You say a phrase and the others have to guess what you are saying. Too simple? No, because you have to poke your tongue out or bite on your tongue or ... during talking.

180120.name: Pyrami-des
180120.description:
The goal of the game is to filled all the values on a pyramide using dice compbinations.

By throwing 3 die, choose 2 and add them up or multiply them up. Find the result on the pyramid and put a token on it. You must start by the bottom of the pyramid and climb up.

You get 3 wild values that you can use during a game to place a additional token on a vlaue of your choice (it must be a valid choice from the bottom to the top).

You get 3 chances to pick an unused dice from an opponent during the game.

180121.name: Saban's Adventures of Oliver Twist: Das große Spiel
180121.description:
You roll a dice, select a direction and move this number of fields. You try to reach one of the adventure fields, which allows you to challenge one of your opponents. The winner gets one chip. If you go on a field, on which an other player is standing, you can steel a chip from them.
The first, who has 7 chips wins.

180123.name: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten: Das Spiel
180123.description: You roll a dice and move your character as many fields on the board. The field, you reach tells you which kind of challange eg drawing, acting, you have to fulfill. The first, who has 15 points wins.

180124.name: Oktro
180124.description:
This is a game for 2 players.
Each Player has pawns in 4 Colors (1 Player large pawns the other small).
Each player has start fields for his pawns on one of the sides of the board. The players start regions are on the opponent sides of the board.
All fields are connected with horizontal and vertical lines.
The fields are colored (1 of the 4 colors of the pawns) or black.
On Players turn he can move 1 pawn in one direction as far as he wants and no other pawn is on the way.
The pawn can be moved on the position of an opponent pawn. This opponent pawn is out of the game.
Independent of this if a pawn is now on a colored field the opponent is only allowed to move the pawn with this Color in his next turn. If the player has choosen a black field the opponent may choose any of his pawns.
The player who cannot move the allowed pawn in his turn looses.

180125.name: Pixel Twist
180125.description:
In the game, players rotate a field of different colored blocks until the blocks are aligned such that they form a picture. The game is similar to the Flash game Coign of Vantage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pixel Twist", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

180126.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Mansons, a company in New Zealand.
180126.name: Monopoly: Mansons TCLM Limited

180127.name: Unter uns: Das Spiel
180127.description:
Each player gets a secrect card with 4 characters, which he has to move to his target fields in his corner of the board. The first player fulfilling this wins.
At the beginning the 16 pawns are placed in the corners and the 9 caps, which can hide the pawns, are placed in the middle of the board. Each turn you move one of the pawns to an adjacent field or jump if it is occupied and additional move one of the caps.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Meralco, a company of the Philippines
180128.name: Monopoly: Meralco

180129.name: Guess Who: Super Hero Squad
180129.description: Guess which super hero or villain the other player selected. Narrow down the options by asking yes or no questions.

180130.name: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten: Das Spiel zur Serie
boardgameversion: Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten Das Spiel zur Serie RTL Edition
180130.description:
The game is based on the German TV series "Gute Zeiten Schlechte Zeiten".
The whole game board has square fields like a chess board.
There are additional drawn walls which separate parts of the boards from each other (rooms). The lines have spaces where the rooms are linked (doors).
There are 20 differnt pawns representing each a different character of the TV series.
At the begin of the game, each player gets 2 cards of the character stock, showing each 1 character/pawn and a room Card showing 1 room.
The player who is first to get his 2 character in the room of his room card wins.
On players turn he rolls 2 dice and moves 1 character for each of the die the number shown. Movement is allowed horizontal, vertical and diagonal also with changing while moving. Moving through walls is not allowed.
One of the oppenents (the fasted) may say which charcter is owned by the actual user. If this is right the Player has to show this character card and has only 1 die and 1 move in his next turns.
If the opponent is wrong, he has to show one of his character cards with the same effect. If a player has to Show his second card, he looses and is out of the game.
The game can also end if only 1 player is in the game. This player has won the game.

A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from NASPL, stands for The North American Association of State and Provincial Lotteries
180131.name: Monopoly: NASPL

180132.name: Bibelspiel 1
180132.description:
It's a dominio game where children should learn about the stories of the bible and there "historic" series.
The start stone shows the Genesis. The activ player tries to find the next matching Stone/story from all stones which lie open in the middle of the table.
The game should lead the children asking questions about the bible stories, which main content are discribed in little books in the game.
There are Stones allowing to continue different bible series in different directions.
All Player win when they can finish the stories.

180133.description:
This game is an auction that should not be a successful bid.
Exhibit of this auction is Rubbish.
Players have participated for appearance.

All players will sealed bid against Rubbish in order.
The successful bid was the player to bid the Rubbish, and then deducted the bid amount from the honor points.
Lowest price of the player will get the rights of the next of auctioneer.
All of the other players will be added points the bid amount of money to honor points.

Seven of Rubbish is the end of the game at the time has been a successful bid.

In fact, all of the players, has been assigned the role of a secret at the start of the game.
Rubbish that has been written on the role of the secret will be bonus points.
And honor points, the sum of the bonus point of Rubbish, the highest person is the winner.
180133.name: Rubbish Auction
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast 004 – Essen 2015 Diary!
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 017 – Our Podcast Subscriptions

180134.name: Die Sendung mit der Maus: Was passt dazu?
180134.description:
The game persists of 7 panels in different colors, which show the 'Maus' in different situations and 7 cards of each color with suitable items . One card of each color is put on the corresponding panel, the others cards are shuffled and build a stock. The players have time to memory the items on the panels, then the cards are turned facedown.
The topmost card of the stock is taken and shown to all players. The first player, who says which hidden item is laying on the panel of the same color as the card drawn, gets the memorized card and the new card is put on the panel facedown.
The game ends if the stock is empty, the player with the most cards wins.

180135.name: Sei auf der Hut!
180135.description:
This is a trivia game about dangerous situations in life.
The game board shows 6 situations where a person behaves wrong.
Each player gets a puzzle of 6 pieces which shows one of the situations on the board, but with the right behavior.
This is the counter, how many questions each player has answered right.
On players turn he gets a question from a card deck about dangerous situations in life and how to behave right in this situation. With each question answered right the player places one of his puzzle pieces on the board. Who places first all 6 wins the game.

180136.name: Der König der Löwen: Das löwenstarke Familienspiel
180136.description:
The cards are put on the suitable fields on the board. You roll a dice and move your pawn as many fields, fields with no card or an other player on it do not count. You take the card your move ends on and take the corresponding action.
The game persists of 3 chapters, Simba as a child in the steppe, as a teen in the jungle and as an adult at Pride Rock, fighting against Scar.
You can leave the steppe after you have found 3 pairs of animals, you can leave the jungle if you own 3 particular cards. At Pride Rock you have to find 3 cards with a lightning on it and then reach the scar field with the exact number on the dice.

180137.name: All Is Dust
180137.description:
User Summary

All Is Dust is a survival horror game that takes place during a dust storm in the 1930s and revolves around a mystery surrounding a decaying farm.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements about offshore technonogies. Version is equipped with elements of the oil and gas industry, including tokens revamped to include a helicopter, drill bits, safety helmet, scuba diver and a remotely operated vehicle.
180138.name: Monopoly: OE Offshore Engineer

180139.description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Rotary Club of Mount Isa South West, Australia.
180139.name: Monopoly: Rotary Club of Mount Isa South West

180140.name: The Altar of Tenoch
180140.description:
From publisher blurb:

Surrounded by lava, the altar to the Demon Tenoch is secret to all those except those corrupted souls that call themselves Acolytes of Tenoch. Whilst some believe the altar is just a place of worship, others believe that Tenoch herself is imprisoned in the lava, waiting for her rebirth.

Need a quick map for an encounter?
A printable battlemap compatible with any RPG/Dungeon-Crawl game. Use as a standalone gameboard, or combine with any same-scale tileset.

Contents: A 20 x 20 cave map depicting an lava cave and a shrine. Featuring magma, boiling lava, statues, chains and carvings - it's the ideal location for demons, fire elementals, dragons and other encounters. It's also ideal as a temple for an evil cult, lava golems or a magic summoning chamber.

180141.name: Unexplored Space
rpgartist: United States National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)
180141.description:
From publisher blurb:

All of "Unexplored Space" can now be yours to explore, and it's all in one volume. This book outlines everything of interest in Sectors 22-41 of the Ephemeris universe. Find new species, new mysteries, the ruins of ancient civilizations, and unexplored worlds just waiting for exploration.

180142.name: 10 Angelic Magic Items
180142.description:
From publisher blurb:

Equipment as angelic as you are!

Sometimes you want to sit down to a full meal of archetypes, base classes, feats, magic items, npcs, prestige classes, traits, classes, or spells, and sometime you just want a cheap, quick, and easy snack. To feed your craving Rite Publishing presents the “10 Series” which will presents 10 pieces for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game.

This time out we bring you 10 new magical items to supplement the Angelic Paragon from In The Company of Angels.

Compassionate weapon special ability: Don’t just deal nonlethal damage but also paralyze foes you don’t wish to harm.
Celestial Lenses: enhance your angelic senses so you can see what troubles the mortal world.
Sandals of the Celestial Step: Dance on the head of a pin or about the battlefield with a free 5’ step.
Bracers of Purity: Get rid of those annoying debilitating effects by granting yourself a second saving throw.
Gauntlets of Contrition: Force an opponent to do nothing but repent his sins, so you can focus on tasks that are far more important.
Helm of Heaven’s Ire: Gain a gaze attack that afflicts your foes with biblical curses.
Ring of Celestial Salvation: Expend all your providential power and save yourself from death or banishment by sacrificing this ring.
Tabard of Angelic Paragons: Enhance your innate heavenly gifts beyond that of other angels.
Baldric Empyrean: you enhance your celestial weaponry or gain the celestial weaponry class feature as a 5th level angelic paragon, so you too can fight like an angel.
Shawmay-Aphim “Heaven’s Wrath” Legacy Item: Let your magic item level up with you, and provide you with the glorious weapon for celestial conflicts!

180143.name: The Undead Sea Scrolls (Issue 1 - Jan 2002)
rpgissuearticle: Things That Bump in the Night
180143.description:
Subtitled the "2001 Edition", this issue was released mid January 2002.

Content focused on the worlds of Ravenloft and Masque of the Red Death. Primarily created by the online community Kargatane.

Things that Bump in the Night - Scientiae Arcanum

Things that Bump in the Night - Mythica Nephos
180146.description:
Subtitled the "2003" edition, the issue was actually published February 16, 2004.

Focuses on the Ravenloft and Masque of the Red Death campaign settings.

180147.name: Clue: Doctor Who
180147.description:
Doctor Who CLUE places your favorite characters on a search through the Universe to rescue The Doctor. Playing as his closest friends and allies, players must reveal who amongst them the Daleks conditioned and mind-controlled to mislead the Doctor, what powerful weapon was used in the crime, and where The Doctor has been taken in the kidnapping, thereby saving him from the Daleks!

"Standard" Clue cards that this version shares include:

6 Suspect Cards: Amy & Rory, Commander Strax, Madame Vastra, Clara Oswald, Jenny, River Song

6 Weapon Cards: Hallucinogenic Lipstick, Clara Cyberman Gun, Vortex Manipulator, Strax's Gun, Sonic Screwdriver, and The Moment

9 Location Cards: Platform One, The Moon, Gallifrey, Skaro, Trenzalore, The Library, Starship UK, Demon's Run, Victorian London

In addition to the above common components, the game features a few slight variations from standard CLUE:

Rules for 2 player games are included in the game rulebook
Each of the player characters also include special abilities
This version also includes cards for a theme-specific variant in the form of 21 "Intrigue" cards, 13 of which grant players special abilities, and 8 of which are 'pocketwatch' cards that may potentially end the game.

180148.description:
The Fully Loaded Expansion Pack is a set of new cards and dice that you can add to any COGgs game! It includes three new types of cards and a new set of dice that you can mix in to create even more intrigue and challenge!

The Legends set add notorious outlaws from history; The General Store brings gear and day jobs; and The Newspaper lets you spend your hard-earned loot to get ahead!

The dice in this pack let you change the odds when doing jobs, so you can plan ahead and adjust the risks and rewards to suit your posse's current strengths and weaknesses!
180148.name: Wanted: The Outlaws – Fully Loaded Expansion Pack

180149.name: Drunken Bear Fighter
180149.description:
From the introduction:

In this RPG you will play Russian agents who combat the drunken bear menace present in the modern day Moscow underground.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Chrysler, a multinational car company.
180153.name: Monopoly: Chrysler Town & Country Road Trip Edition

180154.description:
It is a cold winter day when Sherlock Holmes receives Inspector Gregory into his office in Baker Street. The inspector shudders a few seconds from the change in temperature, rubs his gloves, then finally takes off his coat and accepts an invitation to sit down.

"A frosty morning, eh, Gregory? I think it takes a rather unusual murder to force you to come see me with this cold."

"Your deduction is sadly apt, dear Holmes. They killed Dr. William Young this morning, at eight, as he opened the clinic where he worked."

So begins "Murder Behind Closed Door," a single extra case expansion originally written by a fan in Italian, and later published by Asterion Press as an Asterion Gaming Days 2015 event promo for Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective.

Available for download on the Asterion Press website (after solving a hieroglyphic puzzle).

And translated into English by BGG Forum members and freely available in the Files section.
180154.name: Sherlock Holmes Consulting Detective: Murder Behind Closed Doors

180155.name: Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher)
180155.description:
ファイアエムブレム０（サイファー） ("Fire Emblem 0 (Cipher)") is a collectible card game based on the Fire Emblem video games. Currently, it is being released in Japan.

Both players choose one main character at the start of the game. All the cards in the game are character cards. Each character has a base attack strenght, as well as support strength (in addition to certain other powers and abilities). Each player has five 'orbs' ('life' represented by cards'), which the other player tries to get down to zero by attacking the main character.

There's five phases in a game.
1) Starting Phase
Untapping tapped characters, and drawing 1 card.
2) The Bond Phase
Playing 1 card into the ´bond´ area. Each card has a value (top left). The value of cards in the 'bond' area determines the value of the characters you can put into play.
3) The Sortie Phase
Play characters, or level up certain characters. The characters you can play depends on their card value and the value of cards in your ´bond´ area.
4) The Action Phase
Move your characters into the opponent's area; attack your opponent's characters; or use a skll.
5) The Final Phase
Skills that say 'during this turn' end, and the turn goes to the opposing player.

The goal of the game is to defeat your opponent's main character by destroying his 'orbs.'

180156.description:
Atlas Expansion adds to Mare Nostrum - Empires the 6th player including a game board expansion (increase map size by 50%), Atlas starting hero, 8 legions, 5 triremes, 5 fortresses, 7 control markers, 5 leadership markers, 9 resources, forum mat, and player screen.

Atlas Expansion includes new heroes, cards, counters, scenarios, and tiles with:

the 2 players rule book expansion;
the Barbarians (a special set with 3 triremes, 3 fortresses, and 8 Barbarians hordes);
Troy!, a military expansion;
Jerusalem!, a cultural expansion;
Syracuse!, an economic expansion;
the Mausoleum;
the Greek Fire;
the Myrmidons!
the Centaurs!
180156.name: Mare Nostrum: Empires – Atlas Expansion

180157.name: Village of Familiar
180157.description:
It's magic school's graduation season.
You are one of apprentice witches and to pass final exam to become a respectable witch.
The contents of the test is to make a comfortable village to live for your familiars!
While collecting the wealth of the forest, you will build magical tree houses.
Let's build the tree houses more and higher.

The game based on card-drafting in real time.
In the planning phase, you will gather planning documents(cards) to your drawer and can occasionally use magic to influence other players.
Then you can build magical houses in your village by setting these documents in the construction phase.
Your familiars can sometimes help you to keep resources in the forest. This may be important for earning more VPs at the end of the game.
After repeating 4 rounds of this, you will gain VPs from your buildings, the ability of those and the challenges that you could achieve.
The player with the most VPs wins the game!
