180160.name: Héroes del Acero
180160.description:
From the back of the book:

Surprising, exciting and addictive, this game-book, written and illustrated by David Velasco and Felix Sotomayor, blends the best of fantasy novels, video games and the world of the role. Dig in a land of magic and enemies, each action will help you improve your character's record . Fight to death, bet your coins, participate in drinking contests, discover treasures, steal nonstop, upgrade your armor, get new and powerful weapons, learn spells, get drunk in a tavern or enjoy the pleasures of the flesh in the company of a prostitute. All this and more is what awaits you in the mythical Land Úrowen, where the road to become hero will be fraught with surprises. Create your character, choose your race and profession and indulge yourself in the adventure in a dangerous world where every action you do and every decision you make mark all your future. 'Héroes del Acero' (Steel's Heroes) is a game-book in the style of the classic 'Choose your own adventure' that triumphed in the 80s, but it has a very dynamic and exciting gameplay, completely renovated and aimed at an adult audience, rules that allow you to enjoy the pleasure of throwing the dice, to improve your character and use countless objects, such as weapons and armors, potions, charms, coins to spend on vices, and so that each time will make you more powerful. Not surprisingly, to create this book the author has used a great experience for over 15 years as a tireless master role, and habitual consumer of console and computer games.

180161.name: En la Feria Tenebrosa
180161.description:
From the back of the book:

A new exhibition has settled on the outskirts of the village. Trying to break a little routine, you've been with your girlfriend Sofia to visit it; however, she does not attend the appointment. What could happen? When, alarmed, you start to look, you soon realize that in this place nothing is as it seems. Terror, magic and fantasy await at every corner, at every attraction. You'll have to take the plunge if you want to find and save her from the sinister evil that permeates everything. You are the hero of this story and you have to make decisions.

180162.name: Codes & Cyphers
180162.description:
From publisher blurb:

Knowledge Check is a product line for players and gamemasters. Each book is a collection of rules and information designed to add a little knowledge to any fantasy campaign, focusing on a particular aspect of the skill system and adding depth and breadth to your play experience.

Codes and Cyphers enters the world of secret writing, exploring the history of codes and cyphers. It introduces new spells, feats, an archetype, and even a set of codes to introduce into your game, and a band of codemakers and codebreakers to vex or help your PCs. Knowledge Check: Codes and Cyphers is the book to add a few letters and numbers of intrigue to your game!

180163.name: The Making of the Ghost Ring
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
180163.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Level 4 Adventure

To save a soul and forge a ring! A ghostly enchantress calls for aid, her salvation hanging in the balance. Brave heroes are needed to complete the creation of a magical ring, a process that will take them from gritty city streets to sun-scorched deserts to the ruins of an ancient fortress atop a windswept peak. Are the adventurers up to the task or shall a sinister demon claim the souls of not only the enchantress but the heroes as well? Only luck, courage, and wits will triumph against adversity and allow the adventurers to claim the Ghost Ring for themselves!

180164.name: Ninja
180164.description:
From publisher blurb:

This edition of “Fantastic Feats” – a series of feats based around a certain theme or subject is about the mysterious and deadly Ninja.

The feats inside

Favoured Weapon Type - Gain a bonus when using a particular weapon
Improved Sneak - Sneaking is now more effective
Larger Ki Pool - Have more Ki to draw on
Master of Tracking - Escaping a ninja is now harder for your oppenets
Ninja Reflexes - Ninja reflexes can save your life
Stronger Poisons - Your poisions are now more potent
Superior Training - Your training gives you an edge over your peers

180165.name: The Totemic Sentinel (Hybrid Fighter/Druid Class)
180165.description:
From publisher blurb:

This issue offers a new hybrid built from the Druid and Fighter core classes. The totemic sentinel gains the power and strengths of a chosen animal totem, gaining natural attacks and the ability to shape shift into his chosen animal spirit. This supplement includes twelve animal totems to choose from ranging from the badger to the wolf.

A box set of four Zombicide: Black Plague survivors that were designed by Naiade. The survivors include:
Merieil
Apprentice Milo
Thundergut
Ostokar the Pale

Ostokar the Pale has an option to serve as a special Necromancer.
This box includes 6 Spawn cards for said special Necromancer.
180166.name: Zombicide: Black Plague Special Guest Box – Naïade

180167.name: Cities of Mystery
180167.description:
From publisher blurb:

Darkness Lurks Among Us

Whenever mankind gathers, sins gather with them. The Adversary, determined to break free of the bounds of Solomon's Seal, tempts mortals with promises of power and wealth. Hollow though these promises may prove when measured by eternity, many are seduced to its service. The Witch Hunters are what stands between the darkness and the light, even when such darkness is found in the hearts of mankind.

Cities of Mystery details eight cities, 4 in the Old World, and 4 in the New. The cities' people, notable places, history and hidden threats are revealed in detail. Each local offers a suggested campaign for Grand Masters and new rules for Grand Masters and Witch Hunter's Alike.

Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers.

You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

4 miniatures of the Cruiser, a new type of ship of class 3 with bonus when it uses its shields
3 new special weapons: Interdictor, Vortex Jump and Exo-Bomb

180171.name: Fleet Commander: 2 – Beyond the Gate

180172.name: Fleet Commander: Orbit

180173.name: Adventurous Locations I: The Broken Tower
180173.description:

Your adventurers are traveling near a forested swamp when on a nearby rise, they see the walls of a broken tower sitting in the wilderness, it’s shattered walls reaching to the sky.

Pulses quicken as the intrepid adventurers draw near, for who knows what secrets lie within the hull of the Broken Tower?

An Adventurous Location for game referees to add to their games. Stats provided for old-school style OGL games and for DwD Studios BareBones Fantasy.

180174.name: Adventurous Locations II: The Crypt of Verant Giantsbane
180174.description:
From publisher blurb:

Overgrown ruins within the forest conceal the resting place of the great hero, Verant Giantsbane. There have been reports of restless dead and missing people in the region. The Crypt of a Hero, Undead, Missing Kids and Old People. . . Fortune and Glory! Do you need anything more? Light your lanterns and explore the crypt.

Welcome to Character Options: Witches. In this document we present ten new patron themes to use for your witch characters. Also since patrons are such an important choice for a witch it is unusual that this choice is not reflected in their main class feature, the witch’s hex. Patron hexes are special hexes that can only be taken by followers of a specific type of patron. We present patron hexes for all ten of our new patrons. Finally we present three new witch archetypes; the Devoted Witch is of a more religious bent, the Green Witch has a closer tie to nature and the Storyteller gains bardic performance.

Need an adventure that is ready to play, including pregens?

Travel north to the abandoned mountain temple known as Giant’s Perch. There you will help recover a rare plant whose extract my help stem the tide of an ancient undead evil.

But this won't be no daisy picking excursion.

Here’s what you get for your gold pieces:

a base town and local personalities (NPC’s)
new monsters (including the Octobat!)
pregenerated player characters (PC’s)
map images for use with a Virtual Tabletop
printable large maps (color and black and white)
printable tokens

From publisher blurb:

This product is a little booklet of a Traveller compatible space station. The station introduced in this installment of the series is a moderately sized fighter base station for system defense purposes.

The PDF contains the background of the station, statistics for it and its crew. In addition the document contains an image depicting the station. This PDF contains NO deckplan!

180179.name: Siggil
180179.description:
Siggils are magical seals where spirits are locked. The players must untie a Siggil and capture the spirits that are escaping!

Siggil is a card game for 1 to 4 players that contains seven families of seven cards numbered 1 to 7 and seven unique spirits cards, each associated with a family and a number. All cards are thoroughly shuffled, including spirits, then placed level-by-level, overlapping face down and face up, according to a simple form called a Siggil. The game includes description to build several Siggils like: The Pass, The Turtle or The Pyramids.

On his turn, a player draws a card from the Siggil and takes it in his hand. When a spirit escapes the Siggil, players can capture it by playing the right combination of cards from their hands. The winner is the first player who controls more spirits than the others at the end of the game.

Siggil also includes rules for a solitary game.

180180.name: Zothique: Gaming on the Lost Continent
180180.description:
From the introduction

This document is for game masters using the D20 System of roleplay gaming. It is intended as an aid to those who wish to create their own game world based on the stories in Clark Ashton Smith’s Zothique cycle.

A pick-up and delivery game based on Atlantic Trade in the 17th Century. The object of the game is to ship cargo from port to port in exchange for victory points; the first to 25 victory points wins.

During your turn you draw 2 cards from the deck, move each of your ships a maximum of 5 spaces, and play any number of cards. You can also load or unload cargo at port. When the turn ends battles are resolved with a roll of the dice.

There are many different types of cards in the deck to keep the game fun and exciting. Wind cards allow you to increase ship movement. Battle cards increase your odds in battle, or can be used to escape battle altogether. There are also wild cards which allow you to adjust the value of the cargo, or summon pirates to attack an opponent.

180182.name: The Sentinels
180182.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the Sentinels!

The Sentinels Agenda is a program overseen by CASTLE (the "Committee of Advanced Strategy, Technology, and Law Enforcement") to bring together extraordinary individuals to deal with impossible problems. It's had a revolving membership over the years, but began with a core of two CASTLE agents, Knight Ranger (a PL 9 expert archer), and Red Widow (a PL 9 covert agent).

180183.name: The Perfect Caper
180183.description:
From the text:

A roleplaying poem for 3-5 players.

Each player takes the role of a criminal executing the perfect score.

180184.name: When the Giant Comes
180184.description:
Part of Dave Cleaver's 30 Roleplaying Shorts in 30 Days.

From the text:

In When the Giant Comes, you will play villagers that must protect their village from a giant. You will need 3-5 people, a blank piece of paper, and one 6-sided die.

180185.description:
The main idea is, NATO devolves toward operational ineffectiveness and, on that basis, old Vladimir decides to try for the big solution to get back all the former Soviet Union's western borderlands.

In designing the game (already done despite the long wait for its publication), I came up with a new system that emphasizes the following perspective: today's First World militaries are part way through a systemic transformation broadly comparable to the one they went through during the 1930s.

The issue in the 30s was how to integrate mechanization into what otherwise still remained foot-slogging, horse-drawn armies. The debate centered around how much horse cavalry to keep mixed in with the tanks, trucks and other combat vehicles. The idea was the large mass of unmotorized units would form a "base of maneuver" from which the relatively more scarce -- but elite -- moto-mech units would operate.

Of course, by the war's midpoint all that had been settled. The question had come to center on determining the optimal mix of tracked and wheeled vehicles, etc.

Today, we're witnessing a similar transformation in that the former moto-mech elite has, in effect, taken on the role of the previous era's foot-sloggers and horse cavalry: they're now the new "base of maneuver" element, holding the line while, evolving atop and past them, is the new elite: the special forces, which are themselves increasingly robot-equipped.

Given that the cost and social advantages involved in deploying small elites rather than the mass mechanized armies of the previous era (the draft isn't going to come back), I see us now at about the 1938-equivalent in terms of the new transition.

Aside from that, another characteristic is more and more of the First World's armies combat experience is increasingly contained within the personnel of the SoF. That, of course, further enhances their relative combat power.

To smoothly model all that, I've come up a system I've titled the "Big And Dumb Armies Super System" (BADASS). I'll be using it again.

This design will be appearing in Modern War issue number 29 (May-June 2017).
180185.name: Putin's War

180186.name: Tech Support
180186.description:
A roleplaying poem for 2 or more players.

From the text:

This is just for fun: it's a fairly silly nano-game that you can play as a group, but it works just as well as a time-filler for two players.

The premise is simple: one player takes on the role of someone employed in tech support, while everybody else takes it in turn to call them with problems. The twist is that the callers can be calling up for the support they need in doing anything and the call-taker will help them, no matter what.

180187.name: A Trip Through Time Seen Through The Eyes of a Fir Tree
rpg: A Trip Through Time Seen Through The Eyes of a Fir Tree
180187.description: A slow, immersive roleplaying poem about trees telling a story. Involves building a tower of dice as you play.

180188.name: Central City: Heroes
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Game Pit: Episode 64 - Automobiles and more….
180188.description:
Central City: Heroes is a cooperative board game for 1-4 players. Each player takes on the role of a unique Superhero with their own unique powers. Players work together to battle minions, complete missions, recruit other heroes, and unlock their upgrade cards. This will all lead up to the final showdown with the Superhero's Nemesis. The Players must complete five missions and defeat the Nemesis in order to win the game. Heroes will accomplish these things by moving around and exploring Central City.

The board consists of 16 interchangeable location hex tiles that make up Central City. Every time you play the city itself will change.

Players will begin by creating their characters. To do so they will get a Superhero Player Board, a Super Power Card and a Secret Identity Card. Combining the Hero Board with the Super Power Card will create the Player's Hero Persona. With 6 Player Characters and 12 Super Power Cards, there are 72 different Hero Personas in the Central City: Heroes Core Set. The Players will also receive their own Secret Identity Card which the game will be trying to force players to reveal.

Are you ready to become a guardian of Central City?

180189.name: Scary Apples to Apples Snack Pack
180189.description:
Mini game pack or expansion for Apples to Apples.

The wild card and party game that provides instant fun for four to 10 players is now scary fun! Still as easy as "comparing apples to apples" you simply open the box, deal the cards and you're ready to play! Select the card from your hand that you think best describes a card played by the judge. If the judge picks your card, you win that round. Everyone gets a chance to be the judge! Each round is filled with surprising and outrageous comparisons from a wide range of people, places, things and events. Add to your Apples to Apples Party Box or play as a standalone game. Fast moving and refreshing, Apples to Apples is perfect for any get-together with family and friends!

180190.name: Gnomes!
180190.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains two full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Gnomes! includes new racial feats, gnome character traits, and alternate racial traits for gnomes. In addition, this product features a new archetype for gnome sorcerers: the Wonderkind!

180191.description:
User summary

A standalone expansion to Tank Hunter (Jäger) 2e.

Tank Hunter is set in a fictional future where players pit their army of model tanks against each other. Each player has a small unit of various tanks from WW2, and deploy them against each other trying to defeat the other player's tanks, infantries and guns.

Commander contains more tanks, more infantry and more guns, and adds Commander cards. It can both be played as a standalone game or integrated with the base set, or Jäger.
180191.name: Tank Hunter 2e Cmdr

180192.name: Universal Adventures Infernal Invocations
180192.description:
From publisher blurb:

The tall man strode forward. Black and crimson robes hung over black mail. A heavy black mace hung at his hip. He smiled. Teeth as white as his skin glinted crimson in the flickering light of torches and braziers.

“Welcome. The flames of the Devourer await you,” he said.

Black clad guards rushed from the darkness. Ejayus drew steel. Artemis and Anora began chanting. The tall man responded in kind.

Welcome to Universal Adventures Infernal Invocations!

Universal Adventures Infernal Invocations is a set of fifty-four invocation cards, drawn from the realms of the Infernal Powers. The invocations can be used by any cleric-type characters who serve one or more infernal powers and are suitable for use with any fantasy adventure game, including Ogres and Underworlds, Swords and Savagery and future RPG’s from NRP. Each of the cards describes a invocation, including range, duration, area and the effect. The Invocation cards can be used independently or in conjunction with other Universal Adventures products. Be a plague upon the Realms of Light, blast pesky paladins, bolster the power of undead and demons, and more with Universal Adventures Infernal Invocations.

180193.description:
Milan, early 20th century, the city is in turmoil as more than 200 new buildings are rushed to being completed in time for welcoming the best minds of the planet. The 1906 Universal Exposition is approaching and, as one of the 40 exhibiting nations, you are confident that your engineers and scientists will impress the world. Who will exhibit the most impressive technological advancements? Which energy source will prevail: the majestic power of Steam or the more elegant and efficient Electricity? Can you prevail in prestige and glory against the other competing nations?

In Expo 1906, players will win by totaling more prestige points at the end of the game than their opponents. Points are awarded for completing Projects which represent historical inventions of the period. To complete a Project, a player must purchase Resources and place them in a proper combinations together with a Project in his Laboratory. This is a challenging task as Projects come in many different shapes and must fit together with their resources in an already tight space. Soon the available room in the Laboratory will reduce and players will face the puzzle solving aspect of the game.
Strategy plays an important role too: to speed up the completion of a Project players can acquire Technologies, which can either reduce the number of Resources required to complete a Project or enhance the type of actions at their disposal. This will require careful management of the available space in their Laboratory too. Also, by registering ideas at the Patents'Office players can become leader in the development of specific Resources and accumulate more prestige points when completing Projects. Setting priorities between all these actions will become critical as players rush to prepare in time for the upcoming World Exposition.
180193.name: Expo 1906

You can play Hearts, Spades, Bridge, Euchre, Cribbage, Canasta, Gin Rummy, Go Fish, Crazy Eights, Five Card Stud Poker, Blackjack, Solitaire, and Video Poker.

180195.name: X-Men: Reign of Apocalypse
180195.description:
X-Men: Reign of Apocalypse is a side-scrolling action beat 'em up with 12 distinct levels. Each level has waves of enemies plus a mutant boss who all must be defeated to progress to the next stage. Players must defeat enemies to earn points which can be spent at the end of each stage to improve the character's strength, vitality, or mutant power. Each playable character share the same basic attacks but each have a unique special ability: Wolverine has claws that excelling in close-range combat, Rogue has a charge ability, Storm controls tornado projectiles, and Cyclops has long-range optic blasts.

X-Men beat-em-up in an alternate future where Apocalypse rules. Returning from their journey in the Mojoverse, the X-Men return to the destroyed remains of their home, the X-Mansion. They soon discover that they are in an alternate universe under the control of the evil mutant, Apocalypse. The X-Men must battle their way through Apocalypse's army of Sentinels and Mutants in order to return to their universe.

The setting takes place in an alternate universe controlled by Apocalypse with backgrounds that stay true to the X-Men comics. X-mansion, Blackbird, Genosha and other familiar locations are present. The playable X-Men roster consists of: Wolverine, Cyclops, Storm, and Rogue. Each character has a different super power that give them a unique playstyle. Boss enemies include classic villains from the comics such as Blob and Magneto. X-Men from the 616 Marvel Universe, such as Colossus and Nightcrawler are also allies of Apocalypse in this alternate universe and must be defeated.

Source: Wikipedia, "X-Men: Reign of Apocalypse", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

180196.name: The Whisper of a Rose
180196.description:
User Summary

Melrose lives in a depressing future age but becomes a key player in a fantasy subcreation. She moves through this JRPG-style world, hoping to save the fantasy land that grows more real than the cruel primary world. The emphasis is on exploration, adventure, and Final Fantasy-type fights with the hope to fulfull a quest that brings her Ladybug 'Diamond' to save the world of light from darkness.

180197.name: A Hold Birodalma
180197.description:
A Hold Birodalma ("The Empire of Moon") is An almost ancient pen-and-paper RPG from Hungary, with modular board, where small cards represent the various locations, such as Towns, Swamps, Cemeteries, Caves, etc. The world's layout always changing ,depending on the players, how they going to place the terrain cards. The box contains a small Event Book, according to the specific terrain, a die roll is needed to deciede what is about to happen in that round with your character. Unfortunately, the games has a very poor design, but a uniqe charm as well, if you're interested in retro games.

Your goal is to kill the Dark Mage in the Black Tower first. Can be played in solo, in a team, or in full competitive mode.

180198.description:
Rolling America, based on the 2014 release Rolling Japan, is a light "multiplayer solitaire" dice game. Each player has a map of the United States that's divided into fifty (abstractly represented) states, which are then bunched together into six differently colored areas.

On a turn, a player draws two regular six-sided dice from a bag and rolls them; the bag starts with seven dice, six matching the colors of the areas on the map along with a wild clear die. All players now write down each number rolled on any state of the matching color, i.e., if the blue die shows 4 and the yellow a 2, write a 4 in one blue state and a 2 in one yellow state. If the clear die is rolled, you can place this number in a state of your choice; additionally, three times per game you can choose to use a non-clear die as any color. However, neighboring states can't have numbers with a difference larger than 1; if you can't place a number without breaking this rule, then you must place an X in a state of the appropriate color. (If all the states in an area are filled, you can ignore the die or use one of your three color changes to place the number elsewhere.)

Rolling America has a few changes from Rolling Japan. The "guard" action allows you to ignore the neighboring number restriction three times during the game, and the "dupe" action allows you to use one of the active dice twice in the same region. As in real life, Alaska and Hawaii are not connected to the continental United States, so you can drop any numbers you want in those states!

After six dice have been rolled, mark one round as being complete, then return the dice to the bag and start the next round. After eight rounds the game ends, and whoever has the fewest Xs on their map wins.

180199.description:
Colonial Twilight takes 1 to 2 players into the tangled web of military and political actions comprising the French-Algerian war of 1954-62.

The insurgent Front de Liberation Nationale (FLN), starting from modest beginnings, must build massive and enduring popular support for its cause, and organize to assume power when Algeria finally gains its independence. The Government, representing both the colonial authorities and France’s military leadership, must engage the nationalist insurgency decisively while striving to preserve the support and commitment of the civilian government and society. Players will enter the “heart of darkness” as they use military, political, and economic actions and exploit events to build and maneuver forces to influence or control the population or otherwise achieve their aims along the twisting route to independence.

This latest instalment in GMT’s popular COIN Series system is the first to be designed for two players. You must consider carefully just what you want to do, and how much of it, before the initiative will slip from your fingers. Also, a full solitaire system enables solo players to test their skill against a devious game-run enemy.

From the Casbah to the Aures, are you ready to run the gauntlet?

180200.name: Dwarf Feats
180200.description:
Publisher's Blurb

Dwarf Feats is our latest Mythic Mini devoted to the dour, doughty, and deadly diehards of fantasy: dwarves! This product contains 11 mythic feats for the truly hardcore (and hard-headed) hero, from Brewmaster and Toxic Recovery to Cloven Helm and Goblin Cleaver!
Mythic Minis are short, inexpensive products designed to take one rules concept or set of Pathfinder RPG rules and bring them to you in a new way for the mythic rules, including converting existing rules as well as introducing entirely new rule options. Created by the same designers that helped bring you the official mythic rules, Mythic Minis skip the fluff and give you all crunch, all the time.

Nobody knows mythic like Legendary Games, and whether it's new mythic feats, class abilities, path abilities, magic items, or anything else, every Mythic Mini delivers a delicious dollop of dazzling design that will fill out your mythic experience one slice at a time. Check for a new Mythic Mini every Monday to make your game just a little more Legendary!

180201.name: Marvel Avengers Assemble: Slide Strike Battle Game
180201.description:
From Back of the Box:

"Go head-to-head in an exciting game of concealed identities and cunning strategy! Slide your team across the battlefield for a surprise attack! Reveal which bero or villan you're attacking with... then find out whl they're up against! Every character combo yields different outcome. Out-last your opponent to win!"

6 characters on each side, mirrored team builds. (12 total)
23 Grey Spacer Tiles create a field similar to Think Fun's Rush Hour puzzle game.
This is Stratego with more restrictive/defined movement, and character powers.
1x d6 (3,4,5,6,7,8 faced)

180202.name: Southern Rails
180202.description:
Southern Rails — one of three titles in Winsome Games 2015 Essen Set — is played on a map of the Southeast United States and is similar in style to many of the stock-based, cube-rail games released by Winsome Games since 2007.

The game starts with the players spending two rounds selecting stocks from among six available companies. Each turn, a player must place a track cube from one of the companies in which he has stock. Once the tenth cube of a company is placed, the players score. Scores are based on the rail lines and awarded to players that own stock in the lines that meet certain criteria. Player order is reassigned and players get to select an additional stock. Players once again start placing cubes. This is repeated until the fourth scoring round, after which the game ends. The player with the most points wins.

180203.description: Age of Steam Expansion: New England, an expansion for Age of Steam that's part of the Winsome Games 2015 Essen set, is a two player map for Age of Steam. In this game, unfinished track sections may not be built. In addition, at the end of the game, players score 1 VP for each $20.
180203.name: Age of Steam Expansion: New England

180204.description: 1857 — one of three titles in Winsome Games 2015 Essen Set — is set in Argentina and requires some of the components from 1830 in order to play. There are 8 companies in the game with 6 unique privates. Several of these privates continue to function if owned by a railroad when they would normally close and removed from the game. Companies also have stations on the board from the beginning of the game that block passage through those locations, even before the company floats.

180205.name: Trans-Siberian Railroad
180205.description:
Trans-Siberian Railroad — one of three titles in Winsome Games 2015 Essen Set — shares some similarities with older Winsome titles where the rail network is already printed on the board and individual companies purchase the links that are printed.

There are six total companies in the game, though only four are available at the beginning. Once the initial stocks are auctioned, players take turns buying stock, building rails, or passing. Some actions cause the timing cube to move which in turns leads to dividend phases which is one of the end of game triggers. The two other companies become available during a later phase shift. The player with the most money at the end of the game wins.

180207.name: Chrome Flesh
180207.description:
From the back of the book:

EDGE OF THE POSSIBLE

Shadowrunners cannot be limited by what their bodies can—or cannot—do. They have to do more, stretch farther, surpass any limits, and accomplish the impossible. Some runners can rely on magic; for everyone else, there are augmentations. From shiny chrome that makes your body into a humanoid semitruck to genetech that alters you at the most fundamental level to drugs and chemicals that give you a quick and dirty boost, Chrome Flesh provides dozens of new ways to alter Shadowrun characters and make them better, stronger, faster, and altogether readier to kick ass and take names on the streets.

Along with the gear and a compiled table of all cyberware, bioware, genetech, and nanotech currently available in Shadowrun, Fifth Edition, Chrome Flesh covers how runners break down and what resources can help fix them up, and where augmentation tech might go in the future. It’s paydata every shadowrunner needs if they want to overcome everything the Sixth World is going to throw at them.

Chrome Flesh is for use with Shadowrun, Fifth Edition.

180208.name: Witkacy
180208.description:
In Witkacy, you are going to restore copies of paintings by the famous polish artist Witkacy. In order to get the most of them, you need to look for the right fragments. The player who has the most copies restored wins, but at the same time, popular paintings are more valuable than others.

Each player starts with one double-sided card and puts it in front of themselves as the start of their collection. In each round players take one card, may play a special action, then add the card to their collection. Each card is divided in three segments and shows only part of a painting — at least one quarter of it, half at most.

The aim of the game is to choose which parts of the cards to connect and when and how use the special one-time actions.

180210.description:
Checkers and chess are classics, but where is the modern twist? tak•tak is today's new two-player strategy board game. tak•tak has simple rules like checkers and the layered strategies of chess. The game uses the familiar grid and 'battlefield' board to allow players to "advance, stack, and attack" chips of matching colors and numbers. While learning to play is quick and easy, it takes a real strategist to win.

How does it play?
Players take turns moving their pieces across the board one space at a time, either straight ahead or diagonally, into the gray "war zone" with the goal of reaching the other player's safe zone.

Stack & Attack
While moving across the board, players may stack any of their pieces of the same number or color. These stacks can now move as one piece to get across the board faster. When players meet in the war zone they may attack their opponent's pieces by stacking on any that are the same color or number and absorb them into their own forward moving stack.

How to win?
Advance the highest numeric value of chips into your opponents safe zone and win tak•tak!
180210.name: tak•tak

180211.name: Apollo XIII
boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 012 – Essen 2015 Highlights Show
180211.description:
Apollo XIII tells the whole story of that mission through a card-driven game system. Follow the story and face all of the disasters that plagued that mission!

To ensure the survival of the crew and get them back to Earth, you need to work together in this cooperative game to manage each setback that the mission faces. Your team must coordinate their actions, or you will not finish the mission! Of course, if you want an even bigger challenge, you can try the optional "competitive mode" to see who is the best mission coordinator!

180212.name: Dr. Green
180212.description:
User Summary

Dr.Green awakes to find his home under attack. A young child uncovering his past he finds the forest he grew up in was under siege by workers.

180215.name: Bad Moon Rising
180215.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to Bad Moon Rising, the second installment of Iron Kingdoms Adventures. Iron Kingdoms Adventures is a series of full-length scenarios for use with the award winning Iron Kingdoms Full Metal Fantasy Roleplaying Game.

Each installment of Iron Kingdoms Adventures contains everything a Game Master will need to run a complete story.

These adventures take place across the Iron Kingdoms, from the depths of the savage wilderness to the soot-covered streets of western Immoren’s major cities. Iron Kingdoms Adventures are self-contained scenarios, but each provides a number of hooks for getting characters involved in the adventure and suggestions for keeping the adventure goingafter the final scene.

Bad Moon Rising is an Iron Kingdoms Adventures scenario for four or five Hero-level characters with 10–20 XP each. It is designed to be played over five sessions, each of which covers roughly one day and one night, but the Game Master can modify this as time and events require.

180216.name: AutoHARP Architect
180216.description:
From publisher blurb:

AutoHARP Architect is an application with which you can customize already existing databases for HARP Fantasy and HARP SF or create your own customized database for either system for use in AutoHARP. AutoHARP Architect is currently supported under Windows 7, 8 and 8.1 as well as Ubuntu 12 and higher. Architect currently supports information for HARP Fantasy, Martial Law, College of Magics and HARP SF. It currently does not support information for HARP SF Xtreme.

The software works under Windows and most Linux distributions. Use the exe files for Windows and the jar files for Windows or Linux - note the jar files require the Java Runtime Environment. Note that updated versions of the executable are available via the developer's Sourceforge page.

180217.name: Fighta Klub
180217.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fighta Klub is the sixth book (of seven) in The Uncommon Commoners campaign series. In this semi-epic campaign, the uncommon commoners will fulfill their destiny. Or die trying. Or both—if their destiny is to die trying.

When Beef Fist was but a young lad, the dragon Azul descended on his village bringing blue tinted death. And lightning. And lightning death. Now has come the time for Beef Fist’s beefy vengeance—Azul the Cruel shall face justice.

But to reach the dragon, Beef Fist and his fellows must punch their way through a myriad of foes, ranging from Mitey Mite to Mic Son of Ty. These epic battles will take place in a variety of arenas, including the Orctagon and the Kobold Koliseum. As always, the first rule of Fighta Klub is talk about Fighta Klub. Otherwise, no one will know when the fights are.

The Uncommon Commoners #6: Fighta Klub is a Pathfinder Role Playing Game compatible adventure. It is intended for a party of 5th-8th level uncommon commoner characters. While the adventure is written to be humorous and fairly light, it is also designed to be suitable for serious game play.

Here are some of the features of the adventure:

Detailed color maps.
Fully developed NPCs, complete with detailed descriptions, backstories and motivations. And loot.
Full statistics are included for all encounters—no need to look up monsters.
New Magic Items (Boots of Dodging, Gloves of Hitting Yourself, Champion Belt, and Lightning Rod).
New Item (Goblin Fire Mace).
New Spells (Enlarge Donkey and Reduce Donkey)
Hero Lab Portfolio (free download).
61 pages of adventure (includes maps)!
Kobold Punching.

180218.name: Those Dam Goblins!
rpg: Old School Reference and Index Compilation (OSRIC)
180218.description:
From publisher blurb:

Several months ago human settlers discovered a marsh covered valley which they knew would provide fertile crop land if only the marsh could be drained.

The settlers dammed the river and may have damned themselves! The diverted river has awoken the cliffs themselves.

Strange rumblings in the earth and smoke from the cliff tops are sure signs of trouble.

The residents of Fertile Valley need some heroes, can you save Fertile Valley before it’s too late?

180219.name: Dr. Siren (ICONS)
180219.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dr. Siren is the companion and second-in-command of the salt walter supervillain known as the Sea Monster (see WMW 5) who claims to be sent by the ocean itself to punish mankind.

The “Siren Song” of her Mind Control power is addictive, and serves to keep the Sea Monster’s minions loyal even when they are not being directly controlled. She also uses her power to ensure that she and Sea Monster have all of the ocean’s natural life forms at their disposal.

180220.name: The Call
180220.description:
From publisher blurb:

War Stories: The Call is a transmedia setting enhancement for Contagion Second Edition

The world of Contagion is a dark and terrifying place. On the surface, it looks much like the world you and I live in. Just beneath that surface, in the shadows, rages an ancient conflict between supernatural factions who all seek dominion over the Earth and control over the souls of humanity. Supernatural creatures stalk the night, hiding among, and sometimes hunting, humans.

The world of Contagion is also a magical place, full of wonder and power. There are those among humanity (and other races) who study ancient knowledge and learn the secrets of magic. Some use that power to fight against the darkness, acting as heroes. Others pursue magic for personal gain. Some act in service to celestial beings.

War Stories: The Call focuses on the story of three young women who plan to use a little magic to further their musical careers. The ritual they use to seek a muse’s blessing instead conjures a bona fide goddess of inspiration. Ceridwen, one of the recently released Ilu, answers the call of these young women. Ceridwen offers her aid with the young women’s performance in exchange for the means to reach out to their audience.

War Stories: The Call includes:

A 19 page setting enhancement detailing new feats for use with spellcaster characters.
Biopgraphical information and pregenerated character sheets for the four new characters featured in War Stories: The Call.
A short film/video asset to be used as an in-game prop/story aid by the Gamemaster.

180221.name: Urban Park
180221.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a 48 x 40 inch Battlemap of an Urban Park, it has Hex, Square and No Overlays, it also includes the VTT files for online play.

“You show me the money and the meteorite is yours. You want me to open the case to see the rock? I’m not sure we should do that. ” —Geologist Andrew Perkins

Urban Park is an exterior map of a triangular-shaped city park in the middle of a city with a factory to the northwest.

Urban Park is intended for use in modern or near future science fiction games.

Adventure idea for this map:

Meteor for Sale: The urban park was once one of the most beautiful spots in the entire city. Now factories pollute the air and imposing skyscrapers loom over the park making it seem small in comparison. The ancient park is now used by the criminal elements in town for drug deals and other nefarious negotiations.

A geologist named Andrew recently found a meteorite in a small crater near his house. He has studied the rock and believes it has an element of alien origin inside. Being poor, he has decided to sell the meteor to one of the CEOs of the factories in town.

The CEO and Andrew meet in the Urban Park at night. The CEO shows him the cash in a briefcase and demands to see the rock. The geologist opens the containment case reluctantly. The once whole meteor now has a crack in it from transporting it over a long distance that reveals a green glow. The radioactivity of the rock causes many effects in the park. Humans that come in contact with the rock spontaneously combust in a conflagration of green flame, devolve into apes, or remain human with super powers given by the rock. Animals and insects in the park grow gigantic (think giant pigeons and giant ants).

Andrew devolves into a giant ape and attacks the CEO. When he instinctively moves his hands to block, a barrier comes up that blocks the blow. The CEO’s men immolate in green fire. The CEO uses his newfound powers to knock out the changed Andrew.

The player characters can be police or detectives monitoring the park for criminal activities at night. They could also be innocent bystanders such as bums squatting in the park, bicyclists and drivers passing the park, factory or office workers leaving for home after work, etc. The group is given super powers by the meteorite but have to deal with the various threats in the Urban Park also created by the meteor’s radioactivity. The CEO grabs the briefcase and containment case and attempts to get away.
